loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Mr. Manuel P., 65 years of age, is happily married to Macaria. They live comfortably at Looc Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena. Fishing and fish vending were their means of survival even before they joined Paglaum and became Everlasting A Center members. Raising their 8 children has been quite a challenge, with their day-to-day experience at sea and retailing in the neighborhood.

Manuel and Macaria now cuddle their “apo” (grandchildren) but never get tired of continuing their everyday undertakings.

According to Manuel, fishing is the life of his family and he will grow old with it. His humble aspiration is to simply have a daily income to support their needs and basic necessities, nothing more, he told us with a smile.

loans.use: To buy an additional fish net and finance buying and re-sale of fish

location.town: Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Mrs. Chraeng Yang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people who all live in Roka Village in Kandal Province make up this village bank loan; all of the members will use the loan proceeds for different purposes. Mrs. Chraeng Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since this current business is going well, she wants to expand it and so is seeking a loan to add more grocery products to her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Uoch T., helps her in the current business. Mrs. Chraeng Y. is 61 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory.

One of the members in this village bank loan is an end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. This client is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add more grocery products to her inventory.

loans.name: Sokleang's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of twenty people, is based in the Roka Village of Kandal Province. Mr. Sokleang H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He and his wife own a small grocery store in the local market. His business has many customers with many demands. To fill these demands, Mr. Sokleang H. is requesting a loan to buy more grocery products for his inventory. He is 35 years old and the father of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, four are attending the local school, and the youngest is only five years old.

This is a village bank loan consisting mostly of end-of-term loans. Eight members of this village bank have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on KIVA.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for his inventory.

loans.name: Mierna

texts.en:
Mierna D., 52, resides at Looc Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. Blessed with 3 children, they help one another to save their fishing business. Seafood vending is also a big help for added income. They bring their catch to Oroquieta market.

Mierna is considered a Member in Good Standing, having reached her fourth loan. She hopes to expand her business with a loan of PHP 7,000. Faced with various challenges, they are assured of Paglaum MPC’s help. They are fond of the cooperative’s various programs and services, micro-entrepreneurship training among others.

Mierna never considers herself too old to strive for a better living. With her children and Paglaum MPC, she dreams of escalating her business and aspires to have her children have individual business as well.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net and accessories

location.town: Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Mrs. Sreang Seum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of nine members, is located in the Thmor Da village in Kampong Cham Province. The loan will be used for many different purposes. Mrs. Sreang S. has been selected by the members as the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Keit Soer, is a fisherman. Mrs. Sreang S. is requesting a loan to buy fishnets to support her husband's business. She is 33 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, three are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

This is a village bank consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on KIVA.

loans.use: To purchase fishnets to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Khy

texts.en: Mrs. Khy C. is  46 years old and lives in the Kradass Kor village in the Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Yorn Yin, are farmers who own a small piece of land and cultivate rice for a living. The plantation has become infertile which is lowering the crop yield. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Khy C. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make it more productive. Mrs. Khy C. has four children, two of whom work in a garment factory and the remaining two attend the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Seang Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Seang Heng C. is a villager in the Morn Hoer village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a Khmer noodle seller but earns a minimal income. In order to improve her living conditions, Seang Heng has decided to request a loan to buy piglets and pig feed to begin a pig breeding business.  Mrs. Seang Heng C. is a 51 year old widow and the mother of one child.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed to begin a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Mrs. Thon U. is a 44 year old married woman that lives in the Soe Sein village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land and cultivate rice for a living.  Mrs. Thon U. has decided to request a loan to add to her savings for expanding her rice farm. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She has three children, one of whom is a jewelry repairer, another  is employed in a garment factory and the remaining one is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to expand her rice farm.

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en: Mrs. Sokchea C. is a 38-year-old widow and lives in the Trapaing Thmor village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a duck breeder. Since her business is doing well, she would like to expand and is now requesting a loan to buy more ducks and ducklings. She hopes the expansion of her business will increase her income and improve her living conditions. She has three children, one of whom is a driver for a company and the two others attend the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and ducklings to expand her business.

loans.name: Hiek

texts.en: Mrs. Hiek P. is a villager in the Trapaing Lech village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice on it to earn a living. In addition to growing rice, she sells chickens. The chicken business is doing very well and she would like to expand by purchasing more chickens with the loan she is now requesting. She is a 49 year old widow with five children; one child sells chickens, three are laborers and the youngest is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita P. is active and busy cultivating her vegetable garden in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. At the age of 48 and with 6 lovely children, her eagerness to provide for her family through gardening is amazing. Juanita's husband raises cows and chickens and pastures goats in their own backyard. He also does fishing for more income.

They bring their produce to the market and sometimes sell it to people in their neighborhood. Juanita realizes that their main problem, being on their own, is their need for additional capital. That made her decide to reach out to Paglaum MPC for a loan of PHP 15,000.

Juanita hopes some day to own a fishing boat and build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer for her garden & fishing net and accessories

loans.name: Hae

texts.en: Mrs. Hae M. is 29 years old and lives in Trapaing Trapaing village in the Kampong Cham Province. Hae is a duck breeder. Her business is doing well and she would like to buy more ducks and duck feed with the requested loan. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Tan Chep, is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. Mrs. Hae M. has two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and duck feed to expand her breeding business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase beauty products and materials for a small beauty parlor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow their field.

loans.name: Thourk

texts.en: Mrs. Thourk O. is a villager in Kradass Khor village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice for a living. She earns a small amount of revenue from rice sales and would like to increase her income and has decided to request a loan to buy additional land to cultivate more rice. Her husband, Mr. Naov Liv, is a palm juice collector. Mrs. Thourk O. is 49 years old and the mother of four children who are all enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy an additonal piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Chhai Leang

texts.en: Mrs. Chhai Leang T. was born in 1971 and now lives in Trapaing village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a pig breeder. Her business is doing well and she would like to expand it with a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Kray Chan Sovantha, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. Mrs. Chhai Leang T. is a mother of three children, one of whom is a duck breeder while the others help their parents. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Mr. Yorn A. is a villager in Prey Char Krouv village in the Kampong Cham Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Ou Yoeurn, are farmers who own a piece of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. The plantation has a field with infertile soil which is lowering the crop yield. In order to resolve this problem, Mr. Yorn A. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to support his field and make his crop more productive. Mr. Yorn A. is 68 years old and the father of a child who is a tailor. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em N. was born in 1964 and lives in Kradass Khor village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Mao Mey, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. She is requesting a loan to increase revenue by purchasing more land to cultivate rice. She has a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purcahse a plot of land to cultivate more rice.

loans.name: Nom

texts.en: Mrs. Nom V. was born in 1957 and now lives in Soteap village in the Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. South Phel, are farmers who own a plot of land and cultivate rice to earn a living. This is the only business supporting their family. Thus, Mrs. Nom V. decided to ask for a loan to buy five piglets and feed to start a new breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Nom V. has five children; two of whom are laborers, one is employed in a garment factory and the others attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase five piglets and feed to begin a breeding business.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Mrs. Channa H. lives in Prey Char Krouv village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have oxen to plow her field. In order to deal this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her field and to buy fertilizer to support her field. Her husband, Mr. Loav Ty, is a laborer in the rice mill. Mrs. Channa H. is 22 years old and the mother of a two-year-old child. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Saveth

texts.en: Mrs. Saveth S. is a breeder who raises pigs and poultry in Sdouk Thom village in Kampong Cham Province. Her husband, Mr. Tim Toeung, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where they cultivate rice. To increase their rice harvest, Mrs. Saveth S. is asking for a loan to buy more land for growing rice. She is 36 years old and the mother of one young child. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more land

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny T., 46, is a grocery seller who lives in Kompong Tom Province. She is running the business from her home and now is doing very well, so she has many regular clients. Ny has six children, four of whom are students, one is married and the other daughter is a teacher. Her husband, Mr. Seur Seng, 51, makes a living breeding pigs. Ny requested a loan of 500,000 riel ($125) to buy more groceries for resale and hopes that a loan will help to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for resale

loans.name: Sokhea

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhea C., 28, is a grocery seller and also raises pigs at home. She has two children. They live in Kompong Tom Province and her husband, Mr. Chong Koul, 35, buys carving wood for sale and is also a farmer. Sokhea applied for a loan of 2,500,000 ($625) to purchase rice for sale. The loan will help their income and provide daily food for their kids.

loans.use: To purchase rice for sale

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en:
In the sleepy town of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Zoila P., 59, is managing to operate a mini-store.  She has had to struggle to overcome life’s challenges. Having 5 children to feed, with a husband who is a farmer, tilling the land is not really enough.  Zoila had the idea of setting up a mini-store as that was the only thing she could think of to make ends meet. Friendly neighbors are her most promising customers.  The store was started with minimal capital from Paglaum MPC. Zoila cares for the store as if it’s her child, and the store has sustained the family for years and she managed to invest profits in more inventory. 

Zoila is very thankful to have become a member of Paglaum MPC who believe in her capacity to run a business. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan as additional working capital.

She wishes for an education for her children and that Paglaum MPC will continue helping the community.

loans.use: purchase more bottled goods, canned goods, and other grocery items

loans.name: Jerus

texts.en:
Jerus T., 30 years old, a resident of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, operates a mini store right at home.  She takes care of her preschool-aged son and lovingly supports her husband who is a motorcycle driver.  She tells us that life is tough without a good way to earn a living.  

The initiative of having a store at home started as a hobby but later on became a serious business for the family.  Jerus realized that it’s really convenient to have the store right at their doorstep.  Having this in mind, she has applied for PHP 14,500 from Paglaum MPC to complete the structure and have a bigger space for her inventory.  Jerus is a member in good standing who has made all her repayments in a timely fashion.

Young couple that they are, Jerus and her husband dream of erecting an improved and decent home and desire to operate a real grocery store someday.

loans.use: Completion of store construction and purchasing additional stocks for her mini-store

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora T., 51, is happy tending her little store.  She has bravely raised her 3 kids alone, being widowed for more than a decade.  The store is her only means of earning a living. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales.  

Aurora stands on her own two feet to manage the running of the store.  Her children are, however, readily available to tend shop with her.  They believe that with their support, as one family they will sustain and beat the odds. Aurora has reached out to Paglaum MPC to help finance a loan of PHP 35,000 for the store.  Expanding her inventory will surely mean additional income.  

Their hand-to-mouth existence is a terrifying experience for the family.  But Aurora is a courageous mother and wishes to sustain the store, for without her store, life cannot ever taste sweet.

loans.use: Purchase more canned goods, bottled items, and rice for re-sale

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Mrs.Lyn D. P. is a resident of Talic, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one child. She was engaged in "suman"-making (a traditional Filipino rice cake) at the time she got married. Her mother-in-law is the one who owned the business. As a newly-wed couple, their family entrusted them with assisting in running the business.

The business is known to be one of Misamis Occidental’s favorite spots for traditional delicacies. A lot of prominent people in the province place orders for traditional delicacies on special occasions and give them to their visitors as a sort of "pasalubong" (homecoming treat). Some foreign visitors bring the products to Las Vegas, Japan, Hongkong, and the United States of America.

Due to the high demand for their products, the couple needs more financial assistance to produce the supply needed. One day, a customer who is also a member of Paglaum MPC told Lyn about the program and services Paglaum MPC offers. On the following day, she attended the training and became a full-pledged member. In November 2003 she received her first loan amounting to three thousand pesos only. Now she is on her 11th loan cycle, amounting to fourteen thousand nine hundred pesos.

In one way or another, the family considers that Paglaum MPC is behind their business successes. As of now, not only are the couple members but their parents are, too. Recently, the parents got a motor-vehicle loan to be used for the business.

The family's future plans for the business are to acquire machinery to be used in the operation instead of manpower, to have their own house, and send their child to school. "All of these plans are possible due to realization through the help of Paglaum MPC," Mrs.Lyn D. P. added during the interview.

loans.use: Purchase additional ingredients for making traditional Filipino rice cakes

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Mrs. Yon R. is 44 years old and makes a living selling groceries and raising pigs at home. She is the mother of three children, all in school, and they live in Kompong Tom Province. Her husband, Mr. Khon Sim, 43, is a rice farmer and he has musical instruments for rent for wedding parties and other ceremonies. He currently earns $5 a day. Yon requested a loan of 4,000,000 riel ($1000) to decorate her house and the rest to pay a house builder.

loans.use: To decorate house

loans.name: Saren

texts.en: Mrs. Saren P., 25,, is raising pigs to support her family and is also a rice farmer, which she started in 2005. She earns approximately $1.50 per day and lives in Kompong Tom Province. She is married with one child who is still young and her husband, Mr. Bao Choun, 25, makes a living purchasing chickens from other places to store and sell out to his regular customers. Saren is applying for a loan 1,000,000 riel ($250) for her husband to purchase chickens for sale. (Mrs. Saren's husband is pictured, because she was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Deth

texts.en: Mr. Deth C. is 28 years old and makes a living climbing palm trees to make palm juice. He makes over fifty liters per day and turns it in to palm sugar or palm wine to sell in font of his house. His wife, Mrs. Chaiya An, 26, is a pig raiser, has no children, and lives in Kompong Tom Province. Deth requests a loan of 700,000 riel ($175) to purchase food for pigs. The loan will help to accrue their income to support their family’s living expenses adequately.

loans.use: to purchase foods for pigs

loans.name: Mirsharif

texts.en:
A. Mirsharif is 27 years old.  He is married and has three children.  Mirsharif has a specialized education.  His specialization is engineering.  However, he went into agro-business because the salary from engineering was small, and with a small salary he has to feed his family and pay for his children’s education. 

Mirsharif works hard to cultivate his products such as potatoes, onions, carrots and other vegetables.  He works from early morning till late night hoping to have a rich harvest.  Mirsharif sells them in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality.  His work fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. 

His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and grow his business.  Today, Mirsharif is requesting a loan of 3500 Somoni for the term of 12 months to buy greater quantities of seeds and fertilizer, be better able to meet the demands of his customers who wait for him every Saturday at the market.  Let's help Mirsharif as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Mrs. Luzvilla S. is a bonafide resident of Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City, province of Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She has been a widow since 1993 and has four children. Hard work and determination are the only weapons she had at the time her husband died but she managed to send her children to school. She is the only one who supports the family through snack vending in offices, also having a part-time job at the hospital as a janitress. 

Change of governance was the cause for which she was terminated at the hospital where she worked for two years. Afterwards, she decided to have a small sari-sari store (general store) with a starting capital of two thousand pesos. In September 2001, a friend told her about Paglaum MPC: its program and services rendered to the members. She did not hesitate to join Paglaum MPC; she attended the membership seminar and became a bonafide member, too. 

From that time on, she requested loans as additional working capital for her sari-sari business.  As of now she is on her 26th loan amounting to Twenty thousand pesos. For the past loans, her good performance in repayment is highly appreciated. In such a way, she was able to send her children to school so that they have successfully finished their studies and have their respective jobs now. Lately, her daughters got married. Only one son and one daughter are still living with her. Future plans for the family are to have a decent house to live in, a bigger sari-sari store building, and adequate savings for her old age.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her store

loans.name: Hom

texts.en: Mrs. Hom U. is 25 years old. She lives in Ta Sean village in Kampong Cham Province where she sells fruit. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so Mrs. Hom U. decided to ask for a loan to bU. more fruit. Her husband, Mr. Met Mean, is a driver in a company. Mrs. Hom U. has two young children, ages 8 months and 4 years.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fruits for her customers’ demand.

loans.name: En

texts.en: Mrs. En L. is 48 years old. She lives in Kradass Khor village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhoung Chhe, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice. Since they cannot grow enough rice to support their family on their small plot, they want to expand it. Mrs. En L. is asking for a loan to buy more land to cultivate rice. She has six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory and the other four are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a plot of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Sokkha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokkha C. lives in Parna village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Lim Channy, sell shoes. The business is doing well and they want to purchase more shoes, so Mrs. Sokkha C. decided to request a loan for this purpose. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 27 years old and the mother of one young child. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Mr. Yong E. is a vice village chef in Kradass Khor village in Kampong Cham Province. His wife, Mrs. Souy Thol, is a farmer who owns a small plot of land where she cultivates rice. The plot is too small to produce enough rice to support the family well. In order to improve this, Mr. Yong E. decided to ask for a loan to buy another piece of land to cultivate rice. He is 54 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is a tailor and the other two attend the local school. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy land to cultivate rice

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mrs. Rose R., who has just married Jules, is 18 years of age and a resident of Looc Mansabay, Bajo Lopez, Jaena. Before they decided to tie the knot, they already had a little fishing business from which to earn a meager income. With the challenges of living as a young couple, they have a pump boat for an easier catch. However, they have realized that it is better to have a small sailboat so that they can fish even if it's low tide.

Both of them manage their business well and they work in tandem to sell their catch at the nearest market. Sometimes wholesale buyers from other towns and cities come to buy their fish. Out of their savings, they welcome the idea of building a small concrete house as their humble home. They are assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital.

Full of hope, Rose wants to own numbers of pump boats and sailboats for fishing and smiles at the thought of seeing their children waving their diplomas one day.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish nets and finance a small sailboat

location.town: Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Mohammad Karim

texts.en:
M. Karim was educated as an engineer and served for a long time in the Afghanistan ministry of Agriculture. He is an honest man in his work. M. Karim has 3 children; they are married and live together with Karim. They have a house and they live in the first floor. A few months ago they started to build the second floor but they now face some economical problems and so he wants to take a loan.

Therefore, he requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghans in the term of 18 months to complete his stock and start working again on his house to build the second floor and solve his problem.

M. Karim is very happy with the loan process in this country. He would like to mention that because of such a great program in Afghanistan, it could really solve his problem. Without this loan it would be impossible to start building his house. He would like to thank those that help with the loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to complete his stock

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en: Mrs.Thuch S. is 45 years old and a widow who resides with her niece in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She has worked, selling grocery to earn a living since 2003. She is able to make an income of US$5 a day. Thuch is asking a loan of US$1200 to invest in her business. She will spend US$300 to increase her inventory of groceries, US$500 to construct a wall around her house and US$400 to build a new bathroom.

loans.use: Purchase additional groceries, construct a wall and bathroom.

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Mrs. Va S. is 24 years old and is married with one child. She lives with her husband and young child and in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She works in security and earns US$2.5 a day. Her husband, Korn Saraket is 26 years old and operates a motorbike-taxi. He is able to earn US$4 a day.  

Mrs. Va S. is requesting a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband so that they can start owning and operating a motor-taxi service. (Her husband is pictured)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed is a 43 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Saeed has worked as a taxi driver since 1995. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase an engine for his taxi. This is the second time that he requested a loan; he has always paid on schedule. 
Saeed is known for his good relationship with his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. His future plan is to change his car, improve his financial situation and expand his business.

loans.use: Saeed needs the loan to purchase an engine for his car

loans.name: Lean

texts.en:
Mrs. Lean R. is 26 years old, married and lives with her two young children in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She makes an income making and selling cakes for which she earns less than US$3 a day. Her husband owns a business renting music equipment in the local area and earns US$5 a day. At present the couple still live with their parents. 

Lean R. is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase a trailer to transport music rental equipment.
(Husband is pictured)

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to transport rental equipment

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 43-year-old man who lives in Saida (in southern Lebanon) with his wife and their four children. For many years now, Mohamed has been in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. Mohamed is known for the high quality of his vegetables and fruits, and also for his tireless work ethic. Indeed, despite the fact that there are many vegetable/fruit sellers in his area, he has separated himself from the pack and has done very well with his business. 

He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 via A. Majmoua in order to purchase some olives and herbs. This is the fourth loan cycle for Mohamed in his micro-finance endeavors. In the future, he plans to purchase a pickup truck for his work.

loans.use: To expand his inventory by purchasing olives and herbs

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yem L. is 27 years old, married and lives with her child in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She owns a grocery store, earning US$3 a day. Her husband works as a rice miller and earns an income of about US$8 a day. 
Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. 
Yem L. is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase additional rice and also increase her grocery store's inventory. They will purchase rice and remove the husk then resell it, making a profit. She is confident that this is a sound business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies of rice and general grocery inventory.

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.en: Pierette S. was born in 1976 in Agonlin and married Benjamin Kpamegan, a gardener and refrigerator repairman.  They have four children in school.  Pierette has been in the business of selling coal for four years and paid off her first loan.  With this loan, she will solidify her client base by continuing to supply necessary fuels.  She is asking for a loan of 120,000 franc CFA ($250 US).

loans.use: To purchase 12 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Seung

texts.en:
Mrs. Seung S. is 34 years old, married and lives with her two children in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She operates a grocery store, earning an income of about US$3 each day. Her husband is a taxi-driver and earns US$10 each day. 
Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. 
Seung S. is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase additional grocery items for resale. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase additional grocery items for resale

loans.name: Khin

texts.en:
Mrs. Khin R., 41, is wedding decorator; she decorates customers' houses for wedding parties, ceremonies, and other special festival. She is married to Mr. Yeang Ros, 38, who raises pigs in their home. They have no children. The couple lives in Kompong Tom Province.

Khin works hard to satisfy her customers. She decided to ask a loan of 2,800,000 riel ($700) to purchase decorator materials. The loan will help this modern business.

loans.use: To purchase decorator materials

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng O. is 38 years old, married and resides with her husband in Battambong, Cambodia. The couple have three school aged children.  She works with her husband selling groceries from her home, and is able to earn an income of US$9 a day. Cheng started selling groceries in 2002.

Cheng O. would like to take out a loan of US$1100 to increase her grocery inventory and the remainder of the loan will be used to purchase a motorbike to transport products from market to home.

loans.use: Increase grocery store inventory and purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol P. is 47 years old and a widow. She lives with her three children in the Battambong province, Cambodia. In 2000, to earn a living, she started selling groceries around the school campus. Thol  is able to earn US$5 a day. Her three children attend the school and always help her during their spare time. She said that each month her family spends an average,  US$60 on food , US$5 on utilities, US$20 on children's education and US$10 on transportation.

Thol P. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to increase her supply of groceries to meet her client’s needs. (The oldest daughter is pictured as Thold P. was not available)

loans.use: Purchase an increased supply of groceries

loans.name: Séraphine

texts.en:
Séraphine H. is married to Bienvenu Magnonnou, a motorcycle taxi driver, and has one child in school. She was born in 1982 in Adja, and she has sold fruit and cookies for the last 2 years. She has lived in Cadjehoun on the outskirts of Cotonou for six years and seen considerable growth in her business. She would use a loan in order to purchase stock of fruit and cookies.

Mariée à Magnonnou Bienvenu chauffeur taxi moto et mère d’un enfant scolarisé, dame H. est née vers 1982 à Adja. Elle est dans cette activité de vente de fruits et de biscuits depuis 02 ans. Elle réside à Cadjehoun depuis 06 ans et voyant la croissance de son activité et voulant satisfaire sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de 100000 f CFA.

loans.use: To purchase 10 cartons of cookies and bags of fruit.

loans.name: Danch

texts.en:
Danch S. is 24 years old, married and operates a motor-taxi service around the market near his house. He earns on average US$3 a day. His wife, Chen Mala is 18 years old. She operates a beauty salon from their home and also designs and makes wedding cloths. The couple takes care of Chen's mother. 

Danch S. is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a newer motorbike to operate his motor-taxi service and the rest will be used for utility expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Hon

texts.en:
Hon H. is 38 years old, married and lives with her three children in the city of Batambong, in Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She operates a grocery store, earning an income of about US$5 a day. Her  husband is ill and must stay at home. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. 
Hon H. is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase additional groceries to meet her customer's demand. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living. (Photo is of Hon H.'s husband as she was not available)

loans.use: Purchase additional supplies of groceries

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.ru: Якубова Гулчахон живет в Варзобском районе. Замужем , имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Работает в мясном ларьке. У них общий бизнес с мужем. В его задачи входит покупать бычков и резать их.А она торгует. Они хотят увеличить товарооборот и купить бычка. Таким образом они обеспечат население своего кишлака мясом. Погасить кредит смогут в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Guljahon Y. lives in the Varzob District. She is married and has three children. She completed secondary school. She and her husband run a butcher shop. He is in charge of buying and butchering steers and she does the sales. They would like to increase sales and buy a bull calf. This allows them to provide town residents with meat. The loan can be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull calf

loans.name: Denise

texts.en:
Denise D. was born in 1973 in Adja and is married to a mechanic named Andre Noumon. She has three children, two of whom are in school and one who is a baby. She has sold food for the past 17 years and has lived in Cadjehoun just outside Cotonou for 20 years. After her first loan, her business grew, and she would like another loan to keep building her business.

Née vers 1973 à Adja, elle est mariée à Noumon André mécanicien auto. Mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés et un bébé, elle intervient dans la vente vivres depuis 17 ans et réside à Cadjehoun depuis 20 ans. Avec le premier crédit où elle a vu son activité accroître, elle sollicite un crédit de 180000 pour satisfaire à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To purchase sacs of rice, beans, corn, and other staple foods.

loans.name: Norbutta

texts.ru: Иммомидинов Норбутта житель города Яван. По профессии бухгалтер. Работает в городской больнице. Кроме того имеет дехканское хозяйство, где сеет пшеницу. К сезону посева необходимо закупить семена пшеницы. Для этого нужно получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Ему 45 лет , он порядочный семьянин и имеет восьмерых детей. Живут все дружно и весело.
texts.en:
Norbutta I. lives in the city of Yavan. He is an accountant by training. He works in a city hospital, and also has a plot of land where he grows wheat. Wheat seed needs to be purchased for the planting season. He needs a 12 month loan to make the purchase. He is 45 years old, and a responsible head of a family with eight children. They live happily and cheerfully together.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat seed

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de 6 femmes (dont 5 mariées et 1 célibataire) ayant une  moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et 4 enfants et qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies  dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Elles excellent dans les activités d’achat et de vente d’habits  pour enfants, de savon, de condiments alimentaires, de fruits et de légumes. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter,  le groupe décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso à travers une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Jiguiya 2 de Médine). Il est à son 7ème  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter,   5 sacs de pomme de terre,   5 sacs de manioc, 5 caisses de banane  sur place auprès des producteurs venant des villages environnants. Elles effectuent  leurs ventes d’une façon fixe au marché et de façon ambulante dans les services au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée des femmes et des hommes.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 8 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of six women (five married and one single) with an average age of 27 and four children, and who live in large, extended traditional families in the neighborhood of Médine in the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They excel in buying and selling children’s clothing, soap, condiments, fruit and vegetables. In order to meet the demand of their ever-increasing clientele, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution through a women’s association in their neighborhood (the Association Jiguiya 2 de Médine). They are now on their 7th solidarity loan (group loan) and all previous loans were fully repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy five bags of potatoes, five bags of cassava and five cases of bananas from producers who come to Médine from neighboring villages. The women sell their produce either at a dedicated market stall or by walking around and selling for cash or credit to a clientele consisting of both men and women. The women each hope to make from this loan a monthly profit of CFA 8,000, which will be used to pay the loan interest and provide for their families’ needs. The remainder will be invested in their business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, cassava and bananas

loans.name: Jamoliddin

texts.ru: Тагоев Джамоллидин проживает вместе со своей семьей в отдом из отдаленных кишлаков города. Он женат и имеет семерых детей. Арендует землю, которую засеивает пшеницей. Он очень активно работает на своей земле. К посевному сезону планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить семена пшеницы. Если на полученный кредит купит качественные семена , он сможет получить качественный урожай и тогда он быстрее реализует товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jamoliddin T. lives in one of the remote villages with his family. He is married and has seven children. He rents land and sows it with wheat. He works very actively on his land. He plans to get a loan in time for the sowing season so he can buy wheat seeds. If he buys quality seeds on his loan he will then get a quality harvest and will be able to sell his product faster. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth T. was born on January 4, 1956 in Cotonou. She married Raymond Vodounon, a commercial agent, and lives in Cadjehoun. She has two daughters and a son, all in school, and she makes dresses and distributes wood and fuel to supplement her household income. Her first loan increased business, and now she requests another loan in order to diversify her business.

Translated from French:

Née le 04/01/1956 à Cotonou, elle est mariée à Vodounon Raymond agent commercial. Mère de 03 enfants dont 02 filles et un garçon tous scolarisés, elle est couturière et intervient aussi dans la distribution des noix d’acajou par saison depuis 02 ans et réside à Cadjehoun depuis 20 ans. Avec le premier crédit où elle a vu son activité accroître, elle sollicite un crédit de 180000 pour satisfaire à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To purchase 14 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul lives in district 9 of Kabul Afghanistan. He was in Pakistan for more than 10 years with all the members of his family. He had worked in a shop for refrigerators and other electronic materials where he had a good number of clients, but after the collapse of the Taleban in Kabul he came back and opened a shop in Kabul. For the first time his business was not good in Kabul because he didn’t have enough clients here, but now he can attract a good number of customers.

Now he requests an individual loan of 50000 Afghans for the term of 18 months to enlarge his shop and buy some necessity materials to further his business. 

He is very happy now that he has good business and can enlarge his shop. He would like to thank Kiva and AFSG for furthering this loan in Afghanistan. He plans to be a good engineer in this field and would like to continue his partnership.

loans.use: to enlarge his shop

loans.name: Odilhon

texts.ru: Хакимов Одилхон житель города Яван. Живет очень далеко от центра. Занимается животноводством уже 13 лет. обратился к нам за кредитом , для того, чтобы купить дополнительно еще одного бычка. Таким образом он увеличит поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Odilhon H. lives in Yavan, far away from the city center. He has been practicing animal husbandry for 13 years. He decided to obtain a loan to purchase an additional bull and increase livestock count. He will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Gatiba

texts.en: Gatiba (her son is pictured) is a mother of 4 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region, Kurdmahmudlu village. She was born in 1954. Seven years ago they started a cattle breeding business. Now, they need a loan to buy 2 calves to improve their cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Hadiaratou Yalcoue

texts.fr:
Madame  H. Yalcoué a 40 ans, vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et ses sept (7) enfants (4 garçons et 3 filles), à Banconi, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir tenté plusieurs d’activités sans succès, elle  opta de s’initiée à  l’activité d’achat et de vente des  pagnes Wax(tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest),  de tissus brodés,  de draps de lit et de tasses “Super” depuis  maintenant huit (8) ans. Elle mène son activité au marché de son quartier à Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clienèle grâce à la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a cinq (5) ans.  Après 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Benkadi de Banconi), elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel  et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt: 10 pièces de pagne wax, 10 complets  de tissus brodé, 10 complets de drap et 10 complets de tasse “Super”. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso au Burkina Faso auprès des grossistes sur commandes.
Elle vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes. Parallèlement à cette activité principale le commerce, elle fait la prestation de service à savoir la couture. Elle coud les habits de ses voisins du quartiers et de ses clientes ce qui lui apporte des recettes couvrant l’essentielles de ses dépenses. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. H. Yalcoué, age 40, lives in a polygamous family with her husband, co-wives, and seven children (four boys and three girls) in Banconi, one of the outlying districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having tried several kinds of work without success, she opted to become initiated eight years ago in the commerce of 'Wax' pagnes (highly prized cloth in West Africa), embroidered fabrics, bedsheets, and 'Super' basins. She works at the marketplace of her district in Sikasso where she is in high demand by her customers, thanks to the quality of her goods. To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After five solidarity loans (group loans) with a women's association of her district (Association Benkadi de Banconi), she is now on her fourth individual loan. All of the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. She intends to use this loan to buy: 10 lengths of 'Wax' pagnes, 10 sets of embroidered fabrics, 10 sets of sheets, and 10 sets of 'Super' basins. She gets her supplies in Bobo Dioulasso in Burkina Faso from wholesalers by special order. She sells her goods, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed essentially of women. Concurrent to this principal commerce, she works in the service sector, specifically dressmaking. She sews clothing for her neighbors and customers, who provide her with revenues that cover her main expenses. She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA, which will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help cover family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 'Wax' pagnes, embroidered fabrics, bedsheets, and 'Super' basins

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen N. is 43 years of age and happily married to Romulo, a resident of Macalibre Alto, Lopez Jaena. They treasure their only child who is a high school student. Romulo is a heavy equipment driver and is receiving a net salary of PHP 6,000 (about US$ 123) per month.

Before Helen married, she worked as a household helper and saved as much as possible from her earnings. Afterward she decided to stop working and ventured into the “tuba” (local coconut wine) business. She even makes and sells candles for extra money.

When she married Romulo, Helen started her "sari-sari" (small general store) with a capital of PHP 3,000. It was Paglaum who conducted a seminar about micro-finance which made her decide to ask for her 1st loan. They granted her PHP 10,000 to be used as capital for candle-making and to purchase more inventory for her "sari-sari".

Helen says that with Paglaum MPC, one will never go wrong financially. Her ambition is to build a little store of her own one day.

loans.use: capital for candle-making

loans.name: Seun

texts.en: Mr. Seun P. lives in Lvea Sor Kandal Village in Kandal Province. He owns a 2.5-hectares farm where he cultivates rice. The soil on this farm is poor, so Mr. Seun P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. His wife, Mrs. Pa Koem Yeang, is a Khmer cake seller who can make a small income to support the family. Mr. Seun P. is 47 years old and the father of eight children, three of whom are employed in different businesses and the other five attend the local school. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou Boiré a 40 ans et vit avec son époux et ses 7 enfants (2 garçons et 5 filles), à Wayerma I, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Dès son jeune âge, elle a commencé les activités économiques notamment la restauration qu’elle a apprise  auprès de sa soeur depuis maintenant 15 ans. Elle mène son activité  à Wayerma I Sikasso devant le domicile conjugal toutes les nuits où elle est beaucoup sollicitée et appréciée par une clienèle riche et variée.
Dans la souci de maintenir cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle travaille depuis 4ans. Après avoir bouclé huit prêts de groupe ( prêt solidaire)  avec une assocaition de son quartier, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce deuxième prêt, elle achetera,  40kg de poissons frais, 40kg d’haricot, 40 sachets d’Attièkè, 24 paquets de spaghetti, 20 poulets, 40kg de pomme de terre, 20kg d’haricot vert et un stock de banane plantin (Aloko). Elle achète ses marchandises sur place au grand marché de Sikasso.
Les marchandises sont vendues au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée des femmes, des jeunes (célibataires) surtout de noctambules. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Oumou Boiré is 40 years old and lives with her husband and seven children (two boys and five girls) in Wayerma I, the main town in Sikasso (the Republic of Mali’s third administrative region). From a young age she has been involved in income-generating businesses, particularly catering, which she learned from her sister 15 years ago now. She runs her business nightly in Wayerma I Sikasso, outside her marital home. She is much in demand and appreciated by a rich and varied clientele. In order to maintain this ever-growing clientele, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she has been working for four years. Having successfully repaid eight group loans (solidarity loans) with an association from her district, she is now on her second individual loan. All previous loans were fully repaid. With this second loan she will buy 40 kg of fresh fish, 40 kg of kidney beans, 40 sachets of attièkè (yam semolina), 24 packets of spaghetti, 20 chickens, 40 kg of potatoes, 20 kg of green beans and a supply of plantain bananas (aloko). She buys her merchandise locally at Sikasso’s main market. The merchandise is then sold for cash or credit to a clientele consisting of women and young (single) people, especially those who stay up very late. She expects to make a monthly profit of CFA 100,000 which will mainly be used to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, beans, bananas, fresh fish, spaghetti, yam semolina and potatoes

loans.name: Todjiddin

texts.ru: Худойкулов Тоджиддин житель города Яван. Занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин в центре района. Сам он живет в дальнем кишлаке . Бизнесом занимается уже шесть лет.Но его оборотной суммы ему не хватает для того, чтобы закупать весь ассортимент товара. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месцев.Женат и имеет семерых детей.
texts.en:
Todjiddin H. lives in the city of Yavan. He is married and has seven children. He is in a food sales business and has a retail store in the city center. He has been in this business for six years; however his profits are not enough to purchase the entire goods assortment. This is why he wants to obtain a loan and increase goods turnover. He will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Vichet

texts.en: Mr. Vichet H. was born in 1978. He lives in Trapaing Lvea village in Kandal Province. He is a construction worker who can make a small income to support his family. Since his work place is far from his house and he usually spends a lot of money on transportation, he decided to ask for a loan to add to his saving to buy a motorbike. In addition, he can use the motorbike as a taxi to earn extra income. His wife, Mrs. Sok Sorphone, is a garment factory worker. Mr. Vichet H. is 30 years old and the father of two children one of whom is enrolled in the local school but the other one is too young for school. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ershad

texts.en:
This is Ershad, 23 years old, who graduated from the 12th class and is single. After he finished school, because of some financial problems, he could not continue his studies. He started a small business of computers and computer equipment.

Ershad has five brothers; one works in a car sales shop and the others are small and study in the public school of Jalalabad city. He has own house and he want to stand on his own feet as soon as possible.

He contacted AFSG to take a 50,000 AF loan for 18 months. He pays 1500 AF per month for rent of the shop. He wants increase his income and buy some things such as laptops, desktops, and USBs. He has his own capital of 800,000 AF invested in his shop. Now he is happy with the lenders to AFSG.

loans.use: Complete his stocks

loans.name: Mrs. Sokpheng Pok Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of 20 people, is located in Ta Reab Doun Sar Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. SokpH. P. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household. Her husband, Mr. Don Narith, is a fisherman. In order to catch more fish, Mrs. SokpH. P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets. Mrs. SokpH. P. is 38 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one stays home because he is too young for school.

loans.use: To buy fishnets

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame   Oumou Traoré  a 43 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses cinq (5) enfants (1 garçon et 4 filles), à Banconi, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Dès son jeune âge, elle a commencé les activités économiques notamment le commerce d’achat et de vente d’articles divers( pagnes Wax, tissus Brodé, complets de Drap de lit et de bois de chauffe) depuis maintenant 15 ans.
Elle travaille avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 5 ans et est à son quatrième prêt indivuduel, après avoir bouclé cinq prêts de groupe ( prêt solidaire)  avec une assocaition de son quartier. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt: 10 pièces de pagne wax, 10 complets  de tissus brodé et 10 complets de drap auprès des commerçants faisant le voyage sur Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso).
Madame  Oumou Traoré vend ses marchandises au marché, sur commandes(surtout lors des cérémonies de baptèmes mariages etc)  au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée des femmes. En plus de l’activité d’achat et de vente, elle fait de la  couture qu’elle a apprise auprès d’une amie.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Oumou Traoré is 43 years old and lives in a monogamous family with her husband and five children (one boy and four girls) in Banconi, a neighborhood on the outskirts of the town of Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). From a young age she has been involved in income-generating businesses, particularly the buying and selling of miscellaneous items (wax cloth, embroidered fabric, bed linen and firewood), which she has been doing for 15 years now. She has been working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for five years and is on her fourth individual loan, having completed five group loans (solidarity loans) in conjunction with an association from her neighborhood. All previous loans were fully repaid. With this loan she intends to buy 10 pieces of wax cloth, 10 sets of embroidered fabric and 10 sets of bed linen from traders who travel from Bobo Dioulasso (in Burkina Faso). Mrs. Oumou Traoré sells her merchandise for cash or credit to a clientele consisting of women, either at the market or to order (especially for christenings and weddings, etc.). In addition to her buying and selling business, she works as a seamstress, a skill she learned from a friend. She expects to make a monthly profit of CFA 150,000 which will mainly be used to increase her working capital and reduce expenses, contribute towards the family expenses and pay the interest on the loan. The remainder will be invested in the business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wax cloth, embroidered fabric and bed linen

loans.name: Edem

texts.en: Coges, Inc. is a pharmacy that was created by Madame Edem G. and her husband in Wome, Togo.  Edem runs the shop most days, and she and her husband have two children who both attend school nearby.  Coges, Inc. is well known and respected in Wome for the quality of its products.  With this loan from Kiva, Edem hopes to go to Lomé, the Togolese capital that is approximately 130 kilometers away, to restock their shop with anti-malarial and other medications to resell in Wome.  With the profits she and her husband will earn from their increased business, they will be able to pay their childrens’ school fees and improve their quality of life.  In the picture she is the person on the right.

loans.use: To restock her shop with anti-malarial and other medications for resale.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.en: Mrs Bui Thi D. is 33 years old. She is married with three children and lives in Quang Yen Commune, Quang Xuong District, Thanh Hoa Province with her family. She joined TYM Fund in 2007. Her business is selling pork and growing rice with an average income of about 5 million VND/month. With this business, her family’s standard of living is becoming more and more stable. Bui Thi would like a loan of 9 million ($550USD) to invest in her business.

loans.use: To invest in her food business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase wheat seeds

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Do Thi S.  is 50 years old. She is married with three children, two of whom are grown. She has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2007. Her main income is raising pigs and growing rice. Her husband is a physician and his income gives the family a stable income. With an income of about 2.5 millionVND/month her family’s life is improving more and more. Do Thi would like a second loan of 6 millionVND ($375USD) to buy more pigs to raise.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise

loans.name: Mrs. Sokkhorn Rom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is for 19 people who live in Roka Village in Kandal. Mrs. Sokkhorn R. is the village bank president. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household. Her husband, Mr. Huonh Hoeurn, is a fisherman. In order to catch more fish, Mrs. Sokkhorn R. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband’s business. Mrs. Sokkhorn R. is 24 years old and the mother of two children, ages 2 and 4.
 
Four members of this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with end-of-term (EoT) loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. These loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Ngo Thi T. is 27 years old. She has been in TYM since 2006. With her first loan, she bought pigs. Now, her family's primary income is raising pigs and trading mats. With an income of about 3,5 million/month, her family’s life is becoming more and more stable. For her second loan, Ngo Thi would like to borrow 5 millionVND ($300USD) to invest in more mats.

loans.use: To invest in mats

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs. Vann P. is a villager in Svay Chuor village in Kandal province. She owns a small place where she sells rice soup in the local area. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who has a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. The soil in her field is poor so she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Mao Heng, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Vann P. is 53 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom works in a small company and the other is a seller in the local market.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sali

texts.fr:
Vivant dans la maison de son défunt époux avec ses enfants (3 garçons et 1 fille), à Mancourani Natien, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) Madame Sali C. est une veuve de 59 ans qui n’a pas fréquenté l’école comme la plupart des femmes de sa génération.
Très tôt elle s’initie aux activités génératrices de revenus, notamment l’achat et vente de poissons séchés du Sénégal communement appelé “Yayi Boyi” il y’a maintenant 20 ans.
Le Yayi Boyi est un poisson très prisé qui rentre dans la prépration des plats alimentaires en Afrique de l’Ouest. En plus de l’activité première d’achat et de vente de “Yayi Boyi”, elle mène également l’activité d’achat et de vente de l’encens.
Elle mène son activité au grand marché de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée et appréciée grâce à la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle decida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant  seulement cinq  mois et est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce premier prêt:, 4 tonnes de poissons séchés“Yayi Boyi” à Dakar (répulique du Sénégal) auprès des commerçants grossistes sur commande.
Elles effectuent ses ventes au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes (citadines et surtout des foraines) 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sali C. is a 59-year-old widow who, like many women of her generation, did not attend school. She lives in the house of her late husband with their children (three boys and one girl) in Mancourani Natien, a busy neighborhood of Sikasso (the Republic of Mali’s third administrative region). From a very young age she became involved in income-generating businesses, particularly the buying and selling of dried fish from Senegal commonly known as “yayi boyi.” She has been doing this for 20 years now. Yayi boyi is a very prized fish which is used in West African cuisine. In addition to her main business of buying and selling “yayi boyi,” she runs a business buying and selling incense. She operates out of Sikasso’s main market where she is much in demand and appreciated due to the quality of her products. To satisfy her ever-increasing clientele, she decided, just five months ago, to rejoin the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is on her first individual loan. She plans to use this first loan to buy 4 metric tons of "yayi boyi" dried fish in Dakar (Senegal) from wholesalers who sell to order. She makes her own sales for cash or on credit to a clientele made up of women (from the city and especially stall holders). She expects to make a monthly profit of CFA 100,000 which will mainly be used to increase her working capital, contribute towards the family expenses and pay the interest on the loan. The remainder will be invested in the business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried fish called “YAYI BOYI”.

loans.name: Azmat M. Ali Group

texts.en:
Azmat baji is a wife of M. A. and lives in a city named Borewala in Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house that she has been living in for the past forty years. She is the mother of seven children: five sons and two daughters. Her first three sons are auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) drivers. Her youngest son is in 5th standard. Her elder daughter is eleven years old and her younger daughter is two years old.

Azmat baji’s husband is a daily wage laborer. Azmat baji helps him meet the house expenses so they don’t feel so much burden. She sews clothes and prepares embroidered dresses. She has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to start a new business of snooker games for her husband because it’s a high demand game for children.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Afshan hussain baji and Naziran begum baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk-selling business. Safia begum baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Naseem Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to resell. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To start a snooker game business.

loans.name: Srei

texts.en: Mrs. Srei H. was born in 1965 and she lives in Preak Kasao Village in Kandal Province. She is a Khmer noodle seller. In addition, she has a small plot of land where she cultivates rice. The soil is poor, so Mrs. Srei H. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her field more productive. Her husband, Mr. Veng Sarin, is a car driver who makes a small income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi D. is 39 years old. She lives in Quang Trach Commune, Quang Xuong District, Thanh Hoa Province, with her husband and her children. She joined the TYM Fund in 2008.  Now her primary income is raising pigs and her husband is trading mats. Nguyen Thi would like a loan of 5 millionVND ($300USD) and will use part of the loan to buy more pigs and part of it to invest in more mats.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and invest in mat trading.

loans.name: Kisa

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Kisa Kasanga from Mbeya. She is single with two children, ages 3 and 6.

Kisa has been running an ice cream business since 2001. Selling ice cream is big business in Tanzania as the temperature here is HOT HOT HOT!! There is no typical type of ice cream stand in Tanzania. You will find people selling ice cream in little trolleys on the beach and along the streets, in deep freezers in convenience stores, and right inside people’s homes. However, they all offer a wide variety of delights from smoothie popsicles to chocolate dipped ice cream, some local and some brand names. No matter what or where you purchase these tasty treats, they always bring a smile and a sense of relief from the constant Tanzanian sun.

She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 6 days per week. Kisa currently earns about 134 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD to purchase a deep freezer in order to keep her ice cream cool. In the future, she plans to establish another business. Kisa thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer in order to keep her ice cream cool

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San L. is a villager in Trouy Treoung Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Nol Nan, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. They have two children who are both construction workers. Although these family members have jobs, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve this, Mrs. San L. decided to ask for a loan to buy pillars for her house. She hopes to improve her house for her family.

loans.use: To buy pillars for her house.

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.en: Mrs Dang Thi D. is 37 years old. She lives in Quang Hop Commune, Quang Xuong District, Thanh Hoa Province with her husband and two children. Her primary income is from her grocery business and scrap trading. With an income of about 6 millionVND, her family’s life is becoming more stable and they have enough money to invest in her children's education. Dang Thi would like a loan of 9 million ($550USD) to invest in her business.

loans.use: To invest in her grocery business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Mrs. Edna D., 32 years old and married, originally lived in Macalibre Alto, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. At present their family has moved to Miputak, Dipolog City and started up their "lechon" (roasted pig) business.  

As they are blessed with 5 children, their income can hardly meet the demands of everyday living. "Lechon" is well-known among Filipinos because of its delectable taste and can be served for all occasions. These are the very reasons why they took up the "lechon" business. Beating the odds like no existing clients and new to the community, the difficulty of obtaining capital is truly a mountain to survive.  And so, aside from "lechon" orders, they also cater "lechon" roasting where customers only pay for the labor.

Edna joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2005 at the Plaridel Branch and later on transferred her membership to the Dipolog Branch because of their desire to start up their own business in the city. They rented a space for PHP 3,000 monthly and crossed their fingers that their "lechon" business would be a success. Paglaum MPC serves to help them access additional capital.  Recently, they have requested PHP 14,000. 

Mrs. D. plans to acquire land for a business site and expand their "lechon" business into other areas. She also wants to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase 5 pigs and firewood

loans.name: Rasul

texts.ru: Шукуров Расул житель города Яван. Живет о своей семьей , в которой имеется шестеро детей. Как и многие жители сельской местности занимается земледелием. Уже 11 лет основным источником дохода его семьи является посев пшеницы. Для посева он решил получить кредит , чтобы закупить качественные семена пшеницы. Это поможет ему получить качественный урожай, который он частично продаст в сыром виде , а часть перемолов в муку. Погасить кредит сможет втечение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rasul S. is a resident of the city of Yavan. He lives with his family, which includes six children. As many people in rural areas do, he practices agriculture. For 11 years his family's primary source of income has been growing wheat. He decided to take out a loan f so that he can buy high quality wheat seed for sowing. This will improve the quality of his harvest, which he sells partly in the whole form and partly ground for flour. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fuel

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Hoang Thi T. is 35 years old. She has been a member of TYM since 2006. She used her first loan to buy pigs. Now her family's primary income is from growing and selling rice. With an income about 4 millionVND/month, her family has enough money to improve their quality of life. With her next loan of 6 millionVND ($375USD), Hoang Thi would like to buy more pigs for her business.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for her farming business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Mrs Nguyen Thi C. is 45 years old. She has been a client of TYM since 2007.

For her first loan, she borrowed and invested in making cakes. Now she owns a grocery shop and her family’s main income is from this business. With the income of 4 million VND (about USD$250) from this business her family’s economy is developing and getting more and more stable.

For her next loan, Mrs Nguyen Thi C. wants to borrow 9 million VND (USD$500) to buy pigs and invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy pigs and invest in her business.

loans.name: Nisaran Mahdi Hassan Group

texts.en:
Nisaran baji is a wife of M. H. and resides in a city named Borewala in Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past twelve years. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Nasiran baji’s husband works as a delivery man and delivers different items (fruits and vegetables) from one place to another on his donkey cart. Nasiran baji herself has a milk selling business. She has been selling milk for the past five years. She gets up early in the morning and gets milk from her buffalo. She transfers the milk on milk pots and sells at different milk shops. She charges $1.00 to $2.00 per kg of milk. She successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy utensils to resell. Khoushfan baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rubina baji and G. Kubra baji each want a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.
