This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
At 50 years old, Chirstine T. lives in Yenawa in Littoral county, one of the economic centers of Benin. She married Victorin Houzandji, a master bricklayer and has 5 children in school. She has lived for the past 20 years in Ahouassa, a suburb of Cotonou, where she has sold mawè (flour, the principal ingredient of the staple food of Benin) for 13 years. With her extra income she can contribute to household costs. Now on her 6th loan, she would like to buy more food stocks and will reimburse the cost in 10 months.

Translated from French:

Agée de 50 ans à Yénawa dans le département du Littoral capitale économique du Benin, dame T. Christine est mariée à Houzandji Victorin maître maçon et mère de 5 enfants et tous scolarisés. Elle réside depuis une vingtaine d’années à Ahouassa l’une des banlieues de Cotonou où elle exerce son activité de vente des condiments et de mawè (farine de maïs fermenté) depuis 13 ans. Avec son activité elle arrive à contribuer considérablement aux du foyer. Elle est à son sixième crédit pour lequel elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000fracs CFA pour faire face à ces demandes et le rembourser sur 10 mois.

loans.use: To purchase three 100 kg bags of corn, packaging, and assorted food products.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs Nguyen Thi H. is 27 years old, married, with two children. Her husband is a wounded soldier. She has been a member of TYM since 2007. Now her primary income is a grocery store. Her family also receives some income from her husband's salary, which keeps their household economy very stable. Nguyen Thi would like a loan of 9 millionVND ($550USD) to invest in her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
Mrs. Anju D. is a tailor in the town of Tangal in Lalitpur. She opened her tailoring shop 8 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like kurta sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. D. took a 6-month training course in tailoring.

Now Mrs. D. is requesting a Rs 30,000 loan to buy raw materials for her work. Mrs. D. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Mr. Sanjay Kiran D. and he makes traditional idols. She has two daughters. Both of them are studying at the secondary level.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Juma

texts.ru: Ярикулов Джума житель города Яван. Занимается животноводством уже 17 лет. Кроме этого бизнеса больше ничем не занимается. Значит  животноводство является основным источником дохода его семьи. он покупает и продает молодых бычков. Бизнес приносит неплохой доход. Теперь для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота он планирует получить кредит и закупить комбикорм. Хорошее питание даст хорошее потомство. Погасить кредитсможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Juma Y. lives in the city of Yavan. He has been raising livestock for the past 17 years. This business is the only thing he does, meaning that the livestock provide the sole source of income for his family. He buys and sells young bull calves. The business brings a fair profit. Now, in order to increase his head of cattle he decided to take out a loan for buying pre-mixed complete feed. Good nutrition will lead to good offspring. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of complete feed

loans.name: Shamim Maqbool Masih Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is a wife of M. M. and lives in a city named Borewala in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 25 years. She is the mother of two sons. Shamim baji’s husband and sons have a wood selling business. Shamim baji herself has a clothes sewing business. She has been sewing clothes for the past 15 years. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her family business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy a juicer machine to sell seasonal fruits juices. Suraiya bano baji wants a loan to buy a photocopier machine. Gulzaran baji wants a loan to buy woods to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood to resell.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en: Mrs Pham Thi Y. is 50 years old. She joined TYM  in 2007. She has two grown children who work. Her husband is a construction worker. Now she and her husband's primary income is raising and growing. With an income of about 4 millionVND/month, her family’s economy is still developing. Pham Thi would like a loan of 9 millionVND ($550USD)  to invest in raising.

loans.use: To invest in raising

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en: Mrs H. lives in Quang Long commune, Quang Xuong district, Thanh Hoa province. She is 34 years old and married, with two children. She has been a member of TYM since 2006. Her primary income is raising  pigs. Her husband is a construction worker, and their combined income makes the family economy stable. Tran Thi would like a loan of 5 millionVND ($300USD) to buy more pigs and feed.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and feed for her business

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar M.ameen Group

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar baji is a wife of M. and lives in a city named Borewala in Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 33 years. She is the mother of five sons. Her elder son is a painter of doors and windows of houses, the next son makes jewelry boxes, the next works in an army, and her younger sons are in 8th Standard. Parveen baji’s husband has a wood selling business. He has been selling wood for the past 10 years. Parveen baji herself has a thread selling business. She gets thread from old warm clothes. First she pulls the thread out from sweaters and then washes and dries it. At the end she makes a roll of that thread and sells it in shops for profit. She doesn’t care about the pain she takes in the process of thread selling because she focuses only on the profit that she wants to earn. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more warm clothes and sweaters in order to sell more thread. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Sheeman baji wants a loan to buy scrap (plastic bottles and waste papers) for her scrap business. Shakeela naz baji wants a loan to buy iron for her scrap business. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy warm clothes for thread selling.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Туракулова Шарофат проживает в районе Гиссар.Возраст 34 года, замужм и имеет троих детей. Уже 6 лет занимается торговлей. Кредит хочет получить , чтобы завезти сезонный товар. Она торгует детской и взрослой одеждой. Шарофат одна обеспечивает свою семью. Погась кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharofat T. lives in the Gissar District. She is 34 years old, married, and has three children. For the past 6 years she has worked in sales. She would like to obtain a loan in order to introduce seasonal goods. She sells children's and adult clothing. She can repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Rann Pom's Group

texts.en:
This a group loan for four borrowers. Mrs. Rann P. is 62 years old who makes a living selling used clothing in the local market and has two children, both of whom are students. She is married to Mr. Choeun Noun, 70, who helps his wife in her business. Rann needs to expand her business so she seeks a loan of $250 to buy more second-hand clothes for sale.

The other three members are:

Mrs. Srors N., 30, is selling fishes for income and she requests $250 to purchase fish for sale. Mrs. Leak S., 38, is a fish seller who seeks a loan of $250 to buy fish for sale. Mrs. Ra R. is 38 years old and makes a living selling fruits in the market. She is applying for $200 to purchase deferent kinds of fruit for sale.

The borrowers live in Slorkram Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.en:
Nathalie G. was born in Abomey on June 6, 1978 and is married to Joseph Lima, a Civil Administrator. She has two children in school. She has sold fabric and basins for the past six years, and she grew her client base with the first two loans. To further develop her business, she will be purchasing more fabric and basins.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Translated from French:

Née le 21/06/1978 à Abomey. Elle est mariée à Lima Joseph (Administrateur civile) et est mère de 02 enfants dont un scolarisé. Elle est dans la vente de tissus et de bassines depuis 06ans.Avec son premier crédit, elle a su fidéliser sa clientèle ce qui a fait accroître la demande de cette dernière. Voulant satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de 150000 f CFA.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and basins.

loans.name: Gulzaran Nawab Hussain Group

texts.en:
Gulzaran baji is a wife of N. H. and lives in a city named Borewala in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 35 years. She is the mother of seven children: five sons and two daughters. Her first three sons are involved in their father’s wood selling business. Her husband has been selling wood for the past 20 years. Her younger son has a food selling business and the youngest son is in 3rd Standard. Her daughters are also enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Gulzaran baji herself has a clothes sewing business. She has been sewing clothes for the past 10 years. She shares her income with her husband so that he is easily able to meet the household expenses. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her family business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shamim akhtar baji and Ghulam Ayesha baji and Parveen baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Maqboolan baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood to resell.

loans.name: Rasak

texts.en:
Rasak A. is a 30-year-old married man, and he is the father of 2 children. One of his children is enrolled in primary school, while his other child is too young to attend school.

To provide for his family, Rasak opened a general store in Wome, a small town located about 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. At his store, he sells a variety of items, ranging from soap and canned goods to prepaid cell phone cards. Rasak is now requesting a loan because he would like to replenish his stock and enlarge his inventory. In general, he hopes that, by increasing his commercial activity, he can better respond to the needs of his family and can continue to participate in the development of his community.

loans.use: To replenish his stock of goods and to expand his inventory

loans.name: Umarjon

texts.ru: Халимов Умарджон житель района Рудаки. Имеет высшее образование. Работает кассиром. Кроме того, занимается торговлей продуктов питания. У него магазин . Обратилс к нам за кредитом , чтобы сделать ремонт в магазине. Таким образом он улучшит условия работы , а так же привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев. Женат и имеет двоих детей.
texts.en:
Umarjon H. lives in the Rudaki region. He has a college education and works as a cashier. In addition he sells food products. He owns a store. Umarjon turned to us for a loan in order to repair his store. This will allow him to improve working conditions and to attract new customers. Umarjon can pay back the loan over 18 months. He is married and has two children.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store Repairs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar

texts.en:
Shamim Akhtar baji is 58 year old married lady. Her husband's name is M. and he has a motor bike rental business. She resides in a historical place called Yadgar that is situated in Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 30 years. Shamim baji is a mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her sons sell ready-made garments for both ladies and gents. Her daughter is 16 years old and reads in 10th Standard.

Shamim baji also has a garment selling business. She buys garments from Peshawar, which is famous for its garment collection, and then sells in different bazaars in Lahore. She has 30 years of experience in this business. She successfully repaid her five previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more garments to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy garments to resell.

loans.name: Zakia Sultana

texts.en:
Zakia sultana is a wife of M. B. and resides in Riwind, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 30 years. Zakia baji is a 53 year old lady and a mother of two sons. Her elder son is a goldsmith and her younger son has a mobile phone shop. Zakia baji’s husband has a shoe shop where he sells shoes for both ladies and gents.

Zakia baji is involved in a cloth knitting business. She knits cloth and sells it in a cloth market for good profit. She has been knitting clothes for the past 10 years. She successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy shoes for her husband’s shoe shop.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell in the shoe shop.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida baji is a 48 year old lady and a wife of S. M.. Her husband has a cardboard selling business. Rashida baji resides in Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 36 years. She is a mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her first two sons work in a factory. Her younger son is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. Her elder daughter works as a teacher in a local school and completed her education until 10th Standard. Her younger daughter is in 8th Standard.

Rashida baji is a seamstress and has been sewing cloths for the past 15 years. Everyone in the community comes to her to stitch their clothes. She successfully repaid her four previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more cardboard for her husband.

loans.use: To buy cardboard to resell.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Якубов Акбар житель житель района Рудаки. Женат и имеет двоих детей. Возраст 31 год. Уже 8 лет занимается бизнесом. Разным бизнесом он занимался все это время, но уже 2 года торгует мукой. Товар привозит из Казахстана. Бизнес прибыльный . Кроме того торговая точка , где он торгует находится в их кишлаке и население покупает муку прямо у него в магазине , не выезжая в город. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Akbar Y. lives in the Rudaki region. He is married and has two children. Akbar is 31 years old. He has been in business for 8 years. During this time he has had several businesses, but he has been selling flour for 2 years. Akbar brings his products in from Kazakhstan. The business is profitable. In addition, the sales location where he sells his products is located in a village and the residents can purchase flour at his store without having to travel to the city. Akbar would like to take out a loan to increase his inventory. He will be able to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.en:
Jocelyn G. was born in 1947 in Abomey. She is a widow who has 3 children in school. She began her business 2 years ago. She has also sold akassa (a snack that includes pate, the staple food of Benin) for the past 8 years and lived in Cadjèhoun for the past 20 years. With her first loan she grew her business, and now she would like to buy more rechargeable cards to satisfy growing demand.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Translated from French:

Née vers 1947 à Abomey, elle est veuve. Mère de 03 enfants tous scolarisés, elle mène cette activité depuis 02 ans. Elle vend également l’akassa depuis 08 ans et réside à Cadjèhoun depuis 20 ans. Avec le premier crédit où elle a vu son activité accroître, elle sollicite un crédit de 150000 pour satisfaire à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable cards for public telephones.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida baji is a wife of M. B. and lives in Riwind, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 11 years. Zubaida baji’s husband is a milk man with 21 years of experience. Zubaida baji is a mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Zubaida baji has been collecting animal waste to generate fire for cooking because gas is not available. She successfully repaid her three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s milk business.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for the milk business.

loans.name: Femmes Couturières 2 Group

texts.fr: Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres , apporter sa participation dans la luttre contre la pauvreté au sénégal, le groupement des Femmes Couturières de Yoff (http://www.sem-fund.org/yoff_fr.php) ayant bénéficié d'un premier prêt vient solliciter auprés de kiva un renouvellement de prêt. Comme les fêtes de fin d'année et de Tabaski (Aïd El Kabir) approchent, elles voudraient profiter de l'occasion pour acheter en grande quantité la matière premiére(tissus, fils, coton, laine)et coudre des vêtements qu'elles vendront à bon prix comme c'est la période des fêtes.
texts.en:
The group Women Dressmakers of Yoff (http://www.sem-fund.org/yoff_fr.php) would like to improve the living conditions of its members and contribute to the fight against poverty in Senegal. They previously received a first loan and come to Kiva to request a loan renewal. Since the end of the year holidays and Tabaski (Aïd El Kabir) are approaching, they would like to take advantage of this time to to buy large quantities of raw material (fabric, thread, cotton, wool) and sew clothing they would sell for a good price during the holidays.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for sewing

loans.name: Muqaddas

texts.en:
Muqaddas baji is 34 year old married lady and a mother of four children: three daughters and one son. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. She is a citizen of a city named Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 13 years. Muqaddas baji’s husband is a driver and drives a vehicle named “Shahzore.” He bought this vehicle on monthly installments and uses it to deliver items (fruits and vegetables) from one place to another.

Muqaddas baji has a clothes sewing business. She has been sewing clothes for the past 10 years. She successfully repaid her four previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to pay the installments of her husband’s vehicle.

loans.use: To pay the installments of vehicle named "Shahzore."

loans.name: Adjarath

texts.fr: Agée de 35 ans et née à OUAKE, dame M. Adjarath est  mariée à Harouna (Agent au port) et est mère de 03 enfants tous scolarisé. Elle est dans la vente d’huile de palme depuis 04 ans juste après son arrivée à  Cadjèhoun où elle y réside actuellement. Avec son premier crédit, elle a su fidéliser sa clientèle ce qui lui a permis d’accroître son activité. Ainsi, voulant satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de 100000 f CFA.
texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Adjarath Moumoni is 35 years old and was born in Ouake. She is married to Harouna (a port agent) and has 3 children, all attending school. She has been in the business of selling palm oil for the last 4 years, since she arrived in Cadjèhoun where she currently lives. With her first loan she was able to secure the loyalty of her clients, in turn that allowed her to increase her activity. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 100000 f CFA to meet her customers’ demands.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 10 drums of palm oil

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
A. Karomat is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of two adorable children. Karomat has a grocery store which she manages herself - aside from caring for her family and her home. 

She began her small business five years ago with financial support from her husband. The reason for starting the business was to increase her large family’s income. Since its inception, the business has been gradually growing. In order to grow her business, she is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 US Dollars). 

Karomat is planning to spend the loan to purchase more goods, thus increasing the range of her goods. She promises to repay her loan within nine months and thanks everybody who has decided to support her.

loans.use: To purchase grocery food items for selling to increase her variety of goods.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is a wife of A. A. and lives in Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past three years. She completed her education until 5th standard. She couldn’t study more due to the poor conditions of her house. She got married in the age of 18. Her husband works in a factory and earns $4.00 to $5.00 per month. She is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her daughter is one and her son is three.

Rukhsna baji makes decorative embroidered clothes. She takes orders from big shops and charges $2.00 to $3.00 per embroidered dress. Her father-in-law also lives with her and has a business selling wood. Rukhsana baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more wood for her father-in-law’s business.

loans.use: To buy wood to resell.

loans.name: Olim

texts.en:
B. Olim is 30-year-old married man with two children. Olim is a hard-working man who was taught farming by his father. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business about nine years ago. 

Over time, he has increased his cattle sales and is proud to say that the business has been running well. However, he now needs additional capital to expand his business. Therefore, Olim is requesting a loan in the amount of 3500 Somoni to purchase four cattle for an estimated cost 300 USD each. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand and grow the business

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is a 22 year old young lady and a mother of two children: one son and one daughter. She resides in Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 11 years. Her husband has a grocery shop in the community. He has been running this shop for the past 5 years.

Yasmeen baji makes embroidered dresses and stitches clothing. She charges $2.00 for stitching and $3.00 for embroidery. Yasmeen baji successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries for the grocery shop.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Файзов Рустам житель города Вахдат. Возраст 34 года , женат и имеет троих детей. Уже 6 лет работает таксистом.Имеет свой автомобиль и работает по маршруту Душанбе-Вахдат. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы сделать ремонт автомобиля. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rustam F. lives in Vahdat. He is 34 years old, is married and has three children. He has been a taxi driver for 6 years. He has his own car and works the Dushanbe-Vahdat route. Rustam would like to take out a loan in order to repair his car. He will pay back the loan over 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car Repairs

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani baji M. Siddique is married and lives in Riwind, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. She has been living in a two room brick house for the past 40 years. her husband has been a wood seller for 20 years. Rani baji independently owns a milk selling business.
She wakes up at 5 a.m. to get milk from her buffalo. She fills the milk pots and sells them at different shops. She also helps her husband meet the house expenses. She successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to help expand her milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk business

loans.name: Havas

texts.en:
Education is the most important inheritance Havas and her husband can give to their two dear children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in farming so that they can give their kids the opportunity to finish school. Finishing school was an opportunity that they never had due to poor finances. 

This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband, she buys and sells cattle. This is a necessary activity in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Regardless of current cattle sales, she finds herself with increasing expenditures. Thus, she would like a loan in order to increase their capital and increase their production. Havas and her family are waiting for your quick response and thank you in advance.

loans.use: To purchase additional cattle to expand their business.

loans.name: Husniya

texts.en:
B. Husniya is 30 years old, and is married with two children. To supplement her husband, who is an electrician, Husniya sells different kinds of sweets for the children in her community in front of her house. 

In a day, she can earn $10 with a net profit of $3, or $60 in a month. Husniya is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni         ($ 600 USD), and with this loan, she hopes to buy more food. In turn, she can more or less double her income. 

Husniya very much wants to earn more money in order to invest in her children's education and to give them a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 11 months. She deeply appreciates your assistance and expresses her gratitude.

loans.use: To purchase the foodstuff in order to increase the range of her business' goods

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru: Увеличить товарооборот планирует Раджабали Махмадиев. Занимается он торговлей коврами, которые привозит из Ирана. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет. Женат и имеет двоих детей. Кредит получить хочет в размере 4080 сомони, сроком на 8 месяцев. Торгует на рынке города Вахдат. Человек , который очень активно работает и не боится рисковать.
texts.en:
Rajabali M. wants to increase sales. His business markets rugs imported from Iran. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. He is married and has two children. The loan will be for 4080 somoni ($1200), with a term of 8 months. He sells at the Vahdat city market. As a person, he works diligently and is not afraid of risk.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales Volume

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.en:
Pascaline A. was born on March 26, 1970 in Allada, and she married an Oryx gas station attendant in Magbonde. She has four children and three currently in school and one too young for schooling. She began to sell phone cards after she gave up selling gas when the gas became too costly. She has lived in Cadjèhoun for 15 years. She is now awaiting her second loan to meet her consumers' growing demands.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Translated from French:

Née le 26/03/1970 à Allada, elle est mariée à Magbonde (Agent à Oryx). Mère de 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés et un pas encore en âge d’être scolarisé, elle mène cette activité depuis 01an après avoir laissé la vente de produits pétroliers qui ne coule plus correctement à cause de l’augmentation du prix. Elle réside à Cadjèhoun depuis 15 ans. Avec le premier crédit où elle a vu son activité accroître, elle sollicite un crédit de 100000 pour satisfaire à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable cell phone cards and assorted other products.

loans.name: Razzok

texts.en:
H. Razzok is 45 years old and is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuff like: cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, tea and many others in his grocery store which he built five years ago. 

Currently, Razzok has about $3000 of goods in inventory. His monthly net profit is about $ 300. Today, Razzok is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (1200 USD) for the term of 12 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress in their studies. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff for increasing his range of grocery goods

loans.name: Maisara

texts.ru: Шарипова Майсара проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 34 года , разведена и имеет двоих детей. Три года назад после развода начала свой бизнес. Пригнала один автомобиль на продажу , так и бизнес начал расти . Сейчас у нее две машины и она хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы добавить в товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Maisara S. lives in the Varzob District. She is 34 years old, divorced, and has two children. After her divorce three years ago she started her own business. She brought one car to her city to sell, and from there her business began to grow. Now she has two cars and would like a loan to add to sales volume. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add to Sales Volume

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia baji is the wife of M. and lives in Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in a two room brick house for the past 20 years. Shazia baji is a mother of five children: three daughters and two sons. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Shazia baji’s husband has owned an animal food selling business for the past ten years.  Shazia baji owns a milk selling business. She gets milk from her buffalo and sells it at different milk shops. Her elder daughter helps her by filling the milk in milk pots. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to help buy more animal food for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy animal food

loans.name: Françoise

texts.en:
Françoise F. is 41 years old and was born in Cotonou. She married Victorin Ade, a printer, and she has sold toothpaste and shoes for the past 10 years after she stopped sewing. She has lived in Cadjèhoun since 1998. With her first loan, she grew her consumer base, and now she is applying for a second loan to increase her stocks of toothpaste and shoes.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Translated from French:

Agée de 41 ans et née à Cotonou, elle est mariée à Ade Victorin (imprimeur de profession) et est mère d’un enfant scolarisé. Elle est dans la vente de pâtes dentifrices et de chaussures depuis 10 ans après avoir laissé la couture. Elle réside également à Cadjèhoun depuis 10 ans. Avec son premier crédit, elle a su fidéliser sa clientèle ce qui lui a permis d’accroître son activité. Ainsi, voulant satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de 100000 f CFA.

loans.use: To purchase four dozen toothpaste tubes and two dozen pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Five years ago, Nargiza started up her clothing business. Experienced and talented in the business, Nargiza has expanded her business into a successful trade and supports her family through this revenue. 

Throughout the last five years, IMON has provided ongoing assistance to Nargiza’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Nargiza has used each loan wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 3000 Somoni ($ 900 USD) to replace the autumn inventory with winter clothing. With the rotation of supplies in her business, she plans to repay the loan within 2 months. The well-being of Nargiza’s family and her business are in your hands. Nargiza and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for business expansion and to replace her current inventory

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en: Nabeela baji is 24 years old and is married to M. who sells food items such as candies, biscuits at wholesale.  Nabeela baji lives in a city Riwind, Pakistan. She is the mother of two daughters. Nabeela baji owns a milk selling business. She gets milk from her buffalo and sells it at different milk shops. Her monthly income is from $10 to $12. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to help expand her milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk business

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Бачачонова Рахима проживает в районе Рудаки. Не замужем , имеет четверых детей. Муж уехал в Россию на заработки и больше не вернулся. Она одна обеспечивает семью. Занимается пошивом курпачей . Занимается этим уже 15 лет. Доход приносит. Обратилась к нам за кредитом . Хочет закупить вату и материал. Таким образом она увеличит товарооборот и прибыль дела. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rahima B. lives in the Rudaki District. She is a single mother with four children. Her husband left to find work in Russia and never returned. She alone supports the family. For the past 15 years she has worked, sewing traditional clothing. It brings in income. She came to us for a loan. She would like to buy cotton batting and fabric, in order to increase sales and profit from the business. The loan will be repaid over 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florentine

texts.en:
Florentine C. was born in Cotonou in 1950 and married Boniface Gogan, a law clerk, in Cotonou. She has two children in school and has sold charcoal for the past two years. She also sells pastries in Cadjèhoun, a neighborhood of Cotonou, where she has lived since her birth. She saw her business grow with her first loan and is now applying for a second loan to buy three bags of charcoal and some bags of corn.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Translated from French:

Née à Cotonou vers 1950, elle est mariée à Gogan Boniface agent au tribunal de première instance de Cotonou. Mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés, elle mène cette activité depuis 02 ans. Elle vend également des beignets depuis 01 ans et réside à Cadjèhoun depuis sa naissance. Avec le premier crédit où elle a vu son activité accroître, elle sollicite un crédit de 100000 pour satisfaire à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To purchase three bags of charcoal and some bags of corn.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
M. Dilorom is 46 years old and is married. She uses all the money she makes to care for her two children and provide for their education. 

Dilorom has a five years of experience preparing and selling dried apricots. She consistently makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, so her clients are always very happy with the service they receive. 

Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today, Dilorom requests 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the repayment term of 12 months. She is going to spend the loan to purchase dried apricots with the purpose to increase the range of her goods. With your help, this will be possible. Dilorom expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase dried apricots in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
P. Hafiza is 37 years old and is married with four children. Hafiza is a teacher in a local school. Considering that the teachers earn low wages, for the past seven years, Hafiza has had a small business of processing apricots. The dried fruits - especially dried apricots - are very popular in Tajikistan. In addition, it is very beneficial for the health. 

Considering the constant demand for this kind of good, the Hafiza's business is quite successful and brings about a stable income for the family, thereby allowing Hafiza to contribute significantly to the household and education of her dearest children. 

Today, she is requesting 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the term of 11 months. She is going to spend the loan for purchasing the dried apricots with the purpose of processing and further selling them in order increase the range of goods. Hafiza expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her. Please support this woman of immense strength and courage.

loans.use: To buy dried apricots in order to increase her food sales business inventory

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en: Ghazala baji is the wife of M. and resides in Riwind, Pakistan. She is the mother of a one year old son. Ghazala baji’s husband has owned grocery shop for 10 years. She has a milk selling business. She gets the milk from the buffalo her family owns. She charges $1 per kg of milk. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her milk selling business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Шарипова Рано жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 42 года,замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка на рынке "Дехкон" имеет небольшую торговую точку,на которой торгует овощами. Рано скупает у оптовых поставщиков  овощи и реализует их в розницу.На доход от торговли она содержит свою семью.Так как муж клиентки временно не работает.На полученный кредит клиентка хочет закупить больше товара.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rano S. lives in the city of Tursunzade. She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children. She completed secondary school. She has a small stall at the Dehkon market, where she sells vegetables. Rano buys from wholesale providers and sells retail. She supports her family on the income from sales, since her husband is temporarily unemployed. She wants to use a loan to buy more goods. She will repay the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en:
R. Marhamat has had her own business for the past 12 years. She runs a small store where she sells kid’s clothing at the market in Isfara,Tajikistan. Together with he husband, they have three children. 

Difficult living circumstances has forced her husband to leave for Russia to earn income. That’s why Marhamat’s business is an important source of income for her family. Marhamat's income helps her daughter with iniversity expenses and helps cover her parents' expenses too. 

Lending services from IMON were a key support for Marhamat as she has developed her business. She has proven to be a great client and has maintained a perfect payment record. Marhamat is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($ 600 USD) to boost her available capital and allow her to purchase new inventory. We are grateful for the opportunity to further assist in the success of this dedicated entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne G. was born in 1977 in Cotonou. She married Agossou Hounkpevi, a taxi driver, and they have two children in school. She has sold fabric and assorted products such as soap for the past four years. Jeanne has lived in Midombo, a neighborhood in Cotonou, for 8 years. With her first loan, she grew her clientele, and is now applying for a second and slightly larger loan. 

Née vers 1977 à Cotonou. Elle est  mariée à HOUNKPEVI Agossou (Chauffeur taxi auto) et est mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est dans la vente de tissus et de divers (savons, Omo) depuis 04ans.Dame G. réside à Midombo depuis 08 ans. Avec son premier crédit d’un montant de 75000, elle a su fidéliser sa clientèle ce qui a fait accroître la demande de cette dernière. Voulant satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de 180000 f CFA. 

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

loans.use: Purchase of 19 swatches of fabric

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en: Suraiya baji is a wife of M. and lives in a city named Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in a two room brick house for the past 48 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son has a welding business and her younger son is a tailor. Her daughter has a thread making business. Suraiya baji’s husband is a daily wage labor. Suraiya baji has a milk selling business. She gets milk from her buffalo and sells it in milk shops . Her monthly income is $10 to $11. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her milk selling business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk business

loans.name: Mamlakatjon

texts.en:
R. Mamlakatjon is 51 years old and lives in the town of Isfara. She is married and has an adult son. Mamlakatjon is processing and selling dried apricots at the central local market. She is experienced in the business of making the dried apricot. 

Ms. Mamlakatjon is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family and educate her only son, who is a hard-working adult - thanks to her good example. Because she buys apricots wholesale, her prices are lower than regular market prices. 

She offers a wide assortment of dried apricots for clients. All this allows Mamlakatjon to make her business quite successful and it brings a consistently stable income for her family. Today, Mamlakatjon requests 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for the term of eight months. She is going to spend the loan to purchase dried apricots and to process them and to sell. Mamlakatjon expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To buy dried apricots in order to increase her food sales business inventory

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia baji is a wife of M. and lives in a city named Riwind, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Shazia baji’s husband is a daily wage laborer. Shazia baji has been in the milk selling business for 20 years. She gets milk from her buffalo and sells it at different milk shops. Her husband’s income is very low and she shares her earning with him to meet the house expenses. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loans.name: Shahrior

texts.en:
Shahrior owns a minivan and provides transportation services. His usual itinerary is the Kanibadam-Khujand-Kanibadam route. Having run this business for the past five years, he has gained much experience. Initially, he rented the car, but after making certain savings, he bought his own minivan, with the support of his father. 

The business is stable and generates the main income for Shahrior’s family, thereby allowing an improvement in their living conditions. To be able to decrease the expenses for the fuel and consequently to reduce the fees for his services, Shahrior is planning to replace the fuel supply system with the system that uses the gas. This system will be much cheaper than petrol. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 3500 Somoni. Abdunazar thanks everyone who is supporting him and promises to repay the loan in 11 months.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to repair his minivan.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru: Улчаев Али живет в районе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 48 лет, женат  и имеет пятерых детей. Образование среднее . Работает на алюминиевом заводе. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы сделать ремонт у себя дома. Планирует купить доски и шифер. Погасить кредит в течение 16 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ali U. lives in the Tursun-Zade District. He is 48 years old, married, and has five children. He completed secondary school. He works at an aluminum plant. He wants to take out a loan to make repairs to his house. He plans to buy wood boards and slate. The loan will be repaid over 16 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Rashidan

texts.en: Rashidan baji is the wife of M. and lives in Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in a two room brick house for the past 29 years. She is the mother of five sons. Rashidan baji’s husband works in a factory. Rashidan baji has a milk selling business. She has been selling milk in the community for the past 10 years. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her milk selling business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loans.name: Teagbanlin

texts.en:
M. Teagbanlin was born in Ouidah in 1970. She married Wassi Adeagan and has 3 children, 2 in school. She has worked selling scrap metal for the past 3 years and lived in Midombo for 3 years. She is now applying for a second loan to buy more stocks of scrap metal.
 
Née à Ouidah vers 1970, elle est mariée à ADEAGAN Wassi (commerçant). Mère de 03 enfants dont 02 en apprentissage et un scolarisé, elle mène cette activité depuis 03 ans et réside à Midombo depuis 03 ans. Avec le premier crédit où elle a vu son activité accroître, elle sollicite un crédit de 150000 pour satisfaire à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

loans.use: Purchase of scrap metal

loans.name: Sugran

texts.en: Sugran baji is the wife of M. and lives in Riwind, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. M. Idress is a driver by profession and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sugran baji has a thread selling business. She buys second hand warm sweaters from the old market and pulls the thread out from the sweaters. She then washes the thread and makes a roll with it, and after sells it in the market. Sugran baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim baji is the wife of M. and lives in Riwind, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children: two daughters and one son. All of her children are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Shamim baji’s husband owns a shuttering business. He provides beams and ropes to building contractors. Shamim baji has a milk selling business. She has been selling milk for the past four years. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to help expand her milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.ru: Носирова Рукия жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 48 лет,замужем, имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее.Клиентка занимается куплей продажей овощей.Она имеет торговую точку на местном рынке.Бизнес является основным источником дохода ее большой семьи.Рукия закупает у местных крестьян овощи и реализует их в розницу.На полученный кредит клиент хочет закупить товар.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ruqiya N. lives in the city of Tursunzade. She is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She completed secondary school. She works selling vegetables at her stall in the local market. The business is the primary source of income for her large family. Ruqiya buys vegetables from local farmers and sells them retail. The loan will be used to buy produce, and repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Mohammad Hashim

texts.en:
M. Hashim, who lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan, was in Iran for about 8 years. Last year he came buck to Kabul. His father was involved in carpet selling. His father is very experienced but he is an old man and he is sick and can't further the business. His son is taking all the responsibility he is continuing the business. He wants to further the business like his father and always thinks how to expand his business. When he found AFSG in Kabul he was very happy.

He requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghans for the term of 18 months to export more carpets and work hard to establish his business better than now to support his family and enjoy working in carpet weaving.

M. Hashim is really happy. He wants to thank Kiva and AFSG for this great opportunity that everyone can use. He will continue his partnership and make his business better and better.

loans.use: To export more carpets

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim baji is the wife of M. and lives Riwind, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children: two daughters and one son. All of her children are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Shamim baji’s husband owns a shuttering business. He provides beams and ropes as materials to building contractors. Shamim baji herself has been selling milk for the past four years. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to help expand her milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en: Ramzana baji is the wife of R. A. and lives in Riwind, Pakistan. She has lived in a two room brick house for the past 50 years. Ramzana baji has a skill of making embroidered dresses. She charges $3 to $4 per dress. Ramzana baji’s husband has a photo studio. He takes photos of different functions such as birthdays and weddings. He has a good reputation in the community. Ramzana baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a digital camera for her husband.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera

loans.name: Maréne Pêche Group

texts.fr: Thiaroye sur mer est un village traditionnel lébou (pêcheur)situé dans la région de Dakar. La principale activité est la pêche. Cependant pêcheurs de notre état, nous sommes confrontés à différentes difficultés pour mener à bien notre activité. On peut citer entre autre la rareté des poissons nous obligeant à aller de plus en plus loin des côtes pour pêcher ce qui nécessite un matériel de qualité. Ce même état de fait occasionne la pauvreté qui engendre l’émigration clandestine vidant le village de ses jeunes.L’objectif de ce prêt est de se doter une pirogue afin d’avoir un  matériel de travail plus adéquat et de d’offrir par la même occasion un emploi fixe aux jeunes pêcheurs du groupe. L’activité est la pêche artisanale et la vente des produits halieutiques.
texts.en:
Thiaroye by the Sea is a traditional lébou (fishing) village located in the region of Dakar. The main activity is fishing. However, being fishermen by trade, we are confronted with different difficulties to carry through our activity. The scarcity of fish, to name one among others, is forcing us to go further and further from the coasts to fish. This requires high quality equipment. This state of affair brings on poverty that in turn engenders illegal immigration, emptying our village of its youth. The goal of this loan is to equip ourselves with a dugout canoe in order to have better and more adequate equipment for our work. This by the same token would give permanent employment to the young fishermen of the group. The activity is fishing and the sale of products from the sea.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of equipment for fishing

loans.name: Amil

texts.en: Amil was born in 1982. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in the Fuzuli region, Bahmanli village. He is married and has a child. He has been in the cattle breeding business for 5 years. Now he needs a loan to buy 2 calves.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Maxim

texts.en:
Maxim is married to his wife Yekaterina. They are raising a 4 year old daughter. Their family lives in Melitopol, south of Ukraine. Maxim sells children’s clothing in the central marketplace. His vending kiosk is located very favourably in one of the busy market rows, and he’s been running it for 3 years. 

Maxim’s business has benefited a lot from the assistance of his family members and Nadiya Ukraine loans. Currently, he has 4000 Grivnas in income, and about 8000 Grivnas invested in inventory. Maxim has managed to develop his business and thus improve his family’s living standards. This time Maxim is requesting a loan to increase his inventory of assorted merchandise. He is hoping to repay this loan without any delinquencies as he has with all of his previous loans.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of assorted merchandise

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: IBRAHIMA est agé de 42 ans ,il est marié et pére de famille .son activité principale est le commerce de detail qu 'il exerce depuis deux (2) ans dans un quartier de mbour.Avec le pret sollicité il compte renforcer son commerce par la diversification des produits.
texts.en:
Imbrahima is 42 years old, married and a father. For two years he has been working mainly as a retailer in a neighborhood of Mbour. He plans to use this loan to strengthen his business by stocking a wider selection of products.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Suraiya M.umar Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji, the wife of M., lives in Kasur, Pakistan, a city famous for its sweetmeat. She owes a two-room brick house where she has been living for the past 20 years. She is a 41-year-old woman and the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder daughter is in 12th standard grade and her younger daughter is in the 10th standard grade. Her elder son is in the 9th standard grade and her younger son is in the 5th standard grade.

Suraiya baji completed her education through the 10th standard grade and earned a diploma (certificate) in nursing. She now works as a nurse in a private hospital for a monthly wage. Her husband has a grocery shop in the community. He has been running this shop for the past 5 years. Suraiya baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop. 

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Shabana baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a three-wheeled motor vehicle, like a tuk-tuk). Nazir Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy furniture to resell. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her salon. Shabana baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar has been in the butchery business for 5 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in the Fuzuli region, Mahmudlu village. This man is single. Now, he needs a loan to buy more meat.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Zareena M.nazir Group

texts.en:
Zareena baji, the wife of M. Ahmad, resides in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat. 

She is the mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Her elder son has a business selling leather. The son next to him is an employee of private company and earns a monthly wage. Her younger son is in the 2nd standard grade. Her elder daughter completed her education throught the 10th standard grade and has started working in a hospital. The next daughter is in the 10th standard grade. Her next daughter is in the 9th standard grade and her youngest daughter is in the 4th standard grade. 

Zareena baji stays at home and sews clothes on order. She collects orders from her neighborhood. She charges $2 to 3$ per suit. Her husband has a business selling stamp paper. He collects the stamp papers from court and sells them to customers who require them. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. 

Zareena baji successfully has repaid two previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more leather to expand her elder son’s leather-selling business. 

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Zubaida Khatoon baji and Najma baji each want a loan to buy goats for their meat-selling business. Kishawar baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her salon. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy leather to resell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married with a grown son. Six years ago she realized that her best opportunity would be to have her own business. Today, Marina is in the business of selling footwear in the local market.

Marina is very sociable. Her friendliness and respectful attitude have given her a good reputation at the market. She has also proven to be a good manager of her finances. She has received and promptly repaid all of her loans from Nadiya Ukraine. Loans have enabled a gradual expansion of Marina’s business. Currently, she has about 7,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her gross income per month is about 4,500 Grivnas. Her monthly net profit amounts to 1,800 Grivnas.  

Marina would like to get a loan to increase the assortment of inventory in her kiosk. She believes the loan will be beneficial to her business by promoting its expansion. Profit generated by her business will give Marina a chance to help her cover some necessities at home, and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Mohammad Sadiq

texts.en:
Mohammad Sadiq, a man with two children, has a restaurant in which he has been involved for more than 10 years. He has a good number of customers and always tries to expand his business. He loves his business and his customers like the food in this restaurant, and therefore he would like to expand.

He requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghans for the term of 18 months to complete his stock and enlarge his restaurant to make his business strong in the future and keep his customers happy. This is one of his best wishes to make happen in his life.

Finally, he would like to thank those who help this loan process in Afghanistan. He wants to continue his partnership with Kiva and AFSG.

loans.use: To expand his restaurant

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.es: Crisanto tiene 57 años, es conviviente, tuvo 6 hijos, de los cuales vive con 5 de ellos. Desde que tuvo conciencia ha visto a sus padres cultivar la tierra, fue la agricultura quien cubrió sus necesidades básicas, por ello le tiene mucha gratitud y jamás dejaría de sembrar, además si se trabaja a conciencia se puede ganar al doble de lo invertido, nos dice. Ahora, como no es tiempo de cultivar, está trabajando como chofer en una minibús de transporte de pasajeros, realiza esta actividad cuando requieren de sus servicios, pero esto no le es tan rentable como sembrar la papa, por ello que prefiere mil veces la agricultura. Empezó a trabajar con Prisma hace 4 años, este es su 7mo préstamo, y nunca se atrasó en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes para su chacra de papas, lo que le costará un aproximado de S/.2.500 a S/. 3.000.
texts.en:
Crisanto is a married 57-year-old father with 6 children, 5 of whom live with him. As far back as he can remember, he has witnessed his parents cultivate the land. Agriculture has always covered his basic needs, which is why he is so grateful and will never stop farming. Furthermore, he says that if one works with dedication, one can earn double what was invested. Since it is no longer growing season, he is currently working as a minibus driver. He does so whenever his services are required, but it is not as lucrative as growing potatoes, which is why he prefers agriculture a thousand times over. He started working with Prisma 4 years ago. This is his seventh loan, and he has never fallen behind on his payments. With this money, he will purchase fertilizer, which will cost anywhere from 2,500.00-3,000.00 PEN, for his potato farm.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for potato farm

loans.name: Nursrat Parveen M.rafiq Group

texts.en:
Nursrat Parveen baji is a 45-year-old woman who resides in Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 10 years. She completed her education until the 5th standard grade. She couldn’t get more education because her parents couldn’t bear the expense. She has one daughter who reads and is in kindergarten. 

Her husband is a butcher who runs a butcher shop in the community. He sells goat meat, specifically. People used to come to him to buy meat. Nusrat baji herself has a cloth-selling business. She buys clothes from big “Orega and Shahalmi” cloth markets in Lahore and sells them in Kasur. She has been in this business for the past 8 years. 

Nursrat baji has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more goats to expand her husband’s meat business. 

She is joined in her loan group by two more members. Razia baji wants a loan to buy used vehicle wheels to resell. Fazilat baji wants a loan to buy meat to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy goata for her butcher shop

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.es: Diomedes tiene 29 años, es conviviente, vive con su esposa y su hija en casa de su suegra. Creció con la actividad de la agricultura, sus padres se dedicaban a esta actividad, y hasta hoy, él sigue sembrando, en sus campos se cultivan por temporadas,  dedicándose a ellos hasta el tiempo de cosecha; pero en tiempos que no cultiva se dedica a vender carnes R. de todo tipo, y aprovecha en juntar los pellejos con lana que  negocia por libra, le pagan desde S/ 1.20  a S/.1.50, le va muy bien y le es muy rentable, también su venta de papa, pero para ello tiene que esperar periodos de 6 meses, en cambio la venta de la carne y la lana es un negocio constante. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará fertilizantes para abonar su chacra, además de comprar 4 o 5 carneros, para luego vender su carne.
texts.en:
Diomedes is 29 years old, married, and lives with his wife and daughter in his mother-in-law’s house. He grew up with agriculture, and his parents did the same work, and he still works planting seeds. He grows seasonal crops on his land, working with the crops until it is time to harvest them. When he is not growing crops, he sells all types of red meat. He also gathers sheepskins with wool which he can sell by the pound. They pay between 1.20 soles ($0.38) to 1.50 soles ($0.48) per pound and the business is profitable and going well. In addition, he sells potatoes, but he needs to wait periods of 6 months for the potatoes to grow, whereas the sale of meat and wool is a year-round business. This is his first loan from Kiva partner MFP (Microfinanzas PRISMA). He will buy fertilizers for his land with this loan, and also 4 or 5 sheep so he can later sell their meat.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers for his farm and some sheep

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es: Elvia tiene 35 años, está felizmente casada con su esposo y tiene 3 hijos. Cuando era niña se dedicaba a pastar los carneros de sus padres, tenían en grandes cantidades de ellos, desde que se casó se ha dedicado a la agricultura, debido a que su esposo se dedica a ello, ahora siembran de 3 a 4 hectáreas de papa, dice que les es rentable, sobre todo cuando en el mercado escasea, ella recién la saca a vender, una vez que se cosecha la puede guardar, le dura un aproximado de 3 a 4 meses, mientras tanto sobrevive de la venta de sus carneros, y cuando sube la papa recién la saca al mercado. Cultivar sus tierras le agrada, solo se le hace dificultoso cuando tiene que abonar y medicar sus tierras. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, durante este tiempo ha demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos. Con este dinero comprará  abonos como el Nitrato, Urea y el 18, para que de ese modo reaccionen bien sus cultivos de papa, esto le costará un aproximado de 3500 a 4000 soles.
texts.en:
Elvia is years old, is happily married to her husband and has 3 children. When she was a child she used to put her parents' cows out to pasture as they had large quantities of them and since she married she has worked in agriculture as her husband works in this. Now they grow 3 to 4 hectares of potato, she says it is profitable for them, above all when the market becomes scarce. She recently took them to sell and once that harvest can be stored, it lasts her 3 to 4 months and meanwhile she lives from the sale of her cows and when the price of potato increases she takes it to market. Cultivating her lands makes her happy, but it becomes difficult when she has to fertilize and medicate her lands. This is her 7th loan with MFP, during this time she has demonstrated punctuality in her payments. With this money she will buy fertilizers with nitrate, urea and 18 so that in this way her potato crops react well. This will cost her an approximate 3500 to 4000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for potato crops

loans.name: Fozia Mumtaza Ali Haider Group

texts.en:
Fozia baji, the wife of M. A. H., resides in Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has been living for the past 10 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her elder son is in the 4th standard grade and her younger son is in kindergarten. 

Fozia baji’s husband has a mobile phone shop in which he sells and repairs mobile phones. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. Fozia baji has a business selling clothes. Because she wants to share the financial burden of her husband, and because of inflation is increasing every day, it's very difficult for a single person to support the family. She is applying for a loan to expand her clothing business. 
 
She is joined in her loan group by three more members. Zahida Parveen baji wants a loan to buy leather to resell. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Amreena baji wants a loan to buy lentils, rice, cooking oil, and spices for her food business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina tiene 40 años, es conviviente, vive con su esposo y sus entenados (hijos de su esposo). Se dedica a la agricultura desde niña, hace 3 años se inició en la compra y venta de frutas en la ciudad, pero solo los días de feria, que son los domingos y jueves;  a ella le agrada mucha estar en contacto con la gente, pero por falta de tiempo y dinero le es imposible, porque su chacra necesita mucha dedicación, comenta. Guillermina empieza a cosechar desde marzo, recupera su dinero cuando el producto tiene buen precio, por ello que nunca dejaría de sembrar, aunque se dedique a otro negocio, lo difícil es la compra de fertilizantes para sus sembríos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará guano de corral para que puedan reaccionar sus sembríos ya que sin ellos morirán sus plantas.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 40 years old and lives with her husband and step-children (children of her husband). She has worked in agriculture since she was a child. Four years ago she started the purchase and sale of fruits in the city, but only on market sales which are Sundays and Thursdays. She likes to be in contact with people very much, but because of a lack of time and money it is imposible for her because her land needs a lot of dedication, she comments. Guillermina starts to harvest from March on and recuperates her money when the product has a good price, which is why she would never stop growing although she works on another business. The difficult thing is the purchase of fertilizers for her crops. This is her second loan with MFP. With the money she is requesting she will buy farm manure so that her crops react as without them her plants will die.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Jilmer

texts.es: Jilmer tiene 27 años, es conviviente, tiene una hija y está viviendo en la casa de su suegra. Desde muy niño ha ayudado a trabajar a sus padres en sus campos de cultivo, ahora que tiene su familia continua en esa actividad, adicional y esporádicamente se dedica al oficio de chofer. Pero siempre le dedica el mayor tiempo en a sus cultivos de papa, que es lo que siembra en mayor cantidad. Le agrada su actividad,  aunque demora en producir 6 meses, por ello le gustaría tener chacras de regadío, con estas sí ocuparía todo su tiempo, entonces, esa es su mayor dificultad, porque en las chacras temporales la inversión para el abono es mayor que en las de regadío. Inició a trabajar con Prisma hace 3 años, este es su 7mo préstamo, y desde entonces ha demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos. Con esta cantidad va a comprar fertilizantes para abonar sus terrenos, calcula que todo le costará un aproximado de S/.500.
texts.en:
Jilmer is 27 years old, lives with his partner, has a daughter and is living in his mother-in-law's house. Since he was a small child he has helped his parents work their fields and now that he has his own family he continues this activity. In addition, he sporadically works as a driver. But he always dedicates the majority of his time to potato cultivation, which is what he grows in the greatest quantity. He likes his activity, although it takes 6 months to produce, which is why he would like to have irrigated fields as with these he would occupy all of his time. So this is his greatest difficulty because in seasonal fields the investment for fertilizers is greater than in those that are irrigated. He started working with Prisma 3 years ago, this is his 7th loan and since then he has demonstrated punctuality in his payments. With this quantity he is going to buy fertilizers to fertilize his fields. He calculates that everything will cost approximately S/.500.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for his land

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando en el colegio D. la ciudad. Cuando era niña se dedicaba a pastar el ganado D. sus padres, y desD. que se casó cambió su actividad para dedicarse mayormente a su casa; su esposo es profesor. Pero ahora que sus hijos ya crecieron ella no pueD. estar sin realizar alguna actividad, por ello empezó a dedicarse a la agricultura, actividad que le agrada mucho y les es muy rentable, sobre todo en tiempos D. cosecha, donD. negocia sus productos. Le es dificultoso en las épocas D. siembra y cosecha, ya que ella solo no se abastece, y a veces no encuentra peones que le ayuden. Le tiene mucha gratitud a su IMF, porque dice que  le han permitido tener independencia económica. Con este, es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y durante todo este tiempo demostró puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero va comprar abono D. corral para que pueda sembrar, ya que tiene semilla guardada y quiere hacerla producir.
texts.en:
Julia is 44 years old, is married and has two children who are studying in the high school in the city. When she was a child she worked putting her parents' cattle out to pasture and since she married she changed her activity to work primarily at home; her husband is a professor. But now that her children are already grown she cannot be without carrying out some activity which is why she started to work in agriculture, which she likes very much and is very profitable, above all in harvest times when she negotiates her products. It is difficult for her in periods of planting and harvesting as she cannot do it all herself and sometimes she does not find laborers to help her. She is very grateful for her IMF, because she says it has allowed her to have economic independence. With this, itis her seventh loan with MFP, and during all of this time she demonstrated punctuality with her payments. With this money she will buy animal manure to help her grow, as she has seed stored and wants to make it produce.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer
