Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado se implementará con más productos de belleza, además de comprar un mostrador para la exhibición y seguridad de sus cosméticos.
texts.en:
Marilin is 34 years old and she is the mother of 2 kids who study, and who are her reason for moving forward. She lives together with her partner who also supports her a lot. She is a very active woman who desires to overcome, and for 2 years she has been selling beauty products like: perfumes, jewelery, talcum powder, lipstick, cremes and other things from the catalog. It is profitable as, thanks to her kind and jolly manner of selling, she has won a large range if clients. She takes these products with her to sell them in the furthest zones of Yarinacocha, and she sells them on credit or I.O.U. She works all day and she is happy with her work as she gets to know many people. This is her first loan with MFP. With the solicited money she will buy many beauty products, as well as buying a counter to show off and for the security of her cosmetics.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a counter and more beauty products/Compra de un mostrador y mayor cantidad de productos de belleza

loans.name: Rural Los Vallegrandinos Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo solidario "Rural Los Vallegrandinos" está compuesto por 4 integrantes; el nombre de los “VALLEGRANDINOS”  que actualmente recibe el grupo es debido a que todos son nacidos en la Provincia de Vallegrande del departamento de Santa Cruz, Bolivia.

Fidelia Davila.- Es la coordinadora del grupo, ella vive en la comunidad de pampa Coscal una pequeña comunidad cutyos pobladores se dedican mayormente a la agricultura, vive en casa propia y es madre soltera por lo cual vive con sus dos hijos, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 17 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, su anhelo es sacar a sus dos hijos profesionales.

Martha A..- Vive junto a la parcela de doña Fidelia Davila son vecinas, Es dueña de casa y vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, su actividad es la agricultura, se dedican a la siembra de maíz y papa.

Venicio R..- el sr. Venicio vive en la misma comunidad de Pampa Coscal; es propietario de una pequeña parcela, en la cual siembra maíz y papa. Vive solo con su hijo quien está estudiando en la escuelita de la misma comunidad.

Marcos F..- es el ultimo integrante del grupo es un Sr. Muy activo vive en la misma comunidad que los anteriores integrantes, vive con su esposa la sra. Adela Arroyo y sus tres hijos.
Su actividad es la agricultura, siembra al igual que los otros integrantes maíz y papa.
texts.en:
These are the four members of the Grupo Solidario (solidarity group) "Rural Los Vallegrandinos". The name of the group was chosen because all the members were born in the Vallegrande province, in Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Fidelia Davila.- She is the group's coordinator. Fidelia lives in the small community of Pampa Coscal, where most people work as farmers. She owns her home, and is a single mother of two children. She has been farming for 17 years; she works very hard and is determined to make a better life for herself and her children. Her wish is to give her two children a college education. Martha A..- Martha is Fidelia's next door neighbor. She owns her home, and lives with her husband and their three children. They grow corn and potatoes. Venicio R..- Venicio also lives in Pampa Coscal. He owns a small piece of land where he grows corn and potatoes. He lives by himself with his son, who attends the school in the community. Marcos F..- Marcos is a very active member of the group. He lives in the same community with his wife Adela Arroyo and their three childrem es el ultimo integrante del grupo es un Sr. Muy activo vive en la misma comunidad que los anteriores integrantes, vive con su esposa la sra. Adela Arroyo y sus tres hijos. Like the other members, he grows corn and potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, etc. for the planting season

loans.name: Rolande

texts.en:
Rolande Adechina was born on May 13, 1968 in Cotonou. She is a divorced mother of one child and she has sold vegetable oil for the past 4 years in Sènadé. She is now applying for a loan to buy 10 more drums of vegetable oil. This will help her do more business and increase her income.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

loans.use: To purchase of 10 drums of vegetable oil

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Mercedes es madre soltera, vive con uno de sus 4 hijos, que es soltero, trabaja y la apoya en lo posible.Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas y helados en su vivienda desde hace 2 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que está en contacto con muchas personas. Le es rentable debido a que sus productos son de consumo diario y ya cuenta con sus clientes desde hace mucho tiempo. Lo difícil para ella es no contar con un local adecuado para la venta de sus productos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP. En esta oportunidad desea mandar a construir un kiosco para poder vender con mayor tranquilidad, comodidad y dar mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mercedes is single and she lives with one of her 4 kids who is single and works and supports her where possible. She has dedicated herself to selling drinks and ice-creams from her house for 2 years. What she likes about her work is that she comes into contact with many people. It is profitable as her products are for every day consumption and she has many long-term clients. The difficult thing for her is that she does not have an adequate store from which to sell her products. This is her second loan with MFP. With this opportunity she wants to build a kiosk to be able to sell more calmly and comfortably and to welcome her clients better.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk to sell her drinks/Construccion de un kiosko para la venta de sus bebidas

loans.name: Valle Hermoso Ccayarpachi Group

texts.en:
The Valle Hermoso Ccayarpachi Village Bank is part of FINCA Peru's Project Wari, an effort to bring micro-loans to rural communities. Valle Hermoso Ccayarpachi is currently in its fifth loan cycle with FINCA. The group members live in the Ccayarpachi community in the province of Huamanga, in central Peru. The community is on the right hand siD. of the Cachi River, in a warm climate. The region produces many fruits and vegetables; many locals also raise large and small animals like cows, pigs, and guinea pigs (a delicacy in Peru). 

Teodosia and Hermelina are two members of Valle Hermoso Ccayarpachi. 

Teodosia is married with four children, who are 11, 9, 6 and 4 years old and are all in school. She runs a small store, which she opened by gradually saving up the money she earned from selling the animals she raised. Teodosia now hopes to open up a larger store in her own home, which she recently finished building. Teodosia is requesting a loan of 800 soles (US$275) to buy a variety of merchandise to sell in the store she plans to open. Teodosia says that loans from FINCA have helped her expand her business. In the future, she hopes to raise her own pigs and guinea pigs in addition to running the store. She also wants her children to study in the city of Ayacucho, where the schools are higher quality. She says she is saving money in her FINCA account in case her family ever has any trouble or emergency situations. 

Hermelina is married with five children who are 28, 25, 18, 14 and 13 years old. She sells chicken, fish and vegetables in Ccayarpachi, and has been in this business for the past 15 years. Hermelina is requesting a loan of 400 soles (US $150) to buy more merchandise to sell so that she can earn more. She says that her business has grown since she began working with FINCA, and that her family is doing very well. She hopes that her younger children will graduate with professional degrees, as her older children already have.

loans.use: Buy grocery items and meat to sell

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: Ninfa, de 53 años de edad, vive junto a su conviviente y uno de sus 6 hijos. Se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, golosinas, entre otras variedades), esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 9 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar lo mejor de ella a sus clientes, para que los mismos se sientan satisfechos. Le es muy rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicada en un lugar muy transitable y concurrido, razón por la cual le va muy bien en su negocio. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, ha sido puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio, y desde luego implementarse con más productos.
texts.en:
Ninfa, who is 53 years old, lives with her partner and one of their six children. She sells staple products such as milk and rice, among other things. She has worked in this capacity for nine years. What she likes most about her job is giving her best to her clients so that they are very satisfied. Her business is profitable and doing well as she is located in an accessible and well traveled place. This is her third loan request. Ninfa has been punctual in repaying her loans. With the proceeds she would like to expand her business and of course add more products to her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business and add more products.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí, de 25 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su conviviente, quien la apoya mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, desde hace ya un año, estos productos los lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares de su zona. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que se relaciona con mucha gente. Le es rentable porque no deja al crédito, siempre vende al contado y cuenta con una clientela selecta que son fieles desde que se inicio en esta labor. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero solicitado será invertido en al compra de más productos de belleza, además de adquirir una vitrina pequeña para exhibición.
texts.en:
Noemí, who is 25 years old, has three children and lives with her domestic partner who gives her a lot of support. She has sold beauty products by catalogue for a year now. She takes the products to sell in different parts of her region. What she likes most about her job is that she interacts frequently with people. Her business is profitable because she does not allow sales based on credit; all sales are cash-based and she relies on a client base that has been faithful since she started her business. This is her first loan with Kiva field partner MFP. The proceeds will be invested in the purchase of more beauty products in addition to acquiring a small display cabinet for exhibition.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products and a display window.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda, de 40 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos, vive con su conviviente, quien la apoya en lo posible. Se dedica a la venta de comida, desde hace un año atrás, vende dentro de su casa, brindando desayunos y almuerzos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una muy buena atención a sus clientes y sobre todo cocinar bien, al gusto de los mismos. Le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona y desde luego cuenta con sus clientes que le son fieles desde que inició. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a construir un kiosco para vender con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Olinda, who is 40 years old, has five children and lives with her domestic partner, who helps her as much as possible. She has sold meals from her home for about a year, offering breakfasts and lunches. What she likes best about her work is giving good service to her clients and above all cooking well and to her clients’ taste. Her business is profitable because it is located in a good spot and because she counts on clients who have been faithful since she started. This is her first loan with Kiva field partner MFP. With the requested loan, she will construct a kiosk to be able to sell more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 23 años de edad, tiene una hija, vive junto a su conviviente quien la ayuda en todo. Ella se dedica a la venta de juanes (arroz con pollo, aceitunas y huevo envuelto en una hoja), desde ya hace 2 años, los lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares de su zona, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y mucha gente. Le es rentable, ya que cuenta con sus clientes, quienes esperan todas las tardes a la vendedora de juanes. Le va muy bien. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para la venta de su comida, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada, y así ya no tendrá que caminar durante tantas horas.
texts.en:
Ruth, who is 23 years old, has a daughter and lives with her domestic partner who helps her with everything. For the last two years, she has sold a local food similar tamales that are called “juanes” and are made of rice and chicken, olives and egg wrapped in a leaf. She takes them to sell in different places in the region where she lives. What she likes about her work is that she gets to see many places and people. The business is profitable and is going well as she has reliable clients who wait every afternoon for their juanes vendor. This is the second loan that Ruth has taken with Kiva partner MFP. With the loan proceeds, she wants to have a kiosk built which she will use to sell her food rather than have to walk for so many hours.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk.

loans.name: Sarela

texts.es: Sarela tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos, siendo 3 de ellos independientes, vive en la actualidad con los tres últimos y con su esposo, quien la apoya en todo, sobre todo en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, constituyendo así su bodega en su propia casa, este negocio lo tiene desde hace un año. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes, quienes son su factor principal en su negocio. Le es rentable porque dentro de su zona ya cuenta con una clientela selecta y sobre todo fiel, es por ello que le va muy bien. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos para implementar su negocio y posteriormente mandarlo a ampliar, ambientarlo adecuadamente para dar una buena acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sarela is 35 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are independent. She lives with her three youngest children and her husband, who helps her with everything and especially with her business. Sarela has been selling groceries and staple products from her home for a year. She likes to provide good service to her clients, who are her primary concern. Her business is profitable because she has a select and faithful client base within her neighborhood. For this reason, she is doing well. This is her first loan with Kiva field partner MFP. With the loan proceeds, she will buy more products for her store which she later plans to expand. She will decorate adequately so that the store is inviting to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in a grocery store.

loans.name: Savi

texts.es: La señora Savi tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto  Su actividad diaria es la venta de abarrotes, labor que viene realizando desde hace 6 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto directo con sus clientes y desde luego darles una buena atención para que regresen en otra oportunidad. Le es rentable porque cuenta con una clientela que la apoya desde el primer momento que puso este negocio, por lo que no muestra dificultad alguna.a su conviviente y sus 3 hijos,  quienes están estudiando y son su razón de seguir adelante. Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, mostrándose puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere ampliar y ambientar adecuadamente su negocio, para así dar una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Savi is 30 years old and lives with her family. Her daily activity is grocery sales, work she has done for 6 years. She likes being in direct contact with her clients and of course likes to give them good service so that they come back. The business is profitable since she is able to depend upon a client base that has helped her from the start. For this reason, she has had no troubles to mention. She lives with her domestic partner and their three children, who are students and are also her reason to persevere in her efforts. This is the fourth loan that she has solicited from Kiva field partner MFP, and she has demonstrated punctual repayments. With the solicited loan proceeds she would like to expand and decorate her business adequately, for her clients' benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To decorate and expand a store.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es: Valentín, de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. El se dedica al cultivo de plátanos, yucas, maíz, entre otras variedades de productos de pan llevar, desde hace ya 2 años. Estos productos los vende de acuerdo a la temporada de producción. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dedicarse a fondo a sus cultivos para que crezcan como es debido y estén a un precio acorde al mercado. Le es rentable, ya que los productos que el lleva vender son de buena calidad y son vendidos rápidamente. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, donde ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará semillas, abonos y fertilizantes, como también quiere comprar ganado para ponerlo en su chacra.
texts.en:
Valentin, is 38 years old, lives with his wife and four children. He works cultivating plantains, yucca, corn; among other varieties of bread products for the last 2 years. He sells them depending on the season of production. What he likes the most is to work hard so his products grow properly and can be sold at a fair market value. The business is very profitable for him because his products are of very good quality and get sold very fast. This is his second loan with MFP, he has demonstrated to be very punctual with his payments. With the money from the loan he wants to buy seeds and fertilizers, as well as livestock to rise.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Paulina António

texts.pt:
Paulina António M. é natural da cidade de Maputo no bairro chamanculo, tem 40 anos de idade, é separada mãe de um filho com 10 anos de idade e estuda na 5ªclasse, para alem do seu filho sustenta a sua mãe e um sobrinho que vivem juntos.

Paulina estudou até 10ªclasse e parou por situações sociais, logo que teve problemas para continuar com os estudos, juntou se com pai do seu filho e juntos viveram durante 8 anos, pois isto ela volta a casa da mãe e por sua vez a mãe corta uma área de terreno para ela construir a sua casinha onde vive até data hoje.

Paulina neste momento vive de negocio onde consiste na venda electrodomésticos, as quais adquira na Africa do sul com destaques aos T.V, assim compra uma T.V pequena por 450 rands e vende por 1800,00mt e compra T.V grande por 600 rands e vende por 2800,00mt, desta forma consegue mensalmente 36000,00mt das vendas e poupa 5000,00mt.

Paulina com este empréstimo pretende aumentar a sua mercadoria e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de melhorar as suas condições habitacionais.
texts.en:
Paulina António M. is a native of the city of Maputo in the Chamanculo district. She is 40 years old, separated, and the mother of a 10 year-old son who is in the 5th grade. Besides her son she also supports her mother and a nephew who live together. Paulina studied until the 10th grade and stopped because of social situations. As soon as she had problems continuing with her studies she got together with the father of her son and they lived together for 8 years. After that she returned to her mother's home and her mother cleared an area of land for her to construct a little house where she lives today. Paulina makes a living from a business that consists of selling household appliances which she acquires in South Africa. Her focus is on Televisions. She purchases a small T.V. for 450 rands and sells it for 1,800MT and purchases a large T.V for 600 rands and sells it for 2,800MT. In this way she is able to make 36,000MT monthly from her sales and save 5,000MT. Paulina intends to use this loan to increase her merchandise. This is her first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. She intends to pay it off before the term so she can solicit another loan to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of household appliances

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento Arco Iris, fue conformado este año, gracias a la inquietúd D. algunos D. sus integrantes, quienes son familiares, y tienen negocios en común.

ELECTO S..- Es el presidente del banco comunal, el es nacido en la provincia D. VallegranD. del Departamento D. Santa Cruz. Actualmente vive en la zona D. El Torno, el vive con su hijo y su esposa en una pequeña casa propia, la cual ha sido adquirida con el fruto D. su trabajo, ellos tienen una panadería, desD. hace 20 años.

Sabina Farrel.- es la tesorera del Banco comunal, vive en la zona D. El Torno, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en casa propia. Se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, negocio que realiza D. manera ambulante y D. la misma manera que las otras compañeras con el tiempo quiere llegar a colocar su negocio fijo.
Su esposo trabaja como ayudante D. chofer, el sueño D. ambos es llegar a contar con vehiculo propio.
texts.en:
The Rainbow Venture Bank was established this year thanks to the concern of the founders, who are family and have the business in common. Electo S.- President of the community bank. He was born in the province of VallegranD. in the Santa Cruz region. Currently, he lives in El Torno zone with his son and wife in his small home that he bought with the fruits of his labor. They have operated a bread shop for the past 20 years. Sabina Farrel- Treasurer of the community bank. She lives in the El Torno zone, has four children, and has her own house. She makes a living by selling cosmetics, a business that she realizes by traveling to people's homes in the same way as her colleagues. Her husband works as a driver. He dream is for both of them to have their own cars.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange D. was born March 24, 1973 in Dogbo, a village in Mono County. She married Joseph Houssa, a retired member of the military. She has three children in school and she sells fish and eggs that she buys in neighboring Nigeria. She is requesting a loan so she can build her business by increasing her inventory.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

loans.use: To purchase of 10 bags of fish and 20 crates of eggs

loans.name: Cintia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La microempresaria Cintia Elizabeth C. H. tiene 45 años de edad, es de la etnia creole, es casada tiene 3 hijos los cuales estudian en nivel primaria y secundaria. Esta señora se dedica desde hace varios años a vender de manera ambulante los siguientes productos: picos, pati, queque de quequisque entre otros, los cuales son bastante consumidos por la población Blufileña.

Esta actividad la realiza visitando los diferentes barrios de esta ciudad teniendo como principales clientes los funcionarios de las distintas oficinas públicas y privadas. Sin embargo por las constantes alzas que se presentan en los productos que utiliza como materia prima hace que cada día la ganancia sea menos y que tenga por optar o por subirle de precio o por hacerlo mas pequeño lo que obviamente crea inconformidad en sus clientes.

Por lo planteado requiere comprar sus productos en volúmenes para poderlos obtener a menor costo y por un tiempo prudente que afecte menos el problema de las alzas.

Esta solicitando para comprar 2 quintales de azúcar a US$ 30 dólares cada quintal, 2 quintales de harina a US$ 50 dólares cada quintal, 2 cajas de mantequilla a US$ 25 dólares cada caja, 2 cajas de manteca a US$ 30 dólares cada caja, 1 bidón de aceite a US$ 35 dólares el bidón, 10 sacos de carbón a US$ 3 dólares cada saco, 2 cajas de levadura a US$ 35 dólares cada caja, 100 unidades de cocos  a US$ 0.20 dólares cada coco y  1 fogonero a US$ 20 cada uno.
texts.en:
Businesswoman Cintia Elizabeth C. H. is 45 years old and a single mother. She is of Creole background and has two children who are both students. For several years she has been a street seller of various baked goods that are very popular amongst the population of Blufileña. She visits several neighbourhoods to sell the pastries. Her main customers are the various public and private office workers. However, because of the constantly rising cost of the basic ingredients, her profit is falling and she has to choose between raising the prices or making the baked goods smaller in size—neither of which will please her customers. For these reasons Cintia wants to buy ingredients in large quantities so she can obtain them at a cheaper cost which will lessen the effect of rising prices. She is asking for a loan to buy 2 quintals (one quintal is 46kg) of sugar at US$30 per quintal, 2 quintals of flour at US$50 per quintal, 2 cases of butter at US$25 per case, 2 cases of shortening at US$30 per case, 1 drum of oil at US$35 per drum, 10 sacks of charcoal at US$3 per sack, 2 cases of yeast at US$35 per case, 100 coconuts at US$0.20 per coconut, and an industrial stove costing US$20.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baking ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: San Juan Bautista De Cayara Group

texts.en:
The San Juan Bautista D. Cayara Village Bank is part of FINCA Peru’s Project Wari, an effort to bring micro-loans to rural communities in central Peru. The group is maD. up of 18 members from the Ayacucho region’s Cayara community, who are together requesting loans of $2025 (6200 PEN). The town is located an hour from Huancapi District, on the highway to Southern Ayacucho. The community has three different elevations: a low part suited to growing fruit, a middle ground suited to growing grains, and an elevated section suited to growing tubers, namely potatoes.

Dina, Reyna Marta, and Eufemia are three members of the San Juan Bautista D. Cayara Village Bank.

Dina is married but separated with two children who are 6 and 12 years old and currently attend school. Dina sells dry goods from a small stO., and would like to expand her businesses and sell ground grains. She is requesting a loan of $65 (200 PEN), which she plans to use to buy grains, whole and ground, to bring to the Canaria Mine to sell. She is grateful to work with FINCA; she says it provides a good opportunity to save and to continue to expand her business. Her goals for the future are to proviD. her children with a good education, improve her business, and get ahead in life. She is saving for her children’s education.

Reyna Marta is married and has three children who are 7, 9, and 12 years old. Reyna sells sweets outsiD. several local schools. She also sells lunch to teachers and to workers who are installing an irrigation canal in her community. She is requesting a loan of $65 (200 PEN) to buy mO. sweets to sell and start running her lunch counter from a kiosk in the town’s main plaza. Reyna’s dream is to move her family to a city with mO. opportunities and open up a business in the city of Huamanga. FINCA has helped her save money for herself and for her children. Like Dina, Reyna is saving up for her children’s education. She says her husband plans to start saving, too.

Eufemia lives with her partner and their three children, who are 1, 4, and 9 years old and are all in school. She is involved in Cayara’s local government, and also runs a small stO. and sells household supplies. She is requesting a loan of $200 (600 PEN), which she will use to buy mO. products for her stO. and to help jump-start her savings. Eufemia says that when she first heard that FINCA was coming to Cayara she didn’t believe it, but it did indeed come, and is helping community members to save, which she likes. Eufemia says that her businesses are doing well, and she knows she will get ahead in life. Eufemia dreams that her children will go to college someday. She wants to leave her village to proviD. her children with a better education. Like Dina and Reyna, she is saving up for her children’s education.

loans.use: Buy grains, buy sweets and open a lunch counter, and buy household supplies to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora  Cristina, es una mujer joven y bonita que se dedica a vender  ropas y calzados además de algunos electrodoméstico.

Ya van varios años que se dedica a este oficio por lo que ya tiene su propia clientela formada. Ella recorre oficinas y  clientes particulares ofreciendo la variedad de sus productos y los vende en su mayoría en cuotas. 

Cristina tiene un solo hijo, gracias a su esfuerzo posee casa  propia. Ella tiene pensado para el próximo año ampliar su casa, y construir ahí un salón comercial para de esa forma vender sus productos en un local propio sin tener que dejar su casa por varias horas durante el día.

Hoy solicita un crédito para poder adquirir mayor variedad de mercaderías especialmente ropas de la temporada verano pues sus clientes ya le han solicitado.
texts.en:
Cristina is a young and beautiful woman that sells clothes, shoes, and some electrical appliances. It has been some years since she began this profession, and now she has an established clientele. She fulfills many duties and offers her customers a variety of products, many of which she sells on credit. Cristina has only one son and thanks to her hard work, she has her own house. She has thought about enlarging her home next year by constructing a small store to sell her products without having to leave home. She requests a loan to purchase a greater variety of merchandise, especially the summer clothes her customers have been asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes for the summer such as shirts, skirts, shorts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cécile Fifonsi D., is the mother of four children and is married to Bernard Deji, a radio and television repairman. She was born on November 28, 1972 in Porto-Novo in Ouémé County in southern Benin. Cécile distributes fabric and sells drinks. She is requesting a loan so that she may buy more inventory and be prepared for the end-of-the year rush. This will increase her income.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

loans.use: To purchase of 15 packs of drinks and 10 packages of fabric

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Ebenezer M. is a hard-working businessman. He is 62 years old and is married with three kids.  Fortunately, all the kids are independent now, easing his burden. He trades in rubber products like polythene bags; these bags come in various sizes and colors, and are mostly used for packing of all kinds. Ebenezer buys his supply of raw materials from the capital city of Ghana. He enjoys his trade very much but says that prices of raw materials have shot up drastically and transport costs have gone up due to the current fuel crisis. These difficulties have rendered his working capital inadequate to purchase appreciable quantities of materials to sell. He therefore needs this loan to inject additional capital into his business to enable him meet the demands of the market. He wants to use the loan to buy an increased supply of raw materials so that he can turn them into finish goods for his customers and increase his profits. Ebenezer hopes to increase his savings to pay for his house rent. He is a member of the community group called The Voice Trust Group. In this group, members vouch for one another as social collateral to repay their loans. Ebenezer’s picture was taken at one of his group meetings.

loans.use: To buy increased supply of polythene raw materials for the production of final packing goods.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.pt:
Carlota I. é natural da cidade de Maputo no bairro luís Cabral, tem 42 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 2 filhos, onde o primeiro tem 16 anos e está no terceiro anos do instituto comercial e o segundo tem 10 anos e está na 6ªclasse.

Carlota é estudante do terceiro ano da universidade pedagógica, trabalha como caixa e nos tempos livre dedica se ao negocio por encomenda onde faz até comidas, vende carne, doces, também cria frangos de corte venda e mais para melhor responder as suas encomendas. Tem um rendimento mensal de 15000,00mt e faz poupanças de 5000,00mt.

Para Carlota este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque de forma a responder da melhor forma os seus clientes. Assim sonha Carlota com um talho e uma pastelaria para melhor fazer o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Carlota I. is a native of the city of Maputo in the Luís Cabral district. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. The oldest is 16 and in the third years at the business institute, and the youngest is 10 years old and is in the 6th grade. Carlota is a student in her third year at the pedagogical university. She works as a cashier, and she dedicates her free time to her business of food orders of meats and sweets. She also raises chickens so she can better respond to her orders. She has a monthly income of 15,000MT and saves 5,000MT. This is Carlota's first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. She intends to increase her stock so she can better respond to her customers. She dreams of having a butcher's shop and a pastry shop so she can do better business.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various products (meat, sweets)

loans.name: Mujeres En Victoria Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres En Victoria" is the name of a group of 5 women hoping to receive a loan. Marie is the representative of this group, and she plans on starting a business where she will sell different types of food. Initially, Marie will sell things such as rice, beans, and salt, but she hopes that the business will continue to grow in such a way that she can someday have her own colmado (small grocery store).

She states that she needs to change things for the better in her life because she has three young kids to feed. Unfortunately, she and her family have been living in extreme poverty in recent years. She and her husband have been working hard to be able to send all of their children to school, but at times the children need to help make money to ensure that there is food on the family's table. She feels that starting her own business will enable all of her children to attend school and to thereby better their future. Marie is a very hard-working person, and she is confident that she will make this business work! This is just the first step for her to better her life!

loans.use: To start a business by purchasing food products to resell to her customers

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en:
Brigitte G. was born on March 20, 1958 in Port Novo. She is a widow and the mother of 4 children. Peniel is 20 years old and is a typist, Jacques is 18 years old and in college, and Luc is 16 years old and is a junior in high school. She takes care of the 3 younger children and started selling akassa (corn flour served with leaves, a snack that is the staple carbohydrate of Benin). As her business grew, she began selling food to children outside of an elementary school. She is applying for a loan to buy more corn, rice, and beans to increase her business. 
 
Veuve G. Brigitte est née le 20 mars 1958 à porto novo; elle est mère de 04 enfants dont les trois derniers sont à sa charge: peniel agée de 20 ans est en formation d'opératrice de saisie, jacques agé de 18 ans est en classe de 2nde et luc agé de 16 ans est en classe de 3ème. Elle vit dans la maison de son feu mari avec ses enfants et pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, elle a crée un petit commerce de vente d' akassa, vu l'evolution de son activité et ayant trouvé une place au niveau d'une école pour vendre de la nourriture aux eleves, elle a sollicité ce pret.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 bags of corn and 2 bags of rice; 2 10 kg drums of beans

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank O. is 59 years old. He is married with five kids, 2 of whom who are still in school. Frank is a dealer in assorted paints, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, PVC pipes, and similar hardware at Tema, a town where he has lived with his family for nine years. He buys his supplies at wholesale prices from importers in the greater Accra of Ghana, and then sells to his customers at retail prices. 

Frank requests the loan to enable him procure increased stock of merchandise to accelerate business progress. With the loan, he hopes to increase his savings so that he can expand his shop to include the sale of cement. He would be very grateful for your support.

Frank is a member of the community group called the Angels Trust Group. In this group, members vouch for one another as social collateral to repay the loan. Frank's picture was taken at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of assorted paints, nails, sandpaper, hammers, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce Appiah is a 28-year-old single mother who takes good care of her home and child, who is currently in school. He is called Prince O., and he is a brilliant boy of whom his mother is very proud. She has operated a seamstress shop for the past seven years. She sews all forms of female clothing, wedding dresses, and funeral clothes, featuring various styles.  She trains one young lady in sewing to equip her with her skills and experience for her future career.

loans.use: To buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Philomène

texts.en:
Philomène H. was born on October 20, 1972 in Lokokoukoumè. She married Pierre Djoi and has 2 children. Her 12 year old twins are in seventh grade and Jean Pierre is 8 years old and in 3rd grade. She sells food on the platform across from the Tokplegbe Miners’ Brigade on the river. Now that she has become better acquainted with her clients, she wishes to expand her business by buying more supplies of rice, corn, fish, and oil.  
 
Dame H. Philomène, est née le 20 octobre 1972 à lokokoukoumè, elle est mariée à monsieur DJOI Pierre, et de cette union est sortie deux enfants firmin agé de 12 ans en classe de 5ème et Jean Pierre agé de 08 ans en classe de CM1. elle vend de la nourriture au bord de la voie en face de la brigarde des mineurs de Tokplegbe. Etant maintenant connue des riverains et pour faire face à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité son second pret.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 kg of rice, 3 bags of corn, fish, and oil

loans.name: Francisca Xavier Macuacua

texts.pt:
Francisca Xavier M. é natural da cidade de Maputo bairro Chamanculo, tem 32 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de três filhos com idade entre o primeiro com 10 anos e estuda na 6ªclasse, o segundo com 8 anos de idade e estudava na 3ªclasse e passou para 4ªclasse e o terceiro tem 5 anos e não estuda. Para alem dos filhos sustenta a sua mãe e um irmão enviando-os dinheiro mensalmente.

Francisca estudou até 9ªclasse e parou por ter se engravidada e pois parto começou o negocio para sustentar ao seu filho porque o pai não trabalhava e pelo tipo de negocio que lhe obriga andar muito pelas comunidades rurais a comprar os cabritos não conseguiu continuar com os estudos.

Francisca é negociante desde 1998, compra e vende caprinos, compra por 350,00mt e vende por 600,00mt; compra por 450,00mt e vende por 750,00mt e compra por 550,00mt e vende por 950,00mt. Assim tem um rendimento mensal de 12500,00mt e consegue poupar 2500,00mt por mês.

Para Francisca este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque para melhor responder a quadra festiva do fim do ano. Assim sonha em comprar um contentor afim de usar como um local fixo de venda deste animais.
texts.en:
Francisca Xavier M. is from the city of Maputo, neighborhood of Chamanculo, she is 32 years old, married with 3 children, who are 10, 8 and 5 years old. Besides her kids, she also supports her mother and brother sending them money monthly. Francisca didn’t finish school as she got pregnant and started a business after she gave birth because the father of her child didn’t work. She has to travel around communities in the interior in order to buy the goats, so she couldn’t keep studying. Francisca works buying and selling goats for profit since 1998. She gets a monthly profit of approximately 12500.00mt. and saves 2500.00mt a month. For Francisca this is her first loan in Hluvuku and Kiva, with the money she wants to increase her inventory to respond better to the demand of the end of the year holidays. She also dreams in buying a container to use it as a fixed place to sell her animals.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell goats at the Xipamanine market in the city of Maputo

loans.name: Petrona Natividad

texts.es:
La señora Petrona  Natividad López B. esta señora tiene la edad de 66 años, su estado civil es soltera, por lo que esta señora no tiene hijos solo 3 nietos que mantiene a su cargo un varón de 16 años que cursa recientemente el 4 año de secundaria, un niño de 10 años que cursa el 5 grado de primaria y una niña de 18 años que cursa el 2 año de farmacia, sus sueños son que Dios le pueda seguir proporcionando vida para ayudarle a sus nietos en la vida y para que el día de mañana ellos no sufran dificultades para el día de mañana, sus propósitos son de darle mejoras a su establecimiento para que este presente las condiciones adecuadas y necesarias.


El tiempo que esta señora tiene de poseer este negocio es de 30 años, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de granos básicos como lo es: arroz, azúcar, aceite, jugos y cosas para uso personal, su establecimiento esta ubicado en el mercado central  sus comienzos fueron desde hace mucho tiempo atrás e inicia con cosas pequeñas como: candelas, arroz, fríjol y aceite a medida del tiempo decide establecer su negocio y realizar la venta de granos básicos y ampliarlo mas por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar las compras de sus productos en las diferentes distribuidoras y también satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Petrona Natividad L. B. is a 66 year old single woman. She has three grandchildren that she supports: a boy of 16 years who is in his fourth year of high school, a boy of 10 years who is in fifth grade, and a girl of 18 years who is her second year of pharmacy school. Her dream is for God to continuing providing for her and her grandchildren in their lives. Also, she dreams about having no difficulties one day. Her goal is to give more to her business because it is what provides them with good conditions and necessities. She has had her business for 30 years, a financial endeavor selling basic grains such as rice, sugar, oil, juices, and personal products. Her business is located in the central market. She started it a long time ago with small items such as candels, rice, beans, and oil. Over time, she decided to grow her business and begin selling basic grains. She will grow her sales by attaining the working capital necessary to purchase the products from various distributors that will satisfy the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine U. is 40 years old. She is married and has three kids who are currently in school. She is a retailer of Chinese herbal medicine. She buys from her Chinese suppliers at Spintex Road in Accra and retails the herb products to her customers. As a result of her rich persuasion skills, she has built up the trust and confidence of the numerous clients who come to buy medicine from her.  She enjoys her trade very much; however, she does not have adequate funds to support her business, especially with the current hikes in the wholesale cost of herbal drugs. 

She therefore needs the loan to remain in business. With the loan, she wants to purchase new stock of herbal medicine to serve her customers. She believes the loan would enable her to save more to finance her kids’ education and also to build her own shop. She is a member of the community group called The Ark Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taken when she was visited.

loans.use: To buy wholesale Chinese herbal medicine supplies

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine Ahiadzro is a 35-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and has three kids, two of whom attend school. She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku, and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and is served with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is served with hot peppers or soup. She says that prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditures. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood to prepare the meals. She would be grateful for such assistance. She is a member of the community group called The Ark Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taken when she was visited.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood for food production.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce K. is 27 years old and is married, with two kids who are currently in school. She sells food stuffs like cassava, snails, and maize in the local market of Accra where she lives. Joyce treks to the farming communities to buy her food stuffs in order to avoid dealing with middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell at very high prices.

Joyce K. is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her kids with a quality education for their future careers. With the loan, she wants to purchase increased stock of cassava, snails, and maize. Snails are reptiles and they are used to prepare soup; because of the cost, it is a food mostly enjoyed by the rich. She is a member of the borrowing group called The Ark Trust Group. In this group, members provide support to one another in handling repayment. She would be grateful for this loan. Her picture was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase bulk stock of cassava and maize for resale.

loans.name: Ma De Lourdes Lorenza

texts.es:
Maria de Lourdes tiene una estética llama  AIDE la cual la ha trabajado por un lapso de 10 años. Por lo cual le ha ido muy bien, ahora se ve en la necesidad de recurrir  a nosotros para pedir un préstamo para surtir la  estética de mercancía como químicos y utensilios. Nos solicita la cantidad de $7,000 pesos.
La señora  Maria se quiere preparar para esta época navideña la cual es muy solicitada para peinados, tintes, cortes y  planchado de cabello.

Su esposo tiene un taller de refrigeración y entre los dos aportan dinero para el sustento de la familia y con estos ingresos podrán pagar el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Maria de Lourdes has a beauty salon named AIDE that she has worked at for the past 10 years. It has gone very well and now she asks for a loan to supply the beauty salon with more merchandise such as chemical products and beauty appliances. She asks for an amount of 7,000 pesos. Maria wants to prepare for the Christmas season by supplying products in demand like brushes, hair dyes, hair cuts, and hair straightening. Her husband has a refrigeration shop and together they make enough money to support their family and with this income, they will be able to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chemical products and beauty appliances

loans.name: Gerardo German

texts.es: El señor Gerardo M. P. fue criado en la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, en la panadería de sus padres, como ellos ya son ancianos pensaban dejarlo a cargo de la panadería para que continúe con la tradición familiar; pero el demostró poco interés por hacerse cargo del negocio familiar, ya que  desde muy pequeño que le gusta arreglar las radios viejas, televisores, etc. Es por ello que se da cuenta de que su vocación es arreglar aparatos eléctricos. Con el paso de los años empieza trabajar como ayudante en un pequeño taller de la zona Norte de la ciudad, desde entonces ha ahorrado de a poco para adquirir un pequeño local en alquiler con el esfuerzo propio y sin el apoyo familiar. Hoy con 46 años de edad y con una experiencia de de 23 años en el rubro, solicita el préstamo para adecuar su taller a las necesidades de su oficio, al mismo tiempo necesita de capital para equipar su pequeño taller. Trabaja día a día pensando en ampliar su taller.
texts.en:
Gerardo M. P. grew up in La Paz, Bolivia in the bread shop of his parents. Now that his parents are old, they are thinking about leaving the bread shop to him so that he can carry on the family tradition. However, he has demonstrated little interest to take on this task because he has liked to fix radios, televisions, etc. since he was very young. Because of this, he realized that his career should be in fixing electronics. For many years, he worked as an assistant in a small rented workshop in the North zone of the city. Since then, he has saved little by little to establish a shop on his own without family support. With an age 46 years and 23 years of local experience, he requests this loan to adapt his shop to the necesities of the job. At the same time, he needs capital to equip his small workshop. Each day that he works, he thinks about growing his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip his workshop

loans.name: Mohammad Sadiq

texts.en:
Mohammad Sadiq may be an old, uneducated man, but he has a great deal of experience in retail. Indeed, he has been operating a retail shop for more than 10 years in Kabul. In the past, he worked in the agriculture industry. For the past 10 years, he has been responsible for generating sufficient income to support his family.

He has been unsuccessful for some time now in securing financing to enlarge his shop, so he was thrilled to learn of AFSG in Kabul. He is now seeking a loan in the amount of 50,000 Afghans ($1,075) over an 18-month term to enlarge his shop and to thereby improve his business. In turn, he hopes to increase his income to better support his family.

Mohammad wants to thank lenders around the world and to thank both Kiva and AFSG for this fantastic process whereby entrepreneurs like him can request loans. He states that he could not have asked for a better program in Afghanistan, and he hopes that many other of his fellow countrymen and countrywomen utilize the program to enable them to make a better life for themselves.

loans.use: To improve his retail business by enlarging his shop

loans.name: Alina

texts.es:
La señora Alina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en el Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 123, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y uno  que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de albañilería. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad vende gaseosas y se dedica a su hogar y a administrar su negocio. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 10 cajas de gaseosas Kola Real, agua mineral, etc.

Alina esta muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que la apoyan, en especial con el banco comunal de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Alina belongs to the community bank "Beautiful View" located in Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 123, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 48 years old, married, and a mother of 3 children, two of who are now adults and one who is still her dependant. Her husband works as a bricklayer. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos in the amount of S/. 300, she decided to invest in food sales. She has been working with the community bank for two years. Currently, she sells sodas and dedicates herself to her home and operating her business. With this loan of S/. 2,500, to be paid back in 5 months, she will buy 10 boxes of Kola Real sodas, mineral water, etc. Alina is very appreciative of every person that supports her, especially the community bank Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 10 boxes of Kola Real sodas, mineral water, etc.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Amanda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en el PSJ. Coronel Bustamante Nº 157, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 46 años D. edad, es madre soltera con 3 hijos, 2 mayores D. edad y uno que aún dependen D. ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. gaseosas. 

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta D. comida y bebidas. En las mañanas va al mercado a comprar lo necesario para preparar sus deliciosos platos D. comida. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 10 pollos, 9 kilos D. carne, 7 kilos D. arroz, 4 paquetes D. gaseosas, etc.

Amanda se siente contenta porque pertenece a un banquito D. mujeres luchadoras y  trabajadoras, que tienen el deseo D. seguir triunfando en la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amanda belongs to the community bank of Bellavista, located in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 46 years old, single mother of 3 children, 2 of them are adults and one of them is still a dependant. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 she bought sodas. Currently she sells food and sodas. She goes to the market in the morning to buy supplies to prepare her delicious meals. With the loan she is requesting of S/.3,000, which will be paid in 5 months, she will buy 10 chickens, 9 kilos of meat, 7 kilos of rice and 4 packs of sodas, etc. Amanda is happy to belong to a bank of hard working women and wants to enjoy life.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 chickens, 9 kilos of meat, 7 kilos of rice and 4 packs of sodas, etc.

loans.name: Jose Salomon

texts.es:
El señor José Salomón López tiene la edad de39 años, su estado civil es casado, este señor tiene 4 hijos sus edades son las siguientes un varón de 6 años que cursa el 1 grado de primaria, su otro hijo es un varón de 12 años que cursa el 6 grado de primaria y una mujer de 17 años que cursa el 4 año de primaria, su esposa labora también en lo que es la sastrería, sus sueños son de mantener activo su negocio y de darle mejoras a su vivienda ya que esta es una de las prioridades que el tiene debido a que sus hijas están creciendo y necesita ofrecerle un espacio que sea propiedad de ellas y en sus propósitos esta el de seguir ayudando a su familia que tanto lo necesita.


su actividad económica es la sastrería, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 15 años, su ubicación es en león rpto Varela 3 calle, su negocio inicia por sus padres quienes fueron los encargados de que el aprendiera este oficio y fue así como empezó a la edad de 12 años su mama tenia un taller y el contribuía con este taller mas tarde decide independizarse y formar su propio negocio por lo que lo realiza con su esposa quien es la que le brinda ayuda y también tiene conocimiento en este negocio y es así como tiene este negocio el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita invertir mas en su negocio para la compra de hilo, zipper, agujas y telas por lo que la compra al por mayor le resulta de manera mas factible.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Salomon L. is 39 years old; he is married and has three children of 6, 12 and a daughter of 17 years old. His wife works as a seamstress with him. He dreams of keeping his business active and improving his house because his children are growing and needs to provides them with a space that belongs to them and wants to keep on helping his family. He has been working as a tailor for the past 15 years. He started because his parents taught him the business when he was 12 years old at hi mother’s atelier. He decides to work independently later on and currently works with his wife who knows the business well too. He is requesting this loan for working capital because he needs to invest more on buying treads, zippers, needles and clothes at wholesale prices.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas”, ubicado en el Jr. Masisea Mz. A Lt. 26, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años de edad, es madre soltera con 8 hijos mayores de edad. Beatriz. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de agua. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio. En su casa tiene un tanque de agua, el cual le permite brindar todos lo días a sus vecinos y amigos agua a sus hogares.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 20 tubos, 2 docenas de codos para tubos, 6 pegamentos, limpieza de tanque, etc.

Beatriz se siente contenta porque todo lo que ha logrado es gracias a su esfuerzo y voluntad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Beatriz belongs to the community bank of Las Tigresas, located in the district of Yarinacocha, department of Ucayali. She is 62 years old, single mother of 8 children who are all adults now. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of $/.300 she invested on selling water. She has 4 years working with the community bank. She has the same business currently. She has a tank of water at her house and sells it to her neighbors and friends for theirs homes. With the S/.1,700 loan she is requesting which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy 20 tubs, and 2 dozen of connectors, 6 glues and cleaning supplies, etc. Beatriz feels happy because all she has obtained is due to her effort and will.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 tubs, and 2 dozen of connectors, 6 glues and cleaning supplies, etc.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Su nombre es Ana Cecilia T. R. tiene  la edad de 38 años, su estado civil es soltera, esta señora no tiene hijos, por lo que sus propósitos son de ampliar su negocio y en sus deseos esta el ampliar su negocio y su vivienda  como es pintar su vivienda y darle las condiciones necesarias para que esta sea un lugar acogedor para ella y su mama ya que el lugar donde reside es en la casa de habitación de su mama por lo que ella sueña seguirle proporcionando mantenimiento a su vivienda para que en un futuro esta no tenga problemas y este acondicionada de la mejor forma.



Su actividad económica a la que dedica es la venta de golosinas, artículos para el hogar venta de granos básicos y venta de refrescos y gaseosa, el tiempo que tiene en este negocio es de 6 años, la ubicación de su establecimiento es en su casa de habitación en león Bo subtiava, tamarindo ½ cuadra al este, en sus inicios decide establecer una venta de golosinas y refrescos por cuenta propia tenia ciertos clientes pero en esa misma cuadra estaban 2 pulperías de las cuales no pudieron mantenerse y ella deseaba invertir en mas productos y mas tarde lo efectúa, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo razón por la que  decide recurrir a su mano amiga como lo es la Fundación León 2000 y otras organizaciones por lo que desea ampliarse aun mas para la compra de juguetes y ropa debido a las fechas festivas que se aproximan.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia T. Ruis is 38 years old and is single, she has no children. Her purpose is to improve her business and her house, to turn it on a welcoming home for her and her mother. She currently lives at her mother’s one room house, and she wants to keep supporting her mom and provide her of a home without any problems. She works selling candy, home supplies, grains and sodas for the past 6 years. Her grocery store is located on her one room house. She started by herself selling candy and sodas but she had 2 other grocery stores as competition, so she wants a loan to invest on buying more products to increase her supplies and buy toys and clothes because of the coming holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en Republica de Panamá Nº 159, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad cuenta con una cerrajería en casa, el cual le brinda ganancias. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo para la administración de su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 4 kilos de soldadura y 6 latas de pintura.

Gracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha mejorado. Ahora tendrá la oportunidad de apoyar sus menores hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cecilia belongs to the community bank of Bellavista located in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 30 years old and has 2 children who are still young, she is married and her husband works as an independent contractor. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos for $/.300 she invested it buying candy. She has 4 years working with the community bank. Currently has a hardware store at her house, which provides good profit. She also has the support of her husband managing the store. With the loan of S/.1,000 which will be paid in 5 months, she will buy 4 kilos of iron and 6 cans of paint. Thanks to Manuela Ramos her business has improved and she will have the chance to help her little children.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 kilos of iron and 6 cans of paint.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en la Urbanización: El Triunfo Mz. H Lt. 20, distrito D. Manantay, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 42 años D. edad, es madre D. 3 hijos, 2 mayores D. edad y uno que aún depenD. D. ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo D. una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. churros. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio. Trabaja D. Lunes a Sábado D. 7 a.m. a 5 p.m., lo cual le permite obtener ganancias para poder pagar su préstamo puntualmente.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 15 kilos D. harina, 2 kilos D. azúcar, 1 litro D. vainilla, 1 paqueta D. levadura, etc.

Celia es una mujer que sonríe día a día por todas las cosas buenas que le pasan en la vida. Agradece al banco comunal por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Señora Celia belongs to the Bellavista Communal Bank located in El Triunfo Mz development. H Lt. 20, Manantay District, Coronel Portillo Province, Ucayali Department. She is 42 and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are grown and one still dependent on her. She is married and her husband drives a motorized cart. With her first loan through Manuela Ramos of $100 she decided to invest in churro sales (a doughnut-like fried confection). She has been working for a year with the communal bank and currently operates the same business. She works from Monday through Saturday from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m., which allows her to earn enough to pay her loan punctually. With this loan of $425, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 15 kilos of flour, 2 kilos of sugar, 1 liter of vanilla, 1 package of yeast, etc. Celia is a woman who smiles day after day for all the good things that come to her in life. She is grateful to the communal bank for the help it has given to her.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 kilos of flour, 2 kilos of sugar, 1 liter of vanilla, 1 package of yeast, etc.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
Su nombre es Félix Pedro Téllez su edad es de 45 años, su  estado es  civil casado este señor tiene 4 hijos todos trabajan por cuenta propia, su compañera de vida labora no labora, Don Félix tiene sus propósitos como lo es mantener su negocio activo por lo que es necesario para el generar ingresos para su familia, sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una casa propia para que el día de mañana no tengan problemas y puedan tener su propio lugar.


La actividad a la que este señor se dedica la venta de gaseosa y cervezas, la ubicación de su establecimiento es en su casa de habitaron en león comarca sagrado corazón de Jesús Km. 77 carretera León- Managua, el tiempo  que tiene de  poseer  este negocio es de 8 años, el inicia este negocio por motivación propia por lo que empezó con la venta de gaseosa al principio  este negocio no le proporcionaba afluencia de clientes por lo que decido introducir otro producto como lo fue la venta de cerveza y cigarrillos así obtuvo  mas afluencia de clientes y es entonces que decide dedicarse a la venta de estos productos el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que el necesita abastecerse de estos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
His name is Félix Pedro Téllez, his age is 45, he is married. This gentleman has 4 children, all working for themselves. His life companion does not work. Don Félix plans to keep his business active enough to generate income for his family. His dreams are that his children would have their own homes so that in the future there would not be problems and they would have their own places. This man sells soft drinks and beers. His establishment is located in his home in the Sacred Heart of Jesus Region Km. 77 León- Managua Highway. He has had this business for 8 years. He started the business through his own motivation, in the beginning selling soft drinks. Since this did not draw a huge clientele, he decided to introduce other products, selling beer and cigarettes, which drew a larger clientele. Therefore he decided to sell these products. The financing is for working capital, because he needs to stock up on these products to offer to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Clara Elena

texts.es:
La señora Clara pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en el Jr. José Olaya Mz. O Lt. 36, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos, 5 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de queso. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una motokar de carga. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo para manejar su herramienta de trabajo. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 2 llantas, 2 focos, arreglará el motor, etc. 

Clara agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda brindada, porque gracias a ello la estabilidad económica de su familia ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Señora Clara belongs to the “El Paraíso” communal bank located on Jr. José Olaya Mz. O Lt. 36, Yarinacocha District, Coronel Portillo Province, Ucayali Department. She is 54, the mother of 6 children, 5 grown and one still dependent on her. She is married, her husband drives a motor cart. With the first loan she got from the Manuela Ramos organization of $100, she decided to invest in cheese sales. She has been working with the communal bank for 4 years. Currently she owns a freight motor cart. She has the help of her husband to drive her work vehicle. With this loan of $975, which will be repaid in 6 months, the will buy 2 tires, 2 headlights, she will have the engine repaired, etc. Clara is thankful to the Manuela Ramos organization for the help it has given her, because thanks to it, the economic stability of her family has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 tires, 2 headlights, have the engine repaired, etc.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela  hace aproximadamente 8 años, que pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo- Puno. Tiene 41 años, es madre   de 03 hijos que mantiene sola por que su esposo falleció  hace 6 años, lo que la motivo a seguir trabajando sin descansar para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro 01 toro para engorde. 
 En la actualidad  tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa del centro poblado de Chimbo al mismo tiempo continua con la crianza de ganado vacuno.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 5 cuotas invertirá en la compra de productos para la Navidad. Como juguetes, regalos, adornos, panteones, etc.

Graciela desea obtener mas ganancias con sus negocios y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Graciela has belonged for 8 years to the "Holy Spirit" Communal Bank of the town of Chimbo, district and province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 41 and the mother of 3 children whom she supports alone since her husband passed away 6 years ago. This motivates her to keep working without a rest to help her children get ahead. With the first loan of $100 she bought one bull to fatten. Currently she has a small grocery shop in her house in town of Chimbo, at the same time continuing to raise cattle. With this loan of $975 that she will repay in 5 installments she will invest in Christmas products such as toys, gifts, decorations, pantheons, etc. Graciela wants greater earnings from her businesses to help her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Christmas products such as toys, gifts, decorations, etc.

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
La señora Clara pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en la Av. San Fernando Nº 771,  distrito de Manantay, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años de edad, es madre de 8 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de frutas. Tiene 10 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de plátano, aguaje, limón y cuenta con 2 motokar como herramienta de trabajo. Estos negocios le brindan ganancias para pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará un saco de aguaje, dos racimos de plátanos, un ciento de limón, dos llantas, una docena de rodaje, 2 carburadores, etc.

Clara está muy contenta por todo lo que ha logrado en esta vida. Agradece a todas las personas que están cerca de ella.
texts.en:
Señora Clara belongs to the El Paraiso Communal Bank on Avenue San Fernando Nº 771, Manantay district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali Department. She is 31, the mother of 8 grown children, and married to a self-employed husband. With the first loan of $100 that she received from the Manuela Ramos organization, she decided to invest in fruit sales. She has been working with the communal bank for 10 years. Currently she sells bananas, aguaje fruit, lemons and has 2 motor carts for her work. These businesses provide earnings to pay back her loan punctually. With this loan of $500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy a sack of aguaje fruit, two bunches of bananas, one hundred lemons, two wheels, a dozen gears, 2 carburetors, etc. Clara is very happy with everything she has achieved in this life. She is grateful to everyone close to her.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of aguaje fruit, two bunches of bananas, one hundred lemons, two wheels, a dozen gears, 2 carburetors, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres con fe y esperanza" is the name of a group which is looking to receive their first loan. Each member is living in extreme poverty and does not have a source of consistent income. Fortunately, the group members learned about Kiva and the assistance being provided through Kiva to aspiring entrepreneurs. Accordingly, each member took part in many meetings and workshops to develop their respective business plans.

Casilda is the representative of this group. She plans on operating a small business in her neighborhood where she will sell clothing, but she hopes to have her own store someday. She notes that she has always been a good seamstress, and that she has made clothing for her children. As a result, she will utilize these skills to create a successful business because she feels that she can truly excel in this field. She is a very hard-working woman, and she is extremely excited about this opportunity. She dreams of sending her children to college, and she wants nothing more than to give her children a chance to break out of poverty. Indeed, she wants to give her children every opportunity possible: this is the first step in reaching that dream, and she is ready to take the step!

loans.use: To start a clothing business by purchasing materials in order to make clothing

loans.name: Elgiba

texts.es:
La señora Elgiba pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en el PSJ. Pedro Portillo Nº 152 “Urbanización Petro Perú”, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 57 años D. edad, es madre D. 6 hijos, 5 mayores D. edad y uno que aún depenD. D. ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja el la empresa MAPLE, la cual produce petróleo D. calidad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. gaseosas. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad se dedica al mismo negocio. Tiene el apoyo D. su familia en especial D. su esposo.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 10 cajas D. gaseosas, 4 paquetes D. agua mineral, etc.

Elgiba agradece al banco comunal por la ayuda brindada. Tiene el deseo D. ampliar más su negocio para mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elgiba belongs to the "Bellavista"Communal Bank, located in Pedro Portillo Nº 152 at the "Petro Peru"urban development, Calleria district, in the Colonel Portillo province, of the Ucayali department. She is 57 years old an a mother of 6 children, 5 of age and one that still depends on her. She is married and her husband works in a company called MAPLE, which produces quality oil. With the first loan of $97 granted by Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in selling sodas drinks. She has been working with the communal bank for the past 4 years. At present she still has the same business. She has the support of her family especially from her husband. With this loan of $975, which will be repaid over a period of 5 months, she will buy 10 boxes of sodas drinks and 4 packs of mineral water. Elgiba is grateful for the help provided by the communal bank. Her wish is to expand her business and improve her economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 10 boxes of sodas drinks and 4 packs of mineral water.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La señora Elisa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas”, ubicado en el Jr. Bolívar Nº 335, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera con 2 hijos, uno mayor de edad y otro que aún depende de ella. Merly. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se encuentra enferma. Trabaja en el puesto de salud 9 de Octubre. Cuenta con 2 motokar, los que hace trabajar todos los días para así aumentar sus ganancias.
