Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 4 llantas, arreglará el motor, tapizará los asientos, etc.

Gracias a su habilidad ha logrado tener sus dos movilidades para mejorar su estabilidad económica y apoyar a su menor hija.
texts.en:
Elisa belongs to the "Las Tigresas" Community bank, located of Jr. Bolivar number 335 in the Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, in the department of Ucayaali. She is a 45 year old single mother with two children, one who is grown, and another (Merly) who still depends on her for support. With the first 300 sol loan that she received from Manuela ramos, she invested in the purchase of beauty products. She has been working with the community bank for 4 years. Currently, she is ill. She works in the 9 de Octubre health clinic. She has two motokars which she has working daily to earn money. With this loan of 3000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase 4 tires, fix an engine, upholster the seats, etc. Thanks to her skill she has been able to acquire two vehicles to improve her economic stability and to support her minor daughter.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 tires, repair engine, upholster seats, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, ubicado en el Jr. Huancavelica Nº 457, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 59 años D. edad, es madre D. 6 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja en la Municipalidad D. Coronel Portillo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. comida. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio D. alquiler D. habitaciones, brindando hospicio a todas las personas que lo necesitan. Este negocio le brinda grandes ganancias para pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará un ciento D. madera, 6 latas D. pintura, clavos, todo para la infraestructura D. sus habitaciones. 

Gracias a Manuela Ramos, su negocio ha crecido. Agradece a Dios por todas las cosas buenas que le han pasado en la vida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the "La Positiva" community bank, located at Jr. Huancavelica Nº 457, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, in the Ucayali department. She is a 59 year old mother of 6 grown children. She is married to her husband who works for the city of Coronel Portillo. With the first loan of 300 soles which she received from Manuela Ramos she decided to invest in food sales. She has been working with the community bank for 5 years. Currently she has a business renting rooms, giving lodging to all who require it. This business gives her plenty of profit to pay her loan on time. With this 1,500 sol loan, which she will repay in 5 month, she will purchase 100 soles of wood, 6 cans of paint, nails, and everything needed for the infrastructure of the rooms. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, her business has grown. She thanks God for all of the good things that have happened to her in her life.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood, paint, nails, etc.

loans.name: Encarna

texts.es:
La señora Encarna pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Divinas”, ubicado en la Urbanización Municipal Mz. A-2 Lt. 15, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 63 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos, 2 mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa y por las noches vende pollo broaster. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo y de su hijo Loser. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 3 cajas de leche, 2 cajas de vinagre y sillao, 1 saco de azúcar, etc.

Encarna es feliz porque tiene una familia unida. Agradece a Dios por toda la felicidad que siempre le brinda.
texts.en:
Encarna belongs to the “Las Divinas” community bank, which is located in Urbanización Municipal Mz. A-2 Lt. 15, in the Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, in the Ucayali department. She is a 63 year old mother of 6 children; 2 of whom are grown. She is married, and her husband works independently in his job. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in food sales. She has been working with the community bank for 4 years. Currently she has a small convenience store in her home, and in the evenings she sells roasted chickens. She has the support of her husband and her son Loser. With this 3000 sol loan, which will be paid in 6 months, she will purchase 1 bag of rice, 3 boxes of mil, 2 boxes of vinegar and soy sauce, 1 bag of sugar, etc. Encarna is happy because her family is together. She is grateful to God for all of the happiness in her life.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 1 bag of rice, 3 boxes of milk, 2 boxes of vinegar and soy sauce, one bag of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Esmeralda pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, ubicado en el Jr. Cerro de Pazco Nº 249, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de odontología. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de joyas. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de productos de bellezas. Se dedica a su hogar y a la administración de su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará perfumes, talos para cuerpos, colonias para bebes y niños, etc. 

Esmeralda se siente contenta por todas las cosas buenas que le pasan. Gracias a su habilidad su estabilidad económica ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Esmeralda belongs to the “La Positiva” community bank, located at Jr. Cerro de Pazco Nº 249, Yarinacocha district, Coronel Portillo province, in the Ucayali province. She is the 36 year old mother of 3 minor children who she still cares for. She is married, and her husband works as a dentist. With the first loan of 300 soles which she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in jewelery sales. She has been working with the community bank for 6 years. Currently she works selling beauty products. She works running her business, and as a homemaker. With this 1000 sol loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase perfume, body powder, scented lotions for babies and children, etc. Esmeralda is please with all of the good things that have happened to her. Thanks to her skill, her stability has improved.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfume, body powder, scented lotions for babies and children, etc..

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
La señora Estrella pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en el Jr. José Olaya Mz. L Lt. 16, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, uno mayor de edad y otro que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en el Ministerio de Agricultura, es Técnico Forestal. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de golosinas, bebidas y productos de belleza, lo cual le brinda ganancias para poder pagar su préstamo con puntualidad. 

Con este préstamo de S/.  3,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 2 cajas de galletas, 2 paquetes de gaseosas, 1 paquete de agua mineral, 5 bolsas de caramelos, colonias, etc. 

Gracias al banco comunal su negocio ha crecido, ahora tendrá la oportunidad de darle una mejor educación a su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Estrella belongs to the “El Paraíso” community bank, located at Jr. José Olaya Mz. L Lt. 16, Yarinacocha district, Coronel Portillo province, in the Ucayali department. She is 39 years old, and is the mother of 2 children - who is independent, and the other who is still a minor. She is married, and her husband works for the ministry of agriculture as a forestry technician. With her initial loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos she decided to invest in beauty products. She has been working for 4 years with the community bank. Currently she works selling snacks, drinks, and beauty products, which earns her enough profit to pay her loans on time. With this 3000 sol loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase 2 boxes of cookies, 2 packages of soft drinks, 1 package of mineral water, 5 bags of caramels, cologne, etc. Thanks to the community bank, her business has grown, and now she will be able to offer a better education to her son.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 boxes of cookies, 2 packages of soft drinks, 1 package of mineral water, 5 bags of caramels, cologne, etc.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
La  señora Eleuteria es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz D. Cacorco”  del distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Asistió al Programa D. Alfabetización durante 6 meses. Tiene 50 años, es madre D. 6 hijos, 2 casados y 4 que aun mantiene, es casada, su esposo trabaja con ella en el negocio D. compra y venta D. granos D. la región (habas). Con el préstamo  D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles que recibió D. Manuela Ramos compro habas D. Bolivia para luego vender en Yunguyo, negocio que continua actualmente.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 800.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara 2 sacos D. habas.

Ella desea trabajar para seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eleuteria is a partner in the “Santa Cruz D. Cacorco” community bank, located in the Copani district, in the Yunguyo-Puno province. She attended the 6 month literacy program. She is 50 years old, and is the mother of 6 children. 2 of her children are married, and she continues to support the remaining 4. Her husband works with her buying and selling local grains (Lima beans). With the 500 sol loan that she received, she purchased Lima beans in Bolivia to sell in Yunguyo, a business that she continues to engage in. With this 800 sol loan, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will purchase 2 bags of Lima beans. She wants to work to continue supporting her children.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 bags of Lima beans.

loans.name: Evila

texts.es:
La señora Evila pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas”, ubicado en la Carretera Federico Basadre Nº 5800, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como mecánico de motos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en una peluquería. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de plásticos y lencería, viaja a la cuidad de lima a comprar su mercadería para vender a sus clientes.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará ¼ de ropa interior, ½ decena de bandejas, 1 docena de jarras, etc.

Evila agradece a su familia por apoyarla en todo momento y al banco comunal por confiar en su persona.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evila belongs to the “Las Tigresas” Communal Bank , located in the Highway Federico Basadre Nº 5800, district of Callería, in the Colonel Portillo province of the Ucayali department. She is 52 years old. She is a mother of 3 children of age. She is married and her husband works as a motorbike mechanic. With the first loan of $97 granted by Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in a hairdressing salon. She has been working with the communal bank for the past 2 years. At present she sells plastics and lingerie, and she travels to Lima city to buy the merchandise she sells to her clients. With this loan of $325, which will be repaid over a period of 6 months, she will buy ¼ dozen pieces of lingerie, ½ dozen trays and 1 dozen pitchers, etc. Evila is grateful for the support her family has given her at all times and to the communal bank for trusting her.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ¼ dozen pieces of lingerie,  ½ dozen trays and 1 dozen pitchers, etc.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El joven  de nombre Julio Cesar B. B. tiene la edad de 30 años su estado civil es casado,  tiene 1 hijo que tiene la edad de 4 años y cursa recientemente el 1 nivel de primaria, su compañera de vida labora en la venta de medicamentos, sus propósitos son crecer en el mercado y predominar de forma que pueda establecerse obteniendo así los ingresos necesarios para ayudar a su familia en sus deseos esta el proporcionarle  a su hijo un futuro de estudios donde pueda desempeñarse y también obtener una casa para su hijo para que el día de mañana no tenga problemas.


Su actividad económica es la venta de medicamentos como lo es: aspirina, sueros, antigripales y otros, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, la forma en como inicia es por cuenta propia  y decide comenzar con 60 productos y la forma en como los realiza es de forma ambulante en las diferentes farmacias de León  y con los ingresos que obtenía de las compras de estos medicamentos es que llega a incrementarse  y es así como recurre a la ayuda de su esposa y ambos trabajan en lo mismo, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado en la compra de mas producto por lo que necesita entregar los encargos que recibe y debido a al eficacia que el da por medio de sus servicios es que sus clientes lo prefieren, es por eso que dice estar agradecido con Fundación León 2000 y otras organizaciones por brindarle esta ayuda en este financiamiento.
texts.en:
The young man named Julio Cesar B. B. is 30 years old. He is married and he has one son who is 4 years old. He is studying first level of primary school. His life partner works selling medicines. His goal is to grow in the market and establish himself obtaining the necessary income to help his family. Among his desires is to be able to pay the school for this son and provide him with a house so he doesn't need to struggle in the future. His economic activity is the sale of medicines like aspirin, saline solutions, anti-flu among others. He has had this business for 4 years. He is still selling these products the same way now like when he first started. He is a hawker and he sells his products to different pharmacies in the city of León. With the profits from the sales, he was able to grow and then asked his wife for help and now they both sell medicines. The loan will be use as a working capital to buy more products in order to supply the orders he has. Due to the efficacy of his services, his clients prefer him. He is grateful to Foundacion León 2000 and other organizations for helping him get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Nueva Ilusion Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el grupo Nueva Ilusion, todas somos mujeres muy luchadoras, responsables y con muchos deseos de superarnos, nuestra meta es poder hacer crecer nuestros negocios para tener mejores ganancias y asi poder optar a una mejor calidad de vida para nosotras, nuestros esposos e hijos, para nosotras la familia es lo mas importante y tenemos que sacar nuestras familias adelante, nuestras actividades son:
Gloria L.: soy la coordinadora del grupo y tengo 5 años de tener mi negocio que es la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, mi negocio tiene bastante demanda ya que las tortillas son un alimento indispensable en nuestras comidas.
Eloisa Z.: ella tiene una venta de golosinas, ya dias que tiene su negocio, ella necesita el credito para acondicionar mejor su negocio, compra de utencilios para hacer las comidas.
Cyntia R.: ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de Baleadas, este tipo de comida es muy vendido en nuestro pais, ya que las baleadas se comen en el desayuno y la cena.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the "Nueva Ilusion" group. We all are hard-working, responsible women with a big desire to do better in life. Our goal is to be able to make our business grow and have better profits and like that be able to choose a better quality of life for us, our husbands and our children. Family is the most important thing for us and we want to support them. Our activities are: Gloria L.: I am the coordinator of the group and I had the business of production and sales of tortillas for 5 years. My business has quite a lot of demand since tortillas are an indispensable food in our meals. Eloisa Z.: She sells candies. She needs the loan to condition better her business and buy the utensils to make the candies. Cyntia R.: She makes and sells Baleadas (flour tortillas filled with mashed fried beans), this type of meal is very popular in our country, since baleadas are eaten during breakfast and dinner.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for the production of corn and wheat tortillas and buy the ingredients to make candies.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas”, ubicado en el Jr. Río Santiago s/n, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer de carros grandes. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta ropa y productos de belleza. Se dedica a su hogar y a su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 7 docenas de blusas, 6 docenas de pantalón, 5 docenas de faldas, colonias, perfumes y otros.

Francisca manifiesta que la ayuda recibida de Manuela Ramos es muy gratificante. Agradece a Dios por cuidar de ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca belongs to the "Las Tigresas" Communal Bank, located in Rio Santiago, district of Callería, in the Colonel Portillo province of the Ucayali department. She is 51 years old, she is a mother of 4 children of age. She is married and her husband works as chauffeur of big cars. With the first loan of $95 granted by Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in selling clothes. She has been working with the communal bank for 3 years. At present, she sells clothes and beauty products. She is devoted to her home and business. With this loan of $975, which will be repaid over a period of 6 months, she will buy 7 dozens blouses, 6 dozens trousers, 5 dozens skirts, cologne, perfumes and others. Francisca tells us that help received from Manuela Ramos is very gratifying. She is grateful to God for taking care of her.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 7 dozens blouses, 6 dozens trousers, 5 dozens skirts, cologne, perfumes and others.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Miguel F. me dedico a la venta de frutas y verduras, tengo 42 años de edad, tengo 4 hijos, a parte de las frutas y verduras tamebien vendo huevos, palomitas de maiz y golosinas de galletas y confites, tengo varios años de tener mi negocio el cual me ayuda mucho a contribuir con los gastos de mi hogar, tengo muchas ganas de superarme y hacer crecer mi negocio, por tal razon es que estoy solicitando credito para poder inyectarle capital y asi tener variedad de productos y un mejor negocio. en estas epocas de navidad se vende mucho las manzanas y las uvas quiero comprar varias cajas de este producto para poder venderlas.
texts.en:
Hello my name is Miguel F., I sell fruit and vegetables. I'm 42 years old and I have 4 children. Besides selling fruit and vegetables, I also sell eggs, popcorn, cookies candies and regular candies. I have had my business for several years now, which helps me to support my home with the expenses. I really want to do better for myself and make my business grow. For this reason, I am requesting a loan to be able to inject capital to my business and have a larger variety of products and a better business. During this Christmas season apples and grapes sell a lot, so I want to buy several boxes of these products to be able to sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Geidy Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Geidy pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, ubicado en el Jr. Huancavelica Nº 457, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años de edad, es madre de un hijo menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en el Hospital de Yarina en el área Administrativa. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de bellezas. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad es profesora de Educación Secundaria y cuenta con el mismo negocio, pero aún no ejerce su carrera. En las mañanas se dedica a su hogar y por las tardes reparte sus productos a sus clientes.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará colonias, talcos, cremas de manos y cuerpo, lápiz labial, etc. 

Geidy agradece muy en especial al banco comunal de Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que siempre le brinda.
texts.en:
Geidy belongs to the “La Positiva” comunal bank, located on Huancavelica Street, No. 457, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 24 years old and she is the mother of a young child who still depends on her. She is married and her husband works in the Yarina Hospital in administration. With the first loan S/. 300.00 she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in selling beauty products. She has been working with the communal bank for one year. She is currently a high school teacher and has her business, but she still doesn’t work in her area of study. In the mornings she takes care of her home, and in the afternoons she sells her products to her clients. With this loan of S/. 1,200.00, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy colognes, talc powders, hand and body lotions, lipstick, etc. Geidy is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos communal bank for the help it always provides to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy colognes, talc powders, hand and body lotions, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Cacorco”  ubicado en el  Distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 35 años y es madre de 03 hijos que están a su cuidado, su esposo trabaja con ella en la crianza de ganado ovino.
Con el  primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  compro 02 ovejas para engorde.
Actualmente sigue con este negocio con ayuda de su pareja.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 cuotas, comprara ganado ovino de raza en Yunguyo.

-Quisiera terminar de construir mi casa y realizar otro negocio que me de mas ganancias- manifiesta Esperanza.
texts.en:
Esperanza belongs to the “Santa Cruz de Cacorco” communal bank, located in the Copani District, Yunguyo-Puno Province. She is 35 years old and is the mother of 3 children who are in her care. Her husband works with her to raise sheep. With the first loan of S/. 300.00, she bought 2 sheep to fatten. She is continuing in this business with the help of her husband. With this loan of S/. 1000.00, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will buy sheep of the Yunguyo breed. “I would like to finish building my house and start another business that will give me a better income,” says Esperanza.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her customer base by purchasing new/fashionable clothes in bulk

loans.name: Gloria Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en el PSJ. San Martín Mz. 154 Lt. 24, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 60 años de edad, es viuda, madre de 7 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega. Viendo grandes resultados en sus ganancias decide ampliar más su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche, 15 kilos de menestra, etc.   

Gloria manifiesta que recibe apoyo de Manuela Ramos. Se sienta contenta y feliz con todo lo que ha logrado en la vida.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the "Paradise" Community Bank, located at PSJ. San Martín Mz. 154 Lt. 24 in the district of Yarinacocha in the province of Cronel Portillo in the suburb of Ucayali. She is 60 years old, a widow, and the mother of 7 children who are now grown up. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, Gloria decided to begin selling groceries. She has been working with the community bank for 2 years. Currently, she relies on her store as a source of income. After realizing how profitable her store had become, she decided to expand it. With this loan of 2,000 Soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, Gloria will purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, 15 kg. of vegetable broth, etc. It is clear that Gloria receives the support of Manuela Ramos, and she feels content and happy with everything she has achieved in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, and 15 kg. of vegetable broth,

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en el Jr. Sucre Nº 998, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, una mayor de edad y dos que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de albañilería. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de comida en el patio de su vivienda. Todas las mañanas vende desayuno a sus clientes.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 3 kilos de arroz, 5 docenas de huevos, 3 kilos de pescado, verduras, etc.

Hilda se siente contenta porque ha conocido mujeres trabajadoras y responsables para el trabajo.
texts.en:
Hilda belongs to the "Bellavista" Community Bank, located at Jr. Sucre Nº 998, district of Callería, province of Coronel Portillo, suburb of Ucayali. She is 47 years old, and is the mother of 3 children, one of which is grown, and the remaining two still live with Hilda. Hilda's husband works in bricklaying. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300 Hilda decided to begin selling sweets. She has been working with the community bank for 4 years. Currently she relies on selling food out of her home as her source of income. Each morning Hilda sells breakfast to her clients. With this loan of S/. 2,200, which will be repaid in 5 months, Hilda will purchase 3 kg. of rice, 5 dozen eggs, 3 kg. fish, vegetables, and other foods. Hilda is happy because she has met hardworking and responsible women.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 3 kg. of rice, 5 dozen eggs, 3 kg. fish, vegetables, and other foods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing clothing in bulk

loans.name: Las Abejitas De Cayara Group

texts.en:
Las Abejitas D. Cayara (“The Little Bees of Cayara”) Village Bank is part of FINCA Peru’s Project Wari, an effort to bring micro-loans to rural communities in central Peru. The group is maD. up of 22 women who live in the Cayara community of the Ayacucho District of central Peru. Cayara is located an hour from the Huancapi District, on the highway to Southern Ayacucho. The community has three different elevations: a low part, near the Pampos River suited to growing fruit, a middle ground suited to growing grains, and an elevated section suited to growing tubers, namely potatoes. Local women also produce woven blankets.

Palomina, Holinda and Edith are three members of Las Abejitas.

Palomina is married and has five children, all under the age of 18. She weaves blankets, does embroidery, and sells clothing. She makes frequent trips to the local jail to buy blankets maD. by prisoners, then she embroiders the blankets and sells them. P. is requesting a loan of 300 soles to buy mO. blankets to embroider for the New Year’s and Carnaval season.

Palomina’s family is still in the process of overcoming difficulties suffered during the Shining Path era. She says that working with FINCA has given her hope and allowed her to start saving money for her children’s future. Her dream in life is to get ahead in life, along with her children; she wants them all to graduate with professional degrees, and she would like to open a small grocery stO. of her own.

Holinda is married with two children, who are four and eight years old. Holinda produces and sells honey, bee pollen and syrup. She takes advantage of business opportunities she sees to sell fruit or other wares at local markets. Holinda is requesting a loan of 200 soles to buy an extractor (a machine used to extract honey from frames of honeycomb) for her bee farm. She says she has been able to improve her apiary with better materials and tools thanks to help from FINCA. Holinda’s goals for the future are to produce mO. honey and honey-derived products. Edith is married with one three-year-old child. She buys and sells grains in her area and also brings some to the Canaria Mine to sell. She is requesting a loan of 200 soles to buy mO. grains to sell, including new types she hasn’t sold befO.. Edith says that when FINCA came to Cayara, she felt as though God had heard the prayers of local women and provided them with an opportunity. Her dream for the future is to improve her business and to help her son get ahead. She is saving in order to open the door to new opportunities and break out of her current routine.

loans.use: Buy honey extractor, blankets and grains

loans.name: Ilmer

texts.es:
La señora Ilmer pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Divinas”, ubicado en el Jr. Trujillo Nº 252-A, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 47 años D. edad, es madre D. 4 hijos, 2 mayores D. edad y 2 que aún dependen D. ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como Profesor Administrativo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. golosinas. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta ropa. En las mañanas se dedica a su hogar y por las tardes reparte su mercadería D. ropa a sus clientes. 
 
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 3 docenas D. blusas, 4 docenas D. faldas, 2 docenas D. ropa interior, etc.

Ilmer manifiesta que el banco comunal ha formado mujeres trabajadoras y responsables para el trabajo, es por eso que desea seguir surgiendo en la vida.
texts.en:
Señora Ilmer belongs to the community bank "Las Divinas," located at el Jr. Trujillo Nº 252-A, in the district of Callería, province of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 47 years of age and a mother of four children, two of which are older and two who still depend on her. She is married and her husband works as an Administrative Professor. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles, she decided to invest in the sales of sweets. She has three years experience working with the community bank. Presently she works with clothing sales. In the mornings she works from her home and in the afternoon she delivers her clothing merchandise to her clients. With this loan for 1500 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy three dozen blouses, four dozen skirts, two dozen underwear garments, etc. Ilmer demonstrates that the community bank is maD. up of hardworking and responsible women, and it is for this reason that she wants to continue making it a part of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 3 dozen blouses, 4 dozen skirts, and 2 dozen underwear garments.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, ubicado en el Jr. Tapiche Nº 697, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos mayores de edad y es casada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de aguajes. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio y con la venta de frejol cocido, los cuales le brindan ganancias para poder pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 15 sacos de aguajes, 1 saco de frejol regional y canario. 

Isabel manifiesta que recibe ayuda del banco comunal. Agradece a todas aquellas personas que confiaron en su talento para los negocios.
texts.en:
Señora Isabel belongs to the community bank "La Positiva," located at Jr. Tapiche Nº 697, district of Callería, province of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and a mother of seven grown children and she is married. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles, she decided to invest in the sales of aguajes (a fruit of Peru). She has a six-year history working with the community bank. Presently she has the same business and added the sales of cooked beans (Peruvian style), which offers her good earnings so she is able to repay her loan with punctuality. With this loan for 1500 Soles, which will be repaid in five months, she will buy 15 sacks of aguajes, one sack of regional beans and one sack from the Canary Islands. Isabel says that she has received help from the community bank. She is thankful for all the people who trusted in her business skills.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 15 sacks of aguajes (a fruit of Peru), 1 sack of regional beans, and 1 sack of beans from the Canary Islands.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Cacorco”  del Distrito de Copani, Provincia de  Yunguyo-Puno. Ella tiene 32 años, es casada y aun no tiene hijos, estudio el sexto grado de Primaria, trabajo desde muy pequeña en La Paz- Bolivia, sus padres no contaban con medios económicos suficientes.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital para comprar ganado vacuno, negocio al que se dedica juntamente con su esposo. Hoy en día sigue realizando esta actividad económica.

Con el ultimo préstamo solicitado de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles comprara  ganado porcino.
 
Desea  abrir una tienda en su casa para iniciar con otro negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Hilda is a founding member of the community bank "Santa Cruz de Cacorco" from the district of Copani, province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 32 years old, married, and does not have any children yet. She studied up to the sixth grade of primary school and she worked since she was very little in La Paz, Bolivia; her parents did not have sufficient economic means. With her first loan for 300 Soles, she increased her capital to buy a head of cattle, a business which she and her husband work together. Today she keeps doing this same economic activity. With the loan she requested for 800 Soles, she will buy farm pigs. She desires to open a shop in her home to start another business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pork livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business of selling clothing.

loans.name: Juana Julia

texts.es:
La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, ubicado en el Jr. Huancavelica Nº 440, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 4 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa usada. Tiene 7 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con 2 motokar como herramienta de trabajo. Tiene el apoyo de sus hijos para el manejo de la movilidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 4 llantas, arreglará el motor, tapizará los asientos, comprará 6 focos, amortiguadores, etc.

Juana manifiesta que su familia es unida. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ms Juana belongs to the community bank "La Positiva", located in Jr. Huancavelica Nº 440, district of Callería, in the province of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 62 years old, a widow, and the mother of 4 adult children. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300, she invested in the sale of used clothing. She has been a member of the community bank for 7 years. She currently has 2 motorized carts which are a source of income. She has the support of her children, who drive the motorized carts. With this loan of S/. 3,000, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy 4 tires, fix the motor, upholster the seats, buy 6 lights, shocks, etc. Juana says that hers is a close family. She thanks Manuela Ramos for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 tires, fix the motor, upholster the seats, buy 6 lights, shocks, etc.

loans.name: Julia Irene

texts.es:
La señora Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en la Av. Tupac Amaru Mz. B Lt. 1, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años de edad, es madre de un hijo menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como vigilante de Seguridad Ciudadana. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de plásticos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de productos de belleza “EBEL”. En las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de su hijo y por las tardes reparte sus productos a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 6 colonias para bebes, 7 talcos, 6 desodorantes, cremas de manos y cuerpos.

Julia y su familia están muy agradecidos con el banco comunal por la oportunidad que le brindan para tener su negocio propio.
texts.en:
Señora Julia belongs to the community bank "El Paraíso," located at Av. Tupac Amaru Mz. B Lt. 1, district of Callería, province of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 31 years old and a mother of one little boy who depends on her. She is married and her husband works as a security guard for Seguridad Ciudadana. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles, she decided to invest in plastic sales. She has a two-year history working with the community bank. Presently she works selling beauty products of "EBEL." In the mornings, she is dedicated to caring for her son and in the evenings she delivers her products to her clients. With this loan for 1000 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy six colognes for babies, seven talcum powders, six deodorants, hand creams, and body creams. Julia and her family are very thankful for the community bank and for the opportunity that you offer her so that she can have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 6 colognes for babies, 7 talcum powders, 6 deodorants, hand creams, and body creams.

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
La señora Lili pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en la Av. Faustino Sánchez Carrión, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como mecánico de carros grandes. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la confección de prendas de vestir. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una vulcanizadota en casa. Tiene el apoyo de su hijo para la atención de su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 4 kilos de varillas de soldaduras, 10 kilos de oxigeno, 4 docenas de rodajes, 5 docenas de cámara para llantas de motokar, etc.

Lili es una mujer trabajadora que lucha día a día para mejorar y ampliar su negocio. Agradece al banco comunal por confiar en su persona.
texts.en:
Señora Lili belongs to the community bank “El Paraíso," located at Av. Faustino Sánchez Carrión, district of Callería, province of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is fifty years of age and a mother of four grown children. She is married and her husband works as a mechanic of big cars. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles, she decided to invest in the making of items of clothing. She has six years experience working with the community bank. Presently she works with a tire repair shop in her home. She has the support of her son for the customer service of the business. With this loan for 2500 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy four kilos of soldering rods, ten kilos of oxygen, four dozen wheels, five dozen inner tubes for tires of motocars, etc. Lili is a hardworking woman who fights every day to improve and grow her business. She is thankful for the community bank for trusting in her character.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy four kilos of soldering rods, ten kilos of oxygen, four dozen wheels, five dozen inner tubes for tires of motocars, etc.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
La señora Lizeth pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Divinas”, ubicado en la Urbanización Municipal Mz. A-3 Lt. 3, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera con 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la confección de costura.  

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio, por las mañanas se dedica a sus  hijas y por las tardes confecciona sus prendas de vestir.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 10 kilos de licra algodón, 4 metros de dacrón, cierres, elásticos, etc.

Gracias a la ayuda del banco comunal su negocio ha crecido, Ahora tendrá la oportunidad de darles una buena educación a sus pequeñas hijas.
texts.en:
Señora Lizeth belongs to the community bank "Las Divinas," located at Urbanización Municipal Mz. A-3 Lt. 3, district of Callería, province of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 35 years of age and a single mother with two young children who still depend on her. With the first loan that she received form Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles, she decided to invest in dressmaking. Presently she works in the same business; in the mornings she is dedicated to caring for her daughters and in the evenings she makes her items of clothing. With this loan of 2000 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy ten kilograms of cotton lycra, four meters of Dacron (a polyester fiber), clasps, elastic, etc. Thanks to the help from the community bank, her business has grown. Now she will have the opportunity to give a good education to her little girls.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ten kilograms of cotton lycra, four meters of Dacron (a polyester fiber), clasps, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Luis Norman

texts.es: El Sr. Luís tiene 33 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Altamira de los semáforos lózelsa 4 c al Norte 1 c arriba, pues desde muy pequeño a ayudado a su familia a salir adelante pues por herencia de sus padres tiene una escuela de enseñanza de manejo vehicular, lo cual con los años ha logrado obtener muchas cliente que aprenden a manejar, y esos recomiendan a otros debido al buen servicios que le da, es casado, pero a un no le tienen hijo que espera con muchas ansias.  Para brindar un buen servicio  a sus clientes opto con prestar en Afodenic para tener mas recursos económicos con esta solicitud es la cuarta lo cual espera que sean muchas mas ya que se ha beneficiado con estos préstamo, esta solicitud la quiere para dar mantenimiento a su vehiculo de practicas vehicular. A largo plazo es poder tener otro vehiculo y un joven que le pueda a ayudar a vender su servicios para crecer en ventas y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Luís is 33 years old. He lives in a neighborhood in the capital of Managua called Altamira in an apartment. Since he was very small he has helped his family get ahead and through an inheritance from his parents has a driving school, which has successfully obtained numerous clients over the years. The clients who learn to drive there recommend the school to others for the great service provided there. Luís is married, but does not yet have a child that he is anxiously awaiting.

In order to provide the best services for his clients he opted for a loan from Afodenic to ensure more economic resources. This loan is his fourth, which he hopes will be much more since he has benefited from his past loans. He desires this loan for maintenance on his vehicle from the practice fleet. In the long term he hopes to have another vehicle and an assistant that can help him sell his services to grow his sales and improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Clayton

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de  la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Clayton se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual lo comercializa desde hace varios años en dicho mercado.   

Es importante destacar que el señor Clayton es el único sustento de su hogar por lo que se ha preocupado por mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia. Por este motivo es que él ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos como granos básicos para continuar con la comercialización de estos en el mercado de Chinandega.
texts.en:
In the Central Market of Chinandega, Clayton has a grocery business which he has run for various years in the Market. It is important to not that Clayton is the only economic provider for his home, which is why he is concerned about bettering the economic conditions of his family. Because of this, Clayton sought assistance through Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will permit him to buy the basic products, like grains, to continue offering these items in the market in Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of Staple Goods.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas”, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Espinar Nº 371, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 9 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de frutas.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio. Se levanta temprano para ir al mercado a comprar sus frutas para luego venderlos a sus clientes.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 ciento de naranja, ½ ciento de aguaje, S/10.00 de cocona para preparar su néctar, etc.

Lourdes agradece a Manuela Ramos por confiar en su persona. Se siente con mucha energía para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes M. belongs to the communal bank "Las Golondrinas" (The Swallows), located in the Coronel Portillo Province, at Jr. Comandante Espinar #371, Callería District, in the Ucayali Region of Peru. She is a 62-year-old widow and mother of nine grown children. With her first 300 soles loan from Manuela Ramos, she invested in fruit sales which is her current business. She heads out early to the market to buy the fruit she then sells to her client base. With this 1000 soles loan, which she'll pay back in 4 months, she will buy a stock of oranges, aguaje fruit, 10 soles of cocona fruit to prepare as nectar, etc. Lourdes is grateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting in her as she is very enthusiastic to keep growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stock of oranges, aguaje fruit, 10 soles of cocona fruit to prepare as nectar, etc.

loans.name: Luz Paquita

texts.es:
La señora Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mi Génesis”, ubicado en el Jr. 9 de Diciembre Mz. 19 Lt. 21, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años de edad y es madre soltera con 6 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de salchipapa. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad trabaja en una vivienda brindando sus servicios y en su hogar cuenta con un motokar como herramienta de trabajo.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 2 pares de amortiguadores, 2 llantas, tapizará los asientos, arreglará el motor, etc. 

Luz manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para ella. Agradece a Dios por brindarle vida y salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz S. belongs to the communal bank "Mi Génesis", located in the Coronel Portillo Province at Jr. 9th of December Mz. 19 Lt. 21, Callería District, in the Ucayali Region of Peru. She is a 50-year-old single mother of six grown children. With the first 300 soles loan she received from Manuela Ramos she invested in selling salchipapa (a fried dish of mixed sliced hotdogs and potatoes). She has worked for two years with the communal bank. She currently works out of her home and uses a motokar (3-wheeled motorized rickshaw) as part of the business. With this 1,500 soles loan, to be paid back in 4 months, she will invest in purchasing two pairs of shock absorbers and two tires, cover the seats, fix the engine, etc. Luz has stated that Manuela Ramos has been a help to her and gives thanks to the Lord for blessing her with life and health to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parts and make repairs to the motokar (buy two pairs of shock absorbers and two tires, cover the seats, fix the engine)

loans.name: Brenda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Brenda Granado es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega y se dedica a su negocio de venta de frutas y verdura  el cual son comercializadas todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Es importante destacar que ella inició este negocio vendiendo pocas cantidades de productos pero a medida que el tiempo vino transcurriendo ha logrado mejorar su situación económica y es por esto que una vez mas espera que su crédito solicitado en Ceprodel sea otorgado para así  continuar con el mantenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brenda G. is originally from the city of Chinandega. She runs her own business selling fruits and vegetables every day during the very early morning hours. It's important to note that she began this business selling low quantities of items, but over time she has improved her economic situation, and therefore hopes her loan at Ceprodel will be approved in order to continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia is 43 years old and married with three children.

Lidia is a member of the Dos Mil ("two thousand") Village Bank, and she has now been approved for an individual loan, a new product being offered by FINCA Peru for the holiday season to some of its oldest, most responsible clients. She is requesting 2000 soles to buy potatoes from local farms, which she then brings to markets in Ayacucho to sell to vendors.

Lidia has been a FINCA client for four years now, and now has her own investment capital. She and her husband now own two cars, which they rent out to drivers to use as taxis. Still, Lidia plans to continue working with FINCA for the foreseeable future.

loans.use: Buy potatoes from local farmers

loans.name: Maria Inez

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, ubicado en el Jr. Antuanez de Mayolo Nº 123, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años de edad, es madre de 9 hijos, 8 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pescado. Tiene 7 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de juanes y tamales. Tiene el apoyo de su querido esposo para la atención de su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 10 kilos de arroz, 5 pollos, 300 hojas de bijao, 2 kilos de maíz morado, etc.

Gracias a la ayuda de Manuela Ramos su negocio ha mejorado. Agradece al banco comunal por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Inez belongs to the communal bank "La Positiva", located in the Jr. Antuanez de Mayolo #123, Yarinacocha District, Coronel Portillo Province, in the Ucayali Region of Peru. She is a 57-year-old mother of nine (eight grown children and one who is still dependent upon her); she is married and her husband has his own business. With the first loan of 300 soles she received from Manuela Ramos she invested in selling fish. She has worked 7 years with the communal bank. Currently she works selling tamales and juanes (a Peruvian tamale). She has the full support of her husband in her business endeavors. With this 1,500 soles loan, which will be paid back in 5 months, she'll buy 10 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, 300 bijao leaves (to wrap juanes), 2 kilos of purple corn, etc. Thanks to the help from Manuela Ramos her business has improved; she is grateful for the help from the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, 300 bijao leaves, 2 kilos of purple corn, etc.

loans.name: Noemi  Micaela

texts.es: La señora Noemi Micaela X. R. es originaria del departamento de Totonicapna un municipio conocido como la tierra de los pinos y las manzanas por sus grandes bosques que posee con residencia en el canton Chuixchimal ubicada a tres kilometros de la cabecera departamental ella se dedica a la venta de ropas para niños y niñas  en la plaza municipal puesto que lo tiene desde hace diez años esta actividad lo ha heredado de su familia. Por la falta de capital para surtir su mercaderia requiere de un credito  la cual lo esta solicitando en las oficina de la sucursal de Totonicapan "ASDIR" con el unico fin de aumentar su venta en las fiestas de fin de año ya que en nuestro departamento de Totonicapan el lugar mas frio  la cual se requiere de productos adecuado a la epoca.
texts.en:
Mrs. Noemi Micaela X. R. is originally from the Totonicapna Region, a municipality referred to as the "land of pine trees and apples" and known for its vast forests found in the Chuixchimal Canton, located three kilometers from the regional headquarters. She has dedicated herself to selling girls and boys clothing from her municipal plaza locale for the past 10 years, a family business she inherited. She lacks capital to expand her merchandise, hence the loan for which she is applying at the "ASDIR" branch office in Totonicapna, with the goal of augmenting her sales during the end-of-year holidays. The weather in the Totonicapna Region is very cold and seasonal merchandise is essential during this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise capital

loans.name: Merly Heydi

texts.es:
La señora Merly pertenece al Banco Comunal “Loreto”, ubicado en el Jr. León de Judas Mz. 31 Lt. 5 AA.HH “Luz y Paz”, distrito de Manantay, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad, que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa a domicilio. En las mañanas se dedica a sus hijos y por las tardes sale a vender su mercadería a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 5 docenas de conjuntos para niñas, 5 docenas de blusas, 1 docena de pantalón, 2 docenas de polos, etc.

Merly agradece a Dios por tener una familia unida y al banco comunal por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Mrs. Merly Heydi belongs to the communal bank "Loreto", located in the Jr. León de Judas Mz. 31 Lt. 5 AA.HH "Luz y Paz", Manantay District, Coronel Portillo Province, in the Ucayali Region of Peru. She is a 25-year-old mother of two dependent children; she is married and her husband works driving a motokar (3-wheeled motorized rickshaw). With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she invested in selling groceries. She has worked with the communal bank for one year. Currently she works selling clothing door-to-door. She spends her mornings dedicated to the children and in the afternoons she goes out to sell her merchandise to her clients. With this 2,000 soles loan, which will be paid back in 5 months, she will buy 5 dozen girls' outfits, 5 dozen blouses, 1 dozen pairs of pants, 2 dozen shirts, etc. Merly is grateful to God for keeping her family together and to the communal bank for its help.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 dozen girls' outfits, 5 dozen blouses, 1 dozen pairs of pants, 2 dozen shirts, etc.

loans.name: Isabel Alicia

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal “Chojchoni”  hace 5 años, vive en el Sector Huaychani del distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 23 años, es soltera y se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro ganado porcino y ovino de Bolivia, negocio al cual sigue dedicándose día a día.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles el que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara
01 ganado vacuno a S/. 1.200

Su deseo es realizar negocio de ropa y vender en la Ciudad de Arequipa.
texts.en:
Isabel has been a member of the Communal Bank “Chojchoni” for 5 years. She lives in the Huaychani sector of Copani district, Yunguyo province, Puno, Peru. She is 23 years old, single, and raises livestock. With the first loan for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles she bought pigs and sheep from Bolivia, a business she dedicates herself to day after day. With this loan for S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 1 head of cattle at S/.1.200. Her wish is to have a business selling clothing in Arequipa city.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy one head of cattle

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
La señora Mirna pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, ubicado en el Jr. Venezuela Mz. F Lt. 4, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pescado. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio y tiene el apoyo de su esposo. Vende todos los días, tanto en las mañanas como en las tardes. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 6 tinas de pescado diario de todas las especies.

Mirna es una mujer trabajadora que lucha día a día para darles una buena educación a sus queridos hijos.
texts.en:
Mirna belongs to the Communal Bank “La Positiva,” located at Jr. Venezuela Mz. F Lt. 4, Yarinacocha district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 40 years old, mother to 3 young children who are still dependent upon her, she is married and her husband is a independent laborer. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 she decided to invest in the selling of fish. She has been working with the communal bank for 8 years. Today she has the same business and has the support of her husband. She sells everyday, in the morning and the afternoon. With this loan for S/. 1,200, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 6 crates of fish daily of a variety of species. Marina is a hard working woman who fights every day to provide a good education to her beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy crates of fish daily of a variety of species

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en el Jr. Los Ceticos Mz. 41 Lt. 3 AAHH. “Próceres de la Independencia”, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, 4 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio y tiene el apoyo de su hija. En las mañanas se dedica a su hogar y por las tardes reparte su mercadería a sus clientes. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 2 docenas de blusas, 4 docenas de faldas, 3 docenas de pantalones, vestidos para niñas, etc.

Nancy manifiesta alegría por todo lo que ha logrado en la vida. Tiene el deseo de ampliar más su negocio para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy belongs to the Communal Bank “El Paraíso”, located at Jr. Los Ceticos Mz. 41 Lt. 3 AAHH. “Próceres de la Independencia”, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 44 years old, mother of 5 children, 4 grown and 1 still dependent upon her, she is married and her husband is an independent laborer. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 she invested in selling clothing. She has been working with the communal bank for a year. Today she has that same business and has the support of her daughter. In the mornings she takes care of her home and in the afternoons she distributes her merchandise to her customers. With this loan for S. 1,200, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 2 dozen blouses, 4 dozen skirts, 3 dozen pairs of pants, dresses for girls, etc. Nancy is happy for everything she has achieved in her life. She has the dream of expanding her business for her family’s continued well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 2 dozen blouses, 4 dozen skirts, 3 dozen pairs of pants, dresses for girls, etc.

loans.name: Melania Aurora

texts.es:
La Sra. Melania tiene 37 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Laureles Norte, con un hijo mayor que trabaja, su esposo trabaja en ventas y ayuda a los gastos del hogar. El negocio de doña Melania es la venta de ropa y variedades pues inicio desde hace tres años en la ventas, con un préstamo en una financiera pues logro poner su venta, a veces difícil ya que las ventas no son a como lo espera, ahora va a formar parte de Afodenic ya que le gusta la modalidad de pago como sus intereses que son. Bajos. Con la solicitud
Va invertir en infraestructura en la construcción de un muro en frente de la casa para tener un poco de seguridad para su familia, para esto va a  comprar piedra, cemento, arena y hierro. A largo plazo es invertir más en su negocio para captar mas clientes y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Melania is 37 years old. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the capital city with her oldest son and her husband. Both her son and her husband work. Her husband is a salesman and helps with the household expenses. Doña Melania has a business selling clothes and miscellaneous items. She has been a saleswoman for three years. With a loan from a finance company, she was able to start her own business. Sometimes business is tough, since sales are not what she had hoped. Now she is part of Afodenic and enjoys their repayment methods because their interest rates are low. She is going to invest this loan in infrastructure by building a wall in front of her house. This wall will give her family a little more security. For the construction project, she needs to buy stone, cement, sand and iron. Her long term goal is to invest in her business so she can pick up more clients and obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Noelali

texts.es:
La señora Noelali pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Divinas”, ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry Nº 638, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad y es madre soltera con 2 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de bebidas (agua mineral, Pulp, gaseosas). Tiene el apoyo de sus hijos para administrar su negocio.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1.200, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 5 cajas de gaseosas, 6 cajas de pulp (néctar), 3 paquetes de agua mineral, etc.

Noelali manifiesta felicidad porque gracias a su habilidad para el trabajo su negocio crece día a día.
texts.en:
Noelali is a member of the Banco Comunal "Las Divinas," located in Jr. Salaverry Nº 638 in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province in Ucayali. She is 44 years old and is a single mother with two adult children. With her first loan of S/. 300 that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of carbonated beverages. She has been working with the village bank for a year. Currently, she has a business selling beverages (mineral water, Pulp, sodas). She has the support of her children in the administration of her business. With this loan of S/. 1.200, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 5 crates of soda, 6 crates of Pulp (juice), 3 packs of mineral water, etc. Noelali is happy because thanks to her aptitude for her work, her business grows everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 5 crates of soda, 6 crates of juice, 3 packs of mineral water, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 65 years old and married with six children, who are all independent adults. She lives with one of her daughters, who is a single mother, and her granddaughter. Carmen owns a gift shop on Manco Capac Street in central Ayacucho, where she sells a bit of everything: drinks, cakes, gifts, dry goods, gelatin desserts, natural remedies, condiments, etc. She says that offering a wiD. variety of merchandise is a good way to retain customers.

Carmen is a member of one of FINCA Peru's village banks. She has been working with the institution on and off for ten or twelve years, and was recently approved for an individual loan, a new product being offered by FINCA to its oldest, most reliable members for the Christmas season. She is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy more gifts for her store. <[> Carmen's dream is to buy a house in Lima to live in with all of her children. Most of them live in Lima in rented apartments, and she would prefer they had a home of their own.

loans.use: Buy more gifts for gift shop

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Chojchoni”  ubicado en el Sector Chojchoni del distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 25 años y es madre de 4 hijos pequeños que dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo se dedica al trabajo de Albañilería en Bolivia. Isabel con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  decidió invertir en la compra y venta de habas. Ella trabaja 5 años con el Banco.
En la actualidad se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y continua con su negocio de venta de habas que trae de Bolivia.

Con este préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles comprara 04 sacos de habas secas, dicho crédito será pagado en 4 cuotas.

Su gran deseo  es terminar de construir su casa para poder vivir tranquilamente con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Isabel is a founding partner of the Banco Comunal “Chojchoni,” located in the Chojchoni sector in the Copani district of the Yunguyo-Puno province. She is 25 years old and the mother of 4 small, dependent children. She is married and her husband works as a mason in Bolivia. With the first loan of S/. 300.00 that she received, Isabel invested in a business buying and selling beans. She has been working with the bank for five years.

Currently, she breeds small animals and continues to buy and sell beans that she brings from Bolivia.

With this loan of S/. 700.00, she will buy 4 sacks of dried beans. This loan will be repaid in 4 installments.

Her dream is to finish building her house so she can live peacefully with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dried beans

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
La señora Rayda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en el PSJ. Coronel Bustamante Nº 13, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años de edad y es madre soltera con 4 hijos, 3 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña bodega en casa y con la confección de prendas de vestir, el cual le brinda ganancias para cumplir con el pago del préstamo correspondiente.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 cajas de leche, ½ saco de arroz y azúcar, ¼ de huevos y telas para sus prendas de vestir.

Rayda manifiesta que la ayuda recibida de Manuela Ramos es muy gratificante para ella. Se siente contenta porque su negocio ha crecido.
texts.en:
Rayda belongs to the Bellavista Community Bank, located at 13 PSJ. Coronel Bustamante, Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, in the department of Uyacali. She is 51 years old and is a single mother with four children, three of whom are grown up while one is still dependent on her. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300 she decided to invest in the sale of candy and snacks. She has worked with the community bank for four years. Currently she has a small store in her house, and she is able to pay back the corresponding loan with the earnings from making items of clothing for sale. With this loan of S/. 2000, which will be paid back in 5 months, she will buy 2 boxes of milk, half a sack of rice and of sugar, a quarter of a box of eggs, and fabric to sew items of clothing for sale. Rayda is very thankful for the help received from Manuela Ramos. She feels happy because her business has grown.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 boxes of milk, half a sack of rice and of sugar, a quarter of a box of eggs, and fabric.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La señora Isidora es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz D. Cacorco” , vive en el Sector Cacorco del Distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno
Tiene 55 años, es casada y madre D. 6 hijos que trabajan en la ciudad D. Lima, junto con su esposo se dedican al negocio D.  compra y venta D. ganado. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro 2 ovejas para engorD..

Actualmente viaja a  Bolivia a comprar ganado vacuno que trae en barco desD. allá., Hace 5 años que trabaja con Manuela Ramos.

Con este préstamo que solicitara D. S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles comprara 01 ganado vacuno para engorD..
texts.en:
Isidora is a member of the Santa Cruz D. Cacorco Community Bank, and lives in the Cacorco sector of the Copani district in the province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 55 years old, is married and is the mother of six children who work in the city of Lima. Together with her husband she earns a living buying and selling livestock. With the first loan of S/. 300 she bought two sheep to raise. Currently she travels to Bolivia to buy livestock that she brings back by boat from there. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. With this loan that she is seeking of S/. 2500.00 she will buy one head of cattle to raise for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase one head of cattle to raise for sale

loans.name: Rosa Alvina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en el Jr. Ricardo Palma Mz. J Lt. 2, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de la pesca. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de frutas. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de golosinas en casa. Todos los días vende en el patio de su hogar, brindando buena atención a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 6 cajas de galletas de diferentes marcas, 2 cajas de chocolates, 3 bolsas de chizitos, 5 tiras de chupetín, etc.

Rosa es una mujer que le gusta trabajar por el bienestar de su familia. Agradece al banco comunal por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the El Paraiso Community Bank, located at Jr. Ricardo Palma Mz. J Lt. 2, in the district of Yarinacocha, province of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of 5 grown children. Her husband works as a fisherman. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300 she decided to invest in the sale of fruit. She has worked with the community bank for 6 years. Currently she works selling candy and snacks from her house. Everyday she sells from the patio of her residence, offering excellent service to her customers. With this loan of S/. 2,500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 6 boxes of different brands of cookies, 2 boxes of chocolates, 3 bags of snack food, 5 strips of lollipops, etc. Rosa is a woman who enjoys working for the wellbeing of her family. She is grateful for the help offered by the community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 6 boxes of different brands of cookies, 2 boxes of chocolates, 3 bags of snack food, 5 strips of lollipops, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en el Jr. Lago Titicaca Nº 170-A, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y 2 que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de combustible. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas. Trabaja de Lunes a Domingo, en las mañanas vende caldo de pollo y en las noches antojitos. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 5 kilos de arroz, 5 pollos, 15 menudencias, 6 paquetes de galletas, 4 bolsas de caramelos, etc.

Rosa se siente feliz porque todo lo que ha logrado es gracias a su esfuerzo. Agradece a Dios por bendecir su negocio y por brindarle vida y salud.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the El Paraiso Community Bank, located at Jr. Lago Titicaca Nº 170-A, in the district of Calleria, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 46 years old and is the mother of 4 children, 2 of whom are grown up while 2 are still dependent on her. She is married, and her husband works independently of her. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300 she decided to invest in the sale of fuel. Currently she works selling food and snacks. She works seven days a week, in the morning selling chicken broth and in the evening selling snacks. With this loan of S/. 2,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 5 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, 15 assorted items, 6 packets of cookies, 4 bags of candy, etc. Rosa feels happy because everything she has achieved is thanks to her hard work. She is thankful to God for blessing her business and for offering her life and good health.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 5 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, 15 assorted items, 6 packets of cookies, 4 bags of candy, etc.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz D. Cacorco” del distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 57 años, es madre D. 8 hijos, D. los cuales 2 están a su cargo, estudio el primer grado D. primaria. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles compro 3 ovejas y 4 cerditos para engorD..

Ella hoy en día se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales menores, su negocio lo realiza en Zepita. Tiene un año trabajando con el Banco.

Con este crédito solicitado D. S/. 600.00 nuevos soles comprara 02 ovejas y un chanchito.
texts.en:
Jacinta is a member of the Santa Cruz D. Cacorco Community Bank, in the Copani district of Yunguyo-Puno province. She is 57 years old and the mother of 8 children, 2 of whom are still dependent on her. She studied the first graD. of primary school. With her first loan of S/. 500.00 she bought 3 sheep and 4 piglets to raise for sale. Currently she works buying and selling small animals, with her business based in Zepita. She has worked with the community bank for one year. With this loan she is seeking of S/. 600.00 she will buy 2 sheep and one small pig.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two sheep and one small pig

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en el Jr. José Olaya Mz O Lt. 29, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años de edad y es madre soltera con 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos lácteos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de zapatos, el cual le brinda ganancias para pagar su préstamo puntualmente.
