Con este préstamo de S/. 1.000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 10 docenas de zapatos para vender a sus clientes.

Rosa es una mujer luchadora. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the El Paraiso Community Bank, located at Jr. José Olaya Mz O Lt. 29, in the district of Yarinacocha, province of Coronel Portillo, in the department of Ucayali. She is 31 years old and a single mother with three children dependent on her. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300 she decided to invest in the sale of dairy products. Currently she works selling shoes, which offer earnings allowing her to pay back her loan on time. With this loan of S/. 1,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 10 dozen pairs of shoes to sell to her customers. Rosa is a fighting woman. She is grateful for the help offered by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 10 dozen pairs of shoes

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 63 años, vive con sus 3 hijos. Tiene una pequeña tienda desD. hace 20 años, ha sabido forjarse en la vida una actividad que le permita estar activa y siempre  en constantes quehacer, y es lo que hace disfrutar a Elsa, pues lo ve como una distracción el D. poder brindar a sus clientes una buena atención en cada compra D. los productos D. pan llevar que consumen D. su tienda. Estos años D. experiencia le ha servido para saber cómo vender y qué estrategias D. ventas se aplican, es por ello que permanece en su negocio, además D. darle lo necesario para poder vivir, ella  tiene sus propios ingresos con la que pueD. disponer D. sus gastos, sus hijos ya son personas adultas que cuidan D. ella, pero están felices por tener una madre muy trabajadora. Para Elsa esta es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, ya que en la primera fue muy responsable con sus cuotas D. devolución. Solicita este préstamo con el que comprará varios sacos D. víveres para que D. esa manera  pueda tener mayor stock D. mercadería.
texts.en:
Elsa is 63 years old and lives with her 3 children. She has had a small store for 20 years, has known how to make herself a life full of activity that allows her to be active and always with tasks to do, and this is what Elsa enjoys. She likes to be able to proviD. her customers good service in every purchase of prepared bread products that they consume from her store. These years of experience have served her to know how to sell and what sales strategies to apply, and that is why she has been in business for so long. In addition to providing her what she needs to be able to live, she has her own income with which she can pay her expenses. Her children are now adults that take care of her, but they are happy to have a mother who is so hard-working. For Elsa this is the second time she has asked for a loan through MFP, in her first loan she was very responsible with her repayments. She asks for this loan to buy various sacks of supplies so that she may have a greater stock of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en el Jr. Sucre Nº 980, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 60 años D. edad y es madre soltera con 5 hijos mayores D. edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. gaseosas. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes. Trabaja todas las mañanas atendiendo su negocio y brindando buena atención a sus clientes. 
 
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco D. arroz, 2 paquetes D. aceites, 2 cajas D. leche, 2 cajas D. vinagre, sillao, etc.

Tomasa es una mujer trabajadora. Se siente feliz por todo lo bueno que le ha pasado en la vida.
texts.en:
Tomasa belongs to the Banco Comunal “Bellavista,” located in Jr. Sucre Nº 980 in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province in Ucayali. She is 60 years old and is a single mother with 5 adult children. With the first loan of S/. 300 that she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in a business selling carbonated beverages. She has been working with the bank for 5 years.

Currently, she owns and operates a grocery store. She works in the store every morning, bringing quality service to her clients.

With this loan of S/. 1,300, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy a sack of rice, 2 packs of oils, 2 crates of milk, 2 crates of vinegar, soy sauce, etc.

Tomasa is a hard working woman. She feels happy for all the good things that have happened in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sack of rice, two packs of oils, two crates of milk, two crates of vinegar, soy sauce, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 27 años, vive  con sus dos hijos. Trabaja desde hace 3 años en su restaurante que abrió en sociedad con su hermana, allí ofrecen una variedad de desayunos y almuerzos a precios módicos, está ubicado cerca de un hospital de su localidad, recientemente cambiaron de local porque el arrendamiento era muy costoso, ahora están en un local más cómodo. Eva trabaja diariamente y descansa  en la tarde después de vender los almuerzos y dejar todo limpio para el día siguiente, su mayor preocupación son sus pequeños hijos, ella es el único sostén que tienen, por lo que no puede quedarse hasta muy noche en su restaurante, su mayor anhelo es tener un restaurante de más categoría y en una zona más comercial. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, fue invitada por su banco comunal porque la conocen y saben que es responsable. Eva comprar con este dinero víveres al por mayor para la preparación de sus almuerzos y también vidrios para la decoración de sus mesas.
texts.en:
Eva is 27 years old and lives with her two children. She has been working for three years in a restaurant that she opened in partnership with her sister. In the restaurant, they offer a variety of breakfasts and lunches at modest prices. The restaurant is located near a regional hospital. They recently locations because the lease was very expensive. Their current location is more affordable. Eva works everyday and rests in the afternoons after selling lunches and cleaning the restaurant for the next day. Her biggest worry is for her small children. She is the only support that they have, so she cannot stay until late at night in the restaurant. Her greatest longing is to own a higher-quality restaurant in a more commercial area. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan with MFP. She was invited by the village bank because the members know her and know that she is responsible. With this money, Eva will buy, in bulk, the food supplies needed to prepare the lunches and glass to decorate the tables.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food supplies and glass to decorate the tables

loans.name: Marielena

texts.es:
L a señora Mariaelena  es socia del Banco Comunal “Chojchoni” del distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 54 años, es casada y madre D. 2 hijos, un menor que mantiene todavía, su esposo trabaja en un taller D. Mecánica en Tacna. Con el primer préstamo recibido D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro papa, chuño, oca para vender en Tacna al mismo tiempo  se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles que obtendrá y que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara 01 ganado vacuno (01 toro) para engorD..

Su deseo es que su hijo termine sus estudios y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Señora Mariaelena is a member of the communal bank “Chojchoni” in the district of Copani in the province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 54, is married, and has 2 children, one of whom is a minor and whom she still supports financially. Her husband works as a mechanic in Tacna.

With the first loan she received of 300 nuevos soles, she purchased potatoes, potato flour, and oca (a root vegetable similar to a potato) to sell in Tacna. At the same time, she raises small animals. With this loan of 1,200 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase one bull to fatten. Her dream is to see her son finish his studies and become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull to fatten

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Tiene una tienda desde hace 3 años, anteriormente tenía en otro lugar su tienda, pero arrendó su casa en la misma plaza de su localidad, ahora vende varios productos de pan llevar, para lo cual tiene que abarrotarla periódicamente para que siempre esté disponible para su publico consumidor, por ahora tiene los retos de que su negocio se más rentable, y para ello es poder tener mayores productos para tener más ventas. Una dificultad es cuando  existen días donde la venta es deficiente, pero es recuperable con aquellos días en que  aumenta su clientela y esto depende de la concurrencia, es especial cuando hay festividades. Es la quinta vez que Flor está solicitando un préstamo, durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser cumplidora y puntual de sus cuentas. Está solicitando este préstamo para implementar con más mercadería su tienda, y abarrotara de gaseosas y víveres.
texts.en:
Flor is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She has had a store for 3 years. Previously she had her store in another location, but she rented a house in the same plaza as her locale and now she sells various products such as baked goods, so she has to stock her store periodically so that she always has available what her customers request. Now she has the goal of making her business more profitable, therefore she needs more products in order to have more sales. One difficulty is when there are days when she doesn’t sell very much, but it is made up by those days where her clientele grows and also the season, when there are holidays. This is the fifth time Flor is asking for a loan, during this time she has been punctual and prompt with her payments. She is asking for this loan in order to expand the merchandise she sells in her store and stock up on soda pop and basic goods.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic goods and beverages for her store

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La señora Trinidad pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en Prolongación Libertad Nº 1202, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, uno mayor de edad y 2 que aun dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la confección de prendas de vestir. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio, confecciona diferentes prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 3 metros de tela licra algodón, 4 metros de lino, cierre, elásticos, hilos, etc. 

Gracias al banco comunal su negocio han crecido y sus clientes han aumentado en estos últimos días.
texts.en:
Trinidad participates in the Communal Bank “Bellavista”, located in Prolongación Libertad Nº 1202, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, in Ucayali. Trinidad, 53, is married and has 3 children; two of them still live at home. Her husband works driving a moto-car. The first loan that she received from Kiva field partner "Manuela Ramos" was invested in her sewing business. Trinidad has been working with the communal bank for 5 years. Currently, Trinidad still runs a sewing business, making clothes for men, women and children. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles to be paid back in 5 months. The loan will be used to purchase 3 meters of cotton material, 4 meters of linen, zippers, elastics, threads, etc. Thanks to the communal bank, Trinidad's business has grown and the number of customers has increased lately.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sewing materials (cotton fabric, linen, zippers, elastic, thread, etc.)

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica al negocio de la venta de abarrotes y productos de pan llevar junto con su esposo, un agricultor dedicado a su familia que con el tiempo pudo comprar e instalarse en su propia casa favoreciéndole aun más en sus ventas, por ubicarse en una zona comercial de su comunidad, entonces ya no paga el concepto de arrendamiento,  lo cual favorece a sus ganancias. La atención que ella brinda en su tienda es diaria y todo el día, ella siempre tiene en cuenta el buen trato a su cliente, tiene muchos planes de crecer para el futuro, y está dispuesta a lograrlo porque desea que su hijo de 14 años siga estudiando. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, fue recomendada por los mismos integrantes del banco comunal para que integrara el grupo. Gloria solicita este préstamo con el que implementará su tienda con más mercadería como fideos, arroz y menestras.
texts.en:
Gloria is 44-years-old and lives with her husband and son. For more than 10 years, she has sold groceries and bread along with her husband, a farmer who is dedicated to his family. With time, she was able to put her store in her own home, which is even more favorable to her sales because it is located in a commercial zone in their community. So she doesn't have to pay rent anymore, which favors her profits. She attends to her store all day every day. She always keeps in mind the good treatment of her customers. She has many plans of growing her business in the future. She is determined to achieve this so her 14-year-old son can continue getting an education. This is the first time that she has requested a loan with MFP. She was recommended by the members of the communal bank to join the group. Gloria is requesting this loan to purchase noodles, rice, and stew for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, noodles, and stew for her store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana V. conocida comúnmente por Juanita se dedica a atender su negocio siendo una pequeña tienda de ropa el cual atiende con mucho entusiasmo en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Ella es una dama soltera que tiene la obligación de mantener su núcleo familiar y por este motivo es que se esfuerza grandemente para mejorar su nivel de vida brindando mejores condiciones para su negocio. Hoy en día espera que su crédito sea otorgado para suplir sus estantes de mercadería ofreciéndosela a sus clientes en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Ms Juana V., better known as Juanita, dedicates herself to her business, a small clothing store which she manages with great enthusiasm in the central market of the town of Chinandega. She is a single woman whose duty it is to care for her household and for this reason she is making great efforts to improve her standard of living by providing better conditions for her store. Today, she hopes her loan request will be granted so that she can stock her shelves with merchandise to offer her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, a box of eggs, 2 boxes of milk, 4 boxes of cookies, sauces, etc.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La señora Lorenza es socia del Banco Comunal “Chojchoni” del distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 46 años, es casada y madre de 7 hijos de los cuales 4 están a su cargo, no estudio porque solo la crió su abuela quien no tenia dinero para apoyarla. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 500. 00 nuevos soles decide invertir en la compra de habas, quinua,  maíz que en esa época vendía en Desaguadero. Su esposo viaja a Bolivia a realizar el negocio de venta de frazadas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles  que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara mas frazadas para vender en la Frontera.

Su deseo es obtener un préstamo más alto para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a partner of the Communal Bank, "Chojchoni," in the Copani District, Yunguyo-Puno Province. She is 46 years old, married, and mother of 7 children, 4 of which are still in her charge. Lorenza did not go to school because she was raised only by her grandmother who did not have the money to support her education. With her first loan of (around) $175 she decided to invest in the purchase of broad beans, Peruvian quinoa, corn, which she currently sells in Desaguadero, Peru. Her husband travels to Bolivia to manage his business in textile sales. With this loan of $250, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase more blankets to sell at the Border. Her desire is to obtain higher loan in the future to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of textiles in Bulk

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda tiene 32 años, vive con sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 10 años tiene su propio negocio, una tienda, la cual administra de manera independiente, con ella, cada día logra el sustento para sus hijos, la atención que ofrece es diaria, incluso los domingos, realiza sus pedidos de mercadería a las casas distribuidoras para abarrotarla de productos de pan llevar, para ella es una ventaja, porque dispone de su propio tiempo, además abrió su tienda cercana a un centro de estudios y tiene buena clientela. Uno de los riesgos es el robo, por lo cual atiende con todas las medidas de seguridad. Está satisfecha, y sigue adelante porque sus hijos son lo más importante para ella. En el caso de Olinda, es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo, con el cual se compromete a devolverlo porque es una persona responsable. Solicita este dinero con el que podrá adquirir más mercadería para su tienda como bebidas y otros víveres.
texts.en:
Olinda is 32 years old and lives with her 3 children. She has owned her own business for the past 10 years, a store which she runs independently. Thanks to her business, she is able to take care of her children's basic needs. Her store is open every day, even on Sundays, which allows her to place orders with distributors of agricultural products. This gives her an advantage as she can manage her own time. In addition, her store is near a school zone and she has a good client base. One of the risks of her business is robbery, so she must be very vigilant. She is satisfied, and continues forging ahead because her children are her highest priority. This will be Olinda's first loan, which she will repay because she is a responsible person. She is requesting this loan so that she can acquire more merchandise for her store, such as beverages and other supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Cacorco” del Distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno hace casi 5 años, Vive en el sector Cacorco, Tiene 32 años, es casada y madre de  3 hijos pequeños todavía,  su esposo se dedica al  arreglo de sombreros junto con ella, estudio el tercer año de Secundaria. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro  materiales para el arreglo de sombreros. Viene trabajando casi 5 años con el Banco.

Hoy se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de discos (CD de música) y al mismo tiempo sigue con su anterior negocio. Ella vende los días domingos en Zepita.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles,  comprara discos en Juliaca, dicho crédito lo pagara en 4 cuotas.

Su deseo es terminar de construir su casa para poner una tienda de CDS.
texts.en:
Maria has been a member of the “Santa Cruz de Cacorco” communal bank, in the Copani district, Yunguyo-Puno province, for almost 5 years. She lives in the Cacorco neighborhood. She is 32 years old, is married, and is the mother of 3 small children. Her husband works along with her to fix hats. She studied through the third year of high school. With the first loan of S/. 300.00, she bought materials for fixing hats. She has been working with the bank for almost 5 years. Maria now works in the business of selling music CDs, meanwhile continuing with her earlier business. She sells on Sundays in Zepita. Her hope is to finish building her house so that she can have in it a CD store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy music CDs.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: La Sr. Fátima tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, con dos preciosos hijos de 9 y 13 años de edad. Habitantes de barrio memorial Sandino de la capital de Managua. Su esposo es de profesión pintor automotriz. Posee un pequeño negocio de frutas, verduras y ocasionalmente comida ya que no existe algunas veces trabajo de pintura y con esos ingresos ayuda más a la economía del hogar. Sus planes son construir toda sus casa para que su familia este protegida y segura. También que su negocio sea una pulpería en un futuro no muy lejano. Gracias a los prestamos de Afodenic sus planes se lograran y le dará a su hogar una mejor comodidad, la expansión de su negocio y la seguridad de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Fatima is 40 years old and married. Her two adorable children are 9 and 13 years old. The family lives in a neighbourhood known as Sandino in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. Fatima's husband works as a painter in the automotive industry and she has a small business selling fruit, vegetables and occasionally, prepared meals. Because there is sometimes a lack of painting work for her husband, the extra income Fatima earns helps to balance the household budget. With this loan, she will undertake some construction work on her house so that her family is more protected and secure. In the future, she also hopes to expand her business into a full fledged grocery store. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, her plans will be accomplished: she will live in a more comfortable home, her business will continue to grow, and those she loves will be cared for.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Victoria Lila

texts.es:
La señora Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, ubicado en la Urbanización Prolongación con Tupac Amaru Mz. 192 Lt. 16, distrito D. Yarinacocha, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 63 años D. edad, es viuda y madre D. 3 hijos mayores D. edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la confección.  

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. ropa y sábanas. Este negocio le brinda ganancias para pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.
 
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 6 sábanas polares, 2 docenas D. faldas, 3 docenas D. blusas, 2 docenas D. ropa interior, etc.

Victoria agradece al banco comunal por apoyar a su grupo D. socias para tener un negocio propio y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the Community Bank "Las Rosas" (meaning The Roses), located in Urbanizacion Prolongacion con Tupac Amaru Mz. 192 Lt. 16, in the district of Yarinacocho, in the province of Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She is 63 years old and she is a widow and mother of three grown children. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 she decided to invest the funds in confections.

Currently she sells clothing and bedding. This business proviD. her with earnings enough to pay off her loan on time.

With this loan of S/.1300, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase 6 polar fleece bed sheets, 2 dozen skirts, 3 dozen blouses, 2 dozen undergarments, etc.

Victoria is thankful to the Community Bank for supporting the group of members to have their own businesses and be triumphant in life.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 6 polar fleece bed sheets, 2 dozen skirts, 3 dozen blouses, 2 dozen undergarments etc.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.es: Teddy tiene 45 años, vive con sus dos hijos. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, de esta manera es un sostén importante en su casa, cultiva papa y maíz, también forraje para sus animales, cría vacas y burros que luego vende después de varios meses para un ingreso adicional, de esta manera, Teddy puede solventar la educación de sus 2 hijos universitarios, su esposo trabaja fuera de su localidad y muchas veces el sueldo es insuficiente, por lo que Teddy tomó esta decisión de poder tener más ingresos económicos, aunque tenga su cota de esfuerzo físico, como el de cargar pesados bultos de forraje para sus animales todas las mañanas desde sus tierras de cultivo hacia su establo, cuando hay escasez de forraje los lleva al campo a pastear, y a pesar de ello sigue trabajando porque quiere dar lo mejor a sus hijos. Para ella es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, fue invitada por los mismos integrantes de su banco comunal porque conocen que es una persona responsable. Teddy solicita este dinero para preparar su tierra de cultivo para esta época de siembra donde cultivará papa y también alfalfa, para ello que comprará abono.
texts.en:
Teddy is 45 years old and lives with her two children. For the past 10 years, she has worked in agriculture: this is the main source of income for her household. She grows potatos and corn, as well as fodder for her livestock. She raises cows and donkeys which she later sells for a profit after a few months. In this manner, Teddy is able to send her two children to university. Her husband works outside their town and often the income he makes is insufficient, so Teddy made the decision to make more money. Although it is physically exhausting, every morning she carries heavy bundles of fodder from the fields to the stable. When there is a shortage of fodder, she takes the livestock to pasture to graze, and in spite of all this, keeps working as she wants the best for her children. This will be her first loan with MFP: she was invited to join the community bank by members of the bank as they know her to be a responsible person. Teddy is asking for this loan to buy seed potatos and alfalfa and to prepare her farmland as it is now time to sow.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed potatos and alfalfa on credit to sow

loans.name: Wendy Janina

texts.es:
La señorita Wendy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas”, ubicado en el Jr. Bolívar Nº 335, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 21 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad estudia en UNU la especialidad de Derechos Humanos y cuenta  con el mismo negocio. Este negocio le brinda ganancias para poder pagar su préstamo puntualmente. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará colonias, aretes, collares, perfumes, cremas de manos, etc.  

Wendy es una señorita que desea triunfar en la vida. Agradece al banco comunal por confiar en su persona.
texts.en:
Wendy belongs to the Community Bank "Las Tigresas" (meaning The Tigresses), located in Jr. Bolivar No. 335, in the district of Calleria, in the province of Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She is 21 years old and she is single. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 she decided to invest in the sales of beauty products. She has been with the Community Bank for the past 2 years.

She is currenty attending the United Nations University, completing a specialty in Human Rights, always depending on her business. This business provides her with enough earnings to pay off her loan on time.

With this loan of S/.1700, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months, she will purchase colognes, earrings, necklaces, perfumes, hand creams, etc.

Wendy is a young lady that longs to enjoy her life. She is very thankful to the Community Bank for believing in her.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase colognes, earrings, necklaces, perfumes, hand creams etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase products for her store

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Ella tiene una gran trayectoria en las actividades agrícolas, pues son 50 años de haber  cultivado la tierra y de criar animales, junto a su esposo ha podido sostener a sus 3  hijos que ahora son personas independientes, con los años que han pasado se siente contenta de haber educado a sus hijos y solo le queda continuar para  seguir cultivando la tierra  para el sostén de ella y de su esposo, ambos cultivan maíz y papa, que son los principales productos de su tierra. También se dedican a la crianza de animales, principalmente la vaca y el toro que les sirve para la venta. Adicionalmente, vende comida en su propia casa. Es la primera vez que solicita préstamo en MFP, pero está avalada por su banco comunal, además tiene buenos antecedentes. Teofila solicita este préstamo que le servirá para preparar su tierra de cultivo con sacos de abono y también para poder seguir impulsando su pequeño negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Teofila is 59 years old and she lives with her husband and her son. She has great stature in the agricultural field having spent the last 50 years cultivating the field and raising livestock. Together with her husband she has been able to support their 3 children, who are now independent. With the years that have gone by she feels fulfilled for having educated their children, and now the only thing that's left is to keep cultivating the fields for hers and her husband support. They both harvest corn and potatoes, which are the main products of their country. They also raise livestock, mostly cows and bulls that are later sold. In addition, they also sell food from their own home. It is the first time that they request a loan from MFP (Kiva field partner). She has good standing with her community bank and she has a good credit history. Teofila requests this loan to prepare the fields for harvest with fertilizer and also to keep her small food service running.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase confections, cookies, and softdrinks wholesale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Miriam Z. se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega. Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una dama el cual ha duplicado sus esfuerzos con el propósito de mantener su núcleo familiar llevando el alimento a sus tres hijos en edad escolar ya que ella es madre solteras y no cuenta con ningún otro ingreso más que su negocio.

Es por este motivo que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la adquisición de las verduras para comercializarlas. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y logra salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Miriam Z. sells vegetables in the Central market in the city of Chinandega. She is well known for being a lady, and she has doubled her efforts with the goal of keeping her nuclear family, bringing food for her three school-aged children. She is a single mother and she does not have any source of income aside from her business.

To this end, she has engaged Ceprodel (Kiva field partner) to receive a loan that will allow her to buy more vegetables to sell to the public. This loan will be of great benefit to her and she will manage to make her business a success.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz M. A. tiene la edad de 42 años, su estado civil es casada, esta señora tiene 3 hijos su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 15 años que cursa recientemente 3 año de secundaria, su otro hijo de 14 años de edad cursa el 3 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 13 años que cursa el 2 grado de primaria, su esposo labora como comerciante, sus propósitos son aumentar y mantener su negocio para seguirle generando a su familia una fuente de ingresos y ayudar a su familia y también quiere seguirle aportando ayuda a sus hijos y poder darle un futuro llenos de estudios.


Su actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos como: arroz, aceite, frijoles y azúcar, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de   8 años, ella inicia este negocio por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo y es así como lo consigue por medio de un crédito que la fundación le otorga decide efectuar las primeras compras de productos como: 25 libras de arroz, 10 libras de aceite y frijoles y al ver que este le dio afluencia de clientes decide invertir un poco mas, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de los granos básicos en el Mercado la Terminal y trasladarlos hasta su casa de habitación para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Beatriz M. A. is 42 years old, she is married and she has 3 children. Her eldest son is 15 years old and he is attending grade 9. Her other son is 14 years old and he is also going to grade 9, while her youngest son, 13, is attending grade 2. Her husband is a businessman . Her goal is to increase and keep up her business to keep generating for her family a source of income and to help her family. She wants to keep supporting her children and provide them with a future full of schooling.

Her business is selling grains and basic products, such as; rice, cooking oil, beans, and sugar. The time she has been running her business is 8 years. She started this business for the need to find work, and she started out by means of a loan from the foundation that supports her. She decided to carry out the purchase of products, such as: 25 pounds of rice, 10 pounds of oil and beans. Having seen an increase in clients she decided to invest a little more. the funds will be used as working capital, to be used in the purchase of gaside grains in the Terminal Market, and take them back to her home where she can satisfy the demands of her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Antonia Socorro

texts.es: Antonia Socorro C. García es originaria del cantón Chuixchimal casada con cuatro hijos originaria  del Municipio de Totonicapán ella desde varios años viene ejerciendo dicha actividad  en la venta de articulo de consumo diario en  mercado municipal del departamento de Totonicapán  ella solicita un crédito en las oficina de ASDIR. Para surtir su mercadería y principalmente en estas épocas de navidad en adquirir productos de la época, uvas, galletas, duraznos luces, adornos con el fin de obtener algunas ganancias que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonia Socorro C. G. is originally from Chuixchimal. She is married and has four children. Originally from the municipality of Totonicapan, she has been for many years running a business, selling consumer items of daily use in the municipal market in Totonicapan. She is requesting a loan from the offices of ASDIR (Kiva field partner), to restock her merchandise and especially for this Christmas season to purchase seasonal products, including grapes, cookies, sweet peaches, and decorations. Her goal is to obtain some earnings that will grant a better quality of life for her family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supplement her capital.

loans.name: Antenor

texts.es: Antenor es un joven soltero de 21 años, vive con sus padres. Cultivar plátanos es una de las actividades que desde muy niño aprendió a  realizar, ya que sus padres  son agricultores, pero desde hace tres años empezó a trabajar  de manera independiente, ya que es una de las actividades que le agrada realizar  ya que siempre le gustó estar en contacto con la naturaleza y lo que puede  obtener de ella. El cultivo de plátano para é es algo muy rentable, siempre  hay gran demanda de este producto y cabe señalara que le ayuda a pagar sus estudios superiores en la ciudad, sin embargo lo difícil de su actividad es que tiene que  enfrentar el duro sol del día que debilita a cualquiera, sobre todo en la temporada donde hay que sembrar sus plantaciones. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Antenor está dispuesto a incrementar su producción, para ello invertirá en la compra de mayores plantaciones de plátanos y café.
texts.en:
Anteno2, 21, is a single man who still lives with his parents. He learned to grow bananas as a young boy, since his parents are farmers. Three years ago he started working independently because he enjoys being outdoors, in contact with nature, and enjoys Bananas have been a profitable crop as there is a constant demand for this fruit. Anteno is paying for his college education in town with the profits from the bananas. But working and studying is tough as he must work all day under the harsh, debilitating sun, especially in planting season. This is the first loan he requests through MFP. Antenor's goal is to increase his production, so he will invest in purchasing more banana and coffee plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing banana and coffee plantations

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José es un joven de 28 años, soltero y vive con su madre. Está dedicado al cultivo de  plátano y café, actividad que realiza hace cuatro años desde que decidió independizarse económicamente y ser un apoyo para su madre. Desde entonces  trabaja muy duramente, siendo la cosecha lo que mas le agrada realizar dentro de su actividad como agricultor, porque a base de ello puede estar previendo las ganancias que podrá obtener, ya que el café y los plátanos son productos altamente demandados y muy  bien pagados, lo cual compensa el esfuerzo de horas expuesto al sol, cuidado y limpiando sus cultivos. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. José invertirá el dinero en la compra de plantas de café y plátano, los cuales le costarán S/.1000,  esto le será de gran ayuda para incrementar sus hectáreas y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
José, 28, is single and lives at home with his mother. He grows bananas and coffee. He became an independent grower four years ago, when he decided to have a business of his own and help support his mother. He works very hard, and he particularly enjoys harvesting, a time when he can look forward to the profits that he will make, after the long hours under the sun, caring for his crops. Bananas and coffee are always in great demand, and they bring in a good income for Jose. This is the first loan (1,000 soles) that Jose requests through MFP. He will invest it in purchasing more banana and coffee plants to increase his production, and obtain larger profits.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing banana and coffee plants

loans.name: Gerardo Rafael

texts.es: Don Gerardo Rafael T. T. el es un ciudano de la zona cuatro de Totonicapan que hace algunos años se ha dedicado ha su negocio que consiste en la compra y venta de accesorio y equipo de computacion y otros productos derivados que con su esfuerzo y empeño ha sobre salido y viendo la necesidad de fortalecer su capital se ha abocado en las oficina de ASDIR Para solicitar un credito con la intencion de fortalecer su capital, así satisfacer las necesidades de clientela con el fin de creser  y desarrollarse economicamente para el bienestar de su familia  y tener un pocesionamiento en el mercado de la tecnologia.
texts.en:
Gerardo Rafael T. T. is a resident of Zone 4 in Totonicapan and for several years has worked in his business that consists of buying and selling computer equipment, accessories and other related products. Due to his effort and hard work has been successful. Seeing the need to increase his business capital he visited the offices of ASDIR to request a loan with the intention of investing in his business in order to satisfy the needs of his clientele. His objective is to grow and develop economically for the well being of his family and to have a better position in the technology market.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computers and accessories

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Don Julio tiene 34 años, es casado, actualmente  vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, quienes son menores de edad. Es agricultor, ya que su actividad principal es el cultivo de plátanos, lo cual le agrada realizar, ya que es una actividad que realiza desde muy pequeño junto a sus padres. El plátano es un producto muy demandado por la zona y en temporada el precio de la producción es  favorable para  don Julio, sin embargo la producción es  algo costosa, debido a los abonos y mantenimiento de sus terrenos, los cuales  tienen que realizarse quincenalmente, por lo cual  trabaja muy duro para poder cubrir las inversiones y continuar con su producción de plátanos. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Don Julio desea invertir el dinero adquirido en la compra de abonos y mano de obra para poder dar un buen mantenimiento a sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Julio is 34 years old, he is married and he lives with his wife and their three children, all of whom are still minors. He is a farmer primarily harvesting bananas, something he loves todo and it is something he started out doing with his parents as a little boy. Bananas are a product in great demand and when they are in season the income is better for Julio. But production is somewhat expensive due to the fertilizers and maintenance of his fields, which has to be done bi-weekly. He works very hard to cover his investiments and continue with his banana harvests. This is the first loan with MFP (Kiva field partner). Julio wishes to invest the funds in the purchase of fertilizers and labor expenses for the maintenance of his fields.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to pay for the labor expenses to work the fields.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 37 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Se dedica a administrar las ganancias del servicio de transporte en el motocarro que posee y que con gran esfuerzo logró adquirir, esta nueva actividad de administradora la realiza recientemente, hace algunos meses, es algo que siempre quiso hacer, para poder llevar la cuenta de sus negocios, que es lo que más le agrada y gracias a que en la zona en que reside es muy  rentable, ya que la gente  tiene que como medio de trasporte a los motocarros para poder movilizarse, pero sin duda los problemas de la competencia afecta el alquiler de su moto. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Nelly desea invertir el dinero en el mantenimiento de su motocarro, el cual es muy costoso, por las diversas reparaciones que tiene.
texts.en:
Nelly is 37, is married, and lives with her husband and 3 children. She manages the earnings of a motorcycle rickshaw transportation service that she owns, which she acquired with a lot of effort. She recently started being the manager several months ago. She has always wanted to keep track of her business. This is what she likes to do most. The area she lives in is very profitable since the people there use motorcycle rickshaws to move around. Without a doubt, though, the problems from her competition affect how she is able to rent out her motorcycle. This is her first loan with MFP. Nelly hopes to invest the money in maintenance of her motorcycle, which is very expensive because of the different repairs that it needs.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of her motorcycle rickshaw

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhorn B. is 28-year-old farmer who specializes in growing rice and vegetables. She has been farming since 1990. She has two children, both still young. Her husband, Mr. Rat Choun, 30, is a hair cutter and also an electronics repairman; he repairs televisions, radios, and VCD players to earn revenue. The family lives in Koshchom Commune in Pursat Province.

Sokhorn is applying a loan of 1,500,000 riel ($375) to purchase a cow. She will also use part of the loan to buy materials for repairing electronics for her husband’s job.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and materials for repairing electronics

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Mr. Kosal Y., 25, is a motorcycle taxi driver. He also works as a construction supervisor who employs workers to provide a building service. He currently earns approximately $10 per day. His wife, Mrs. Houy Oum, 21, is local grocery seller. They live in Loloksar Commune in Pursat Province.

Kosal has applied for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a grocery store for his wife, to repair his motorcycle, and to pay his workers' salaries. The loan will supplement their incomes to support their family’s living expenses sufficiently.

loans.use: To purchase a grocery store, repair a motorcycle, and pay workers' salaries

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny K., a group leader of four who all live in Kdol Village in Takeo Province, owns a small grocery store. Since it is doing well, she wants to expand the business and so is requesting a loan to buy more grocer goods for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Saom Touch, is a policeman who makes a small salary that helps to support the family. Vanny is the 40-year-old mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest is a one-year-old at home.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans and so are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocer goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Mrs. Sean K. is 48-year-old widow. She has one child, and they live together in Anlongthnot Commune in Pursat Province.

Sean is a farmer who grows vegetable such as cabbages. She also grows water lilies, which she sells 3 months after planting. Sean earns approximately $3 per day. Sean is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 ($250) to purchase farm land and one cow.

loans.use: To purchase farm land and one cow

loans.name: Mrs. Sareth Mang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sareth M. is the Village Bank President of ten people who all live in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province; all the members will use the loan for different purposes. For instance, Mrs. Sareth M. is requesting the loan to buy rice seeds since she currently has an insufficient amount to cultivate rice, and she also hopes to increase her rice revenue to better support the family with this loan.

Sareth is the 53 year-old mother of five children, three of whom are employed in different business activities while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Keo Phal, is a village chief who makes a small salary that helps to support the household.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Mrs. Sophal Khat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan consists of 16 people, all of whom live in Barkou Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Sophal K., the Village Bank President selected by the members, plants rice on a 0.3-hectare field to earn a living. Because her field is currently infertile, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to deal with this problem. Sophal is a 53-year-old widow with a child who works as a dump truck driver.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her rice crop more productive.

loans.name: Saophea's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Saophea P., the 44-year-old mother of three children, all attending the local school, is the group leader of four people living in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land upon which they cultivate rice to earn a living.  Because they do not have oxen to plow the field, Saophea is requesting a loan for that purpose. With the rest of the loan, she would like to buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with oxen to plow the field.

loans.name: Ashurmurod

texts.en:
Ashurmurod is a very hard and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. He is married with four children. 

Ashurmurod works in the central city market selling women’s clothing, jeans, jackets, shirts and other clothing items. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for the past five years. Once a month, he travels to the neighboring city to purchase new goods. At the day of our visit, he had gone to purchase new goods in the neighboring city. That’s why his wife is pictured in the photo as she is helping him with his business while he is absent. 

Ashurmurod likes to work for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family. Today, Ashurmurod would like to ask for a loan of 4000 Somoni (1200 USD) for the loan repayment term of 7 months. He aims to purchase winter clothing from wholesalers and increase his merchandise assortment in his store. We believe Ashurmurod’s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Ashurmurod’s business.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing items to continue to grow his business

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Mrs.Yeng S.  lives in Preak Tateang Village in Kandal Province, where she rents land to cultivate rice. This 49-year-old mother of three children, one working in a garment factory while the others attend the local school, is now requesting a loan to rent a plot of land for cultivation and to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and fuel to make the rice crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Thon Khorn, helps her in the farming.

loans.use: To rent land to cultivate rice and purchase fertilizers, pesticides and fuel to make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhon H., 20, is a farmer who lives in Leach Commune in Pursat Province. She takes cares of two children. 

Sokhon is married to Mr. Chanthy Hean, age 39. He provides battery recharging services to his customers and also repairing bicycles for daily income. Chanthy needs to expand his business, but lacks the money to do so. Therefore, Sokhon is applying for a loan of $600 to buy more battery-recharging equipment and bicycle materials for her husband's business. 

Sokhon's husband is pictured because she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To buy more battery-recharging equipment

loans.name: Mrs. Chhorn Khum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank loan, led by Mrs. Chhorn K., consists of eight people residing in Tropang Orn Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. The members will use their share of the loan for a variety of purpose. For instance, Mrs. Chhorn K. wishes to purchase more chickens for her breeding business which is doing well.

Chhorn is 46 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Suon Vanna, is a village chief who makes a small salary that helps to support the family.

This village bank loan consists of both end-of-term loans and monthly payment loans. Those with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Mom El Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who all live in Prapang Mates Village in Kampong Chhnang Province comprise this village bank loan, led by Mrs. Mom E., a rice farmer. Although she works hard on the plantation, it yields inadequate rice revenue to support Mom’s family well. In order to improve her living conditions, she is requesting a loan to buy a plot of land to plant rice on, an action that she hopes will increase her revenue.

Mrs. Mom E. is 30 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Soeurn SoE., is a firewood collector who goes to the forest and gathers firewood to sell for an income.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to plant rice on.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy clay to make more pots for her consumers.

loans.name: Chan Vertana's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan Vertana L., the group leader of five living in Phum Thmey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, is a garment factory worker who makes a small salary that helps to support the household. Her husband, Mr. Bunthong Khorn, owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates rice to earn a living, but he currently does not have enough rice seeds. To deal with this problem, Chan is requesting a loan to buy more seeds for her husband to cultivate.

Mrs. Chan Vertana L. is 20 years old and the mother of a child who is at home, yet too young to attend school.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans and so are not required to pay any principal until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more seeds for her husband to cultivate.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
N. Mahbuba is an innovative, highly capable, and very hard-working woman. Mahbuba is divorced and has two children. In search of a way to better support her household, she started selling clothes about seven years ago. Her business allows her children go to school. Her daughter helps her with the business during her free time. 

The day of our visit, Mahbuba had left to purchase new goods in the neighboring town, so her daughter is pictured in the photo instead. It is very important to Mahbuba that her children finish school and become honest, hard-working individuals. You can help Mahbuba provide for the education of her children. She is requesting 3000 Somoni ($ 900 USD) to buy winter clothing for the upcoming season. Mahbuba wants to continue to support her children and only wishes to work in order to achieve this. Let’s support this loving and hard-working mother.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing in order to increase her business inventory

loans.name: Lon's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan for three group members. The borrowers all live in Beung Melea Commune in Siem Reap Province.

The first group member is Mrs. Lon L., 49, who makes a living selling Kmer noodles in Beung Melea Village. She currently earns approximately $2 per day. She has six children: four are in school, and two are married and farmers. Her husband, Mr. Cheum Chea, 50, is a rice farmer who also grows vegetables such as cabbages and water lillies to sell. Lon is requesting a $200 loan to buy groceries and piglets.

The group also includes Mrs. Kheng H., 32, who is local rice farmer. She is requesting a loan of $200 to buy a cart for transporting rice. The last member is Mrs. Sky S., 43, who is a farmer. She is applying for a $200 loan to purchase piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy groceries and piglets

loans.name: Dam's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan for three women who all live in Siem Reap Province. The leader of the group is Mrs. Dam K.. She is 46 years old and makes a living raising pigs from her home. She is the mother of six children: two are married and the rest to go to school. Her husband, Mr. Tem Nhem, 48, is a fisherman. He depends on Beung Tunle Sap Lake, which is the most important place for Cambodia’s fisherman to catch fish. Dam has applied for a loan of $150 to buy more fishing tools for her husband’s work.

The other two group members include Mrs. Toeum R., 33, who is a fisherwoman. She seeks a loan of $150 to buy fishing tools to use for her work. Mrs. Lorn L., 39, makes her living by fishing as well. Lorn is requesting a $150 loan to purchase fishing tools.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tools

loans.name: Bhagan Saleem Masih Group

texts.en:
Bhagan baji is a 40-year-old woman who resides in Kasur, Pakistan, a city famous for its sweetmeat. She has been living in this city for the past 25 years. Her husband, S. M., is a government employee. She has five children: two sons and three daughters. Her elder son is in the 8th standard grade and her younger son is in the 2nd standard grade. Her elder daughter is in the 7th standard grade, the next daughter is in the 6th standard grade, and her youngest daughter is in the 3rd standard grade. 

Bhagan baji has a business selling clothes. She runs this business to share her income with her husband, so that he is able to meet all of their household expenses and the desires of her children. 

She successfully repaid her three previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to expand her clothing business. 

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy leather to resell. Salma baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Asia baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Shamim M. Aslam Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is a 51-year-old woman and the wife of M. A., who has sells construction supplies. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. Shamim baji resides in Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has been living for the past 14 years. She is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is a cobbler. The next son is an electrician. Her two younger sons want to be cobblers like their elder brother. Her daughter stays at home and helps her to embroider dresses. 

Shamim baji sells the embroidered dresses in a cloth market and earns a profit. She is saving her profit for the marriage of her daughter. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies, such as cement and sand, for her husband’s business. 

She is joined in her loan group by three other members. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Munnaza Tanveer baji wants a loan to buy fruit to resell. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: 'Baji,' which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Sopharin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopharin Y., who lives in Svay Kraom village in Kampong Chhnang Province, owns a small grocery store in the local market while her husband, Mr. Ly Vancy, is a construction worker. Even with two incomes, however, they still lack sufficient funds to allow their household to enjoy good living conditions. Therefore, Sopharin is requesting a loan to add her savings to build a new house for her family.

Sopharin is 25 years old and the mother of two children, one attending the local school while the other is yet too young to study. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Razia M.bota Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a 52-year-old lady who resides in Kasur, Pakistan, where she has been living for the past 34 years. Her husband, M., is a milkman by profession. Razia baji has six children: five sons and one daughter. Her eldest son helps her husband in his milk business. The others are free and don’t do anything. 

Razia baji helps her husband to milk the buffalo. Her husband 25 years of experience selling buffalo milk. Razia baji has successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband’s milk business. 

She is joined in her loan group by three other members. Razia baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. Sahrish baji and Hamidan baji each want a loan to buy leather to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling

loans.name: Gizgayit

texts.en: Gizgayit is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in the Fuzuli region, Bahmanli village. She has been in business for 3 years. She was born in 1974. Now, she needs a loan to buy medicines.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Suraiya M.hanif Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is a 45-year-old woman who resides in Kasur, Paksitan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has been living for the past 18 years. Her husband, M., sells leather. She is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her son helps his father in his leather business. Her daughter works in a cotton factory. 

Suraiya baji is a cook by profession. She cooks Punjabi (Daal Chawal) food and sells it in the community to earn a profit. She has successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more leather to expand her husband’s business. 

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Shamim baji, Rani baji and another woman named Rani baji each want a loan to buy leather to resell. Jia baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy leather to resell

loans.name: Anwar Akmal Masih Group

texts.en:
Anwar baji is a 44-year-old woman who resides in Kasur, Pakistan, a city is famous for its sweetmeat. Her husband, A. M., is a blacksmith by profession. Anwar baji is the mother of seven children: two sons and five daughters. Her eldest son works with his father. Her eldest daughter helps her to embroider dresses. The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. 

Anwar baji embroiders dresses and sells them in the clothing market. She has successfully repaid her three previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy iron to expand her husband’s business so that her husband will be able to make more iron rods and expand his business. 

She is joined in her loan group by three more members. Zarqa baji and Asia baji each want a loan to buy leather to resell. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy iron for making iron rods

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en: Mahammad was born in 1953. He has been in the cattle breeding business for 10 years. He is married with 3 children. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in the Fuzuli region, Bala Bahmanli village. Now he needs a loan to buy 3 calves.

loans.use: To buy 3 calves

loans.name: Elmita

texts.en:
In the little village of Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental lives Mrs. Elmita M. L., 53 years old, married and with 5 children. Her husband is 73 years old is still able to fix cars and trucks and is known as a good mechanic in their area.

Elmita started their little "sari-sari" (convenience) store after their marriage and also raises swine as their other source of income. By these means, they were able to send their children to school. Luckily, all got stable jobs, 3 are happily married and 2 are still single. It hasn't been the case that they sit prettily as all the children got their jobs. They continue the store and swine businesses for their own living. To give them company, their "apos" (grandchildren) live with them.

Elmita joined Paglaum MPC after a friend referred her. She is attracted to the programs and services like micro financing, livelihood program and other benefits like dividends and insurance. Mrs. L. has already been a member for more than a year. She is a member in good standing and very helpful to her co-group members. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 12,000.00 and is intending to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store and additional feed for hog fattening.

All she wants for her life now is to live comfortably in their renovated house.

loans.use: Sari-sari Store (Mini Store) and Hog Fattening

loans.name: Nuraddin

texts.en: Nuraddin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in the Fuzuli region, Kurdmahmudlu village. He is married with 3 children. Five years ago he started a business of transporting wheat and barley for sale. Now he needs a loan to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Gladys Nagadya’S Group

texts.en:
Gladys is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is 21 and married with 3 children aged between 2 and 7 years. Two of her children go to school. Gladys takes care of her parents and two orphans. She owns a three-room house where she is staying with five people. They have electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets two meals a day and rarely take tea.

Gladys works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala, dealing in second-hand clothes. She uses public transport to and from work. Gladys buys theses clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and to all categories of people, mainly women. Gladys has been in this business for five years, working six days a week.

She is faced with a challenge of high transport costs from home to work, and the rainy season, which makes movement impossible because she lives in a place that floods. She has been with MCDT for four years, working all this time with the same group-mates. She wants to use this very loan to buy more bales of clothes. Gladys aspires to sell new clothes in the future.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zulfiyya

texts.en: Zulfiyya (her husband is pictured) was born in 1969. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in the Fuzuli region in the Finnish house, which is built for IDPs. Three years ago her husband started a butchery business. Now they need a loan to buy meat.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en:
Mrs. Bopha Y., 45, runs a cafe in her home, selling milk and other drinks for income to pay her family's expenses. She has six children: five are in school, and one son sells beans and also responds to family's foods. Her husband, Mr. Tepsatra Sao, 49, is a staff member of the Ministry of Commerce; he currently gets a salary of $200 per month. 

Bopha applied this loan for her son's business, so she requests a $1,000 loan to purchase beans to store for her son to sell. Bopha lives in Battambang Province. She and her husband are pictured.

loans.use: To purchase  beans

loans.name: Zakhir

texts.en: Zakhir is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in the Fuzuli region, Bala Bahmanli village. He was born in 1967. Five years ago he started breeding poultry. He is married with 3 children. Now he needs a loan to buy more poultry.

loans.use: To buy more poultry

loans.name: Mrs. Pao Soun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, led by Mrs. Pao S., a basket maker, consists of 21 members living in Ou Ta Sek Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Each will use the loan for different purposes. For example, Pao’s husband, Mr. Va Chor, is a farmer whose field is currently infertile, so Pao is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to support his field and make it more productive.

Mrs. Pao S. is 35 years old and the mother of six children, all attending the local school. The two M. in the picture are there in place of their wives.

This is a village bank loan consisting of 16 end-of-term loans and 5 monthly payment loans. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support her husband's field.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly I., a villager in Trapaing Bei Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, is a 58-year-old widow with two children, one a motorbike taxi driver and the other a garment factory worker. Since her first child’s motorbike is old and in need of costly repairs, Ly is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy another one for his business.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her child's business.

loans.name: Sobun

texts.en: Mrs. Sobun U., a 42-year-old mother of two children attending the local school, lives in Trapaing Bei Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, where she is a vegetable-seller making a small income that helps to support her household. Her husband, Mr. Thaong Puthy, is a motorbike taxi driver whose motorbike is old and consuming a great deal of petrol.  To reduce operational expenses, Sobun is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more pork to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish for her customers.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en: Zahra is an 18 year-old woman, married with one child and living in Jeb Jenin in the Bekaa valley. Zahra works as a beautician. Since she has started to work in this field almost 2 years, Zahra was able to acquire a big number of clients. Today as she wishes to propose more services to her clientele, she is requesting $700 in order to buy a wax machine and beauty products.

loans.use: Buy equipment and beauty products

loans.name: Thoun

texts.en:
Mr. Thoun J., 43, is a motorcycle taxi driver who lives in Vealvong Commune in Kompong Cham Province. He is married to Mrs. Srun Ly, 39, who sells rice and charcoal to earn income to support her family's home. The couple has four children, all of whom are single. 

Thoun decided to request a loan of $600 to buy rice, charcoal, and perfumes for his wife to sell. The loan will increase his family income to pay for daily expenses and enable his kids to go to school. 

Mr. Thoun's wife is pictured because he was not available.

loans.use: To buy rice, charcoal, and perfumes

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin K., 49, is married and lives with her husband (pictured in the photo) and 5 children in the Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband earn their living by growing rice and different types of vegetables. Together, they earn about $5 per day. Rin K. is requesting a loan of $500 to hire a farm worker to help harvest the crops and plow the farmland in preparation for the next growing season.

loans.use: Hire a farm worker to help harvest the crops and plow the farmland.

loans.name: Mrs. Channy Koem Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of eleven members, is located in Svay Chrum Thmey village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Channy K. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a bean seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more beans to sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Sin Phalla, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Channy K. has three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. All the members of the bank are presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Kimho Mey  Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of eleven members, is located in Svay Chrum ThM. village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  They plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Kimho M. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a dessert seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it.  Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more ingredients to make delicious desserts for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Keo Chum, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Kimho M. has three children.  One of her children repairs motorbikes;  another is a construction worker; and the third is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to make desserts to sell.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Файзуллаева Махбуба живет в районе Гиссар. Змужем и имеет двоих детей.Имеет средне -техническое образование.По специальности техник-гидролог.  Живут отдельно от родителей . Муж в России на заработках. Сама работает в диллерском центре. Предоставляет услуги перевода денег,продает сим-карты и запчасти для мобильных телефонов.Решила получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и сделать небольшой ремонт в помещение. Это поможет привлечь новых клиентов и увеличить доход. Кроме того она одна во всем кишлаке , которая предоставляет данные услуги. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahbuba F. lives in the Gissar region. She is married and has two children. She has secondary technical education and is a technical hydrologist by profession. She lives separately from her parents. Her husband is working in Russia and she works in the dealing center. Her job is to provide money transfer services, sell SIM cards and mobile phone parts. Mahbuba decided to apply for a loan to increase commodity circulation and to do some repairs in the building. This will help her attract new clients and increase her income. Besides, Mahbuba is the only one in her village who provides these services. She will be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: 01 Phố 1- Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs H. Thị Hường is the group leader for group 01, town 1, Đông Sơn district. The group has 5 members. Mrs Hường was born in 1975. Her husband is Mr Trần Anh Tuấn, born in 1970. They have a son, Trần Anh Thuý. He is in grade 8. Mrs Hường makes incense sticks. Her husband is a construction worker. She is seeking a loan of 1.626.900 VND to invest in her incense shop. Other members in her group are all from the same town:

* Mrs B. Thị Sáu, born in 1963. She sells groceries.
