* Mrs N. Thị Liên, she and her husband want to open a bike repair shop. 
* Mrs N. Thị Viên, she and her family want to open a shop to sell rice.
* Mrs N. Thị Nhung, she and her family sell rice, rice paper and raise livestock.

 Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer


Nhóm 01 - Phố 1, phường Đông Sơn gồm 5 thành viên. Chị H. Thị Hường là nhóm trưởng, MS 0016. Chị Hường sinh năm 1975. Chồng chị là Trần Anh Tuấn sinh năm 1970. Anh chị có 1 cháu trai là Trần Anh Thuý. Cháu đang học lớp 8. Chị làm nghề làm hương, chồng chị làm nghề thợ xây, chị đang vay mức vốn 1626900VND để đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng làm hương. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm cùng ở phố 1 phường Đông Sơn và có cùng mức vay: Chị B. Thị Sáu sinh năm 1963, MS 0017. Gia đình chị vay vốn để bán hàng tạp hoá Chị N. Thị Liên, MS 0019. Anh chị vay vốn để mở cửa hàng nhỏ sữa chữa xe đạp Chị N. Thị Viên, MS 0018. Gia đình chị vay vốn để mở cửa hành bán gạo Chị N. Thị Nhung, MS 0020. Gia đình chị vay vốn để buôn bán gạo, chăn nuuôi làm bánh đa

loans.use: To invest in her incense store

loans.name: Sakorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sakorn L. is 53 years old and she lives in Trapaing Sva village in Kandal Province. She has a child who is enrolled in the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Sus Mao, are farmers who own a piece of land where they cultivate vegetables to earn their living. They cannot earn enough revenue from this work to support their household. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sakorn L. decided to request a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She and her husband are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Nurbibi

texts.ru: Раджабова Норбиби проживает в районе Гиссар . Живет со своей семьей. У нег трое детей. Возраст 34 года. Образование среднее. Арендует столовую в центре района. Бизнес успешный , но помещение требует ремонта. Поэтому она обратилась к нам за кредитом . Полученные деньги она сможет использовать для покупки стройматериала.  Улучшив условия в кафе, таким образом она привлечет новых клиентов , что даст возможность больше заработать. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nurbibi R. lives in the Gissar district with her family. She has three children, and is 34 years old. She completed secondary school. She rents a cafeteria in the district's center. Business is good, but the facility needs repairs. To that end she came to us for a loan. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials. One she has improved the cafe's condition she will be able to attract new customers, and earn more income. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Facility repairs

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom P. is a villager in Trapaing Sva village in Kandal Province. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children; two are employed in a garment factory and the others attend the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Sin Sokly, are farmers.  They own a plot of land where they cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn their living. They face a problem because they have only one ox, so they cannot plow their field. Thus, Mrs. Mom P. decided to request a loan to buy another ox to help plow the field. She and her husband are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a second ox to help plow the field.

loans.name: Husniya

texts.ru: Рахмонова Хусния жительница района Гиссар. Не замужем ,живет с родителями в селе. Занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Ее торговая точка находится на одном из рынков района. Бизнесом занимается уже 8 лет.Планирует получить кредит , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Кредит сможет погасить в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Husniya R. lives in the Gissar district. She is unmarried and lives with her parents in a small town. She sells groceries for a living. Her sales stall is in one of the markets of the district. She has been in this business for the past 8 years. She decided to take out credit in order to increase sales. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Mr. Sophat T. is a farmer who lives in Preak Svay village in Kandal Province. He is 59 years old and the father of five children; two of his children are farmers, another is employed in a garment factory, and the other two are enrolled in the local school. He owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to earn his living. He faces some problems because his field is not fertile and has a lot of insects, which damage his crop. In order to deal with these problems, Mr. Sophat T. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. An Tai, is a jasmine seller. Mr. Sophat T. and his wife are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhon C. is a villager in Preak Ta Tin village in Kandal Province. She is 50 years old and the mother of two children; one is a weaver and the other attends the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Mang Sophal, are farmers who own a piece of land where they cultivate vegetables to earn their living. They face some problems because they do not have vegetable seeds to plant, and their field is not sufficiently fertile. In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Sokhon C. decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers; she will use the rest of the loan to add to her savings to buy a pump to irrigate her field. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and a pump.

loans.name: Ndongo

texts.fr: Ndongo est agé de 46 ans il est marié et oére de famille .Pour échapper aux difficultés au monde rural dues au deficit pluviometrique, il a quitté depuis cinq (05) ans son village pour venir s' installer dans la périphérie de la ville de Mbour avec sa famille.Pour gagner sa vie chaque matin il charge sa charette de paille d'arachide pour le vendre à travers la ville .Avec la fin des récoltes ,il sollicite un pret pour s'approvisionner en marchandise a bon prix.
texts.en:
Ndongo is 46 years old, married and the father of a family. To escape the difficulties of a rural life plagued by a shortage of rainfall, five years ago he left his village and with his family relocated to the outskirts of the town of Mbour. To earn a living, each morning Ndongo loads up his wagon with peanut straw and sells it around town. As the end of the harvest approaches, he is requesting a loan in order to stock up on straw at a good price.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mohrusor

texts.ru: Хисарова Мохрухсор жительница Гиссарского района. Возраст 32 года , замужем и имеет двоих детей. Занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке района. Торгует одеждой. Кредит решила получить для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и завезти сезонный товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mohrusor H. lives in the Gissar district. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children. She works in sales. She sells clothing from her stall in the district's central market. She decided to take out a loan in order to increase sales volume and bring in seasonal goods. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan L. is the leader of a group with four members who all live in Poub village in Takeo Province. She is 57 years old and the mother of three children; two are farmers helping their father, and the other attends the local school. She is a grocer who owns a small store in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Chuon Thim, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. He faces a small problem because his field is insufficiently fertile. In order to solve this problem, they decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to  make the crop more productive. 

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has an overall delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Собирджонов Шавкат житель Гиссарского района.Возраст 28 лет .Женат и имеет троих детей.Работает водителем пассажирской маршрутки. Маршрутка марки"Газель" его собственная.Это дело является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Неделю , как произошла поломка автомашины . Кредит решил получить сразу как узнал о возможности получить кредит. Закпив необходимые запчасти он сможет сделать капитальный ремонт автомобиля. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shavkat S. lives in the Gissar district. He is 28 years old, married, and has three children. He drives a minibus taxi for a living. He has his own Gazelle brand minibus. This work is the only source of income for his family. A week ago the minibus broke down. The minute Shavkat learned of the availability of loans he decided to take one out. Once he buys the needed parts he can make major repairs on the vehicle. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of car parts

loans.name: Mrs. Phan Chheun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of eighteen members, is located in Kruos village in Takeo Province.  The members plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Phan C. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a 33-year-old mother of four children who attend the local school.  Mrs. Phan C. is a mat weaver. Her husband, Mr. Chhorn Thoeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. He faces a small problem because his field is insufficiently fertile to support his crop. Thus, they decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. These loans do not require any principal repayment until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. The loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has an overall delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Shahali

texts.en: Shahali is 57 years old, married, and has 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the town of Fuzuli, and he settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Dilagarda village. Ten years ago he started his business selling souvenirs and glassware, tea things, and other things. Now he is requesting a loan of $1200 (970 AZN) to buy souvenirs and other items to sell.

loans.use: Buy souvenirs and other items to sell

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of six members, is located in Souben village in Takeo Province.  The members plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Thy S. is the village bank president, selected by the members. He is 29 years old and the father of two children who are enrolled in the local school. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates both rice and vegetables to earn his living. His wife, Mrs. Kong Chrean, is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, they decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. They hope to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. 

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has an overall delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Хасанов Фируз проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 36 лет, имеет двоих детей. Образование высшее.Работает  бухгалтером в Агроинвестбанке. Кроме того занимается торговлей. Торгует на рынке овощами. Привозит товар и сдает оптом. Хочет получить кредит и использовать его для покупки картофеля и лука. Продавать будет зимой по более вычокой цене. Погашать кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Firuz H. lives in the Gissar district. He is 36 years old and has two children. He completed secondary school, and works as an accountant at Agroinvestbank. In addition he works selling vegetables at the market. He brings in the goods and delivers them wholesale. He would like to use a loan for purchasing potatoes and onions. They will be sold during winter at a higher price. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of produce (potatoes and onions)

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok S. is 40 years old and she lives in Kampong Svay village in Kandal Province.  She is the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Mrs. Sok S. is a fish breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus she decided to request a loan to buy more fish and fish food. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Sao Oul, is a fisherman. She and her husband are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fish and fish food.

loans.name: Sojida

texts.ru: Хасанова Соджида проживает в районе Гиссар. Живет не далеко от центра . Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Занимается торговлей одежды уже 17 лет. Товар привозит из города Душанбе. Торговая точка находится на центральном рынке района. МЕсто арендованное и она платит арендную плату ежемесячно. Сейчас планирует получить кредит для ого, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sojida H. lives in the Gissar district, not far from the center. She is married and has four children. For the past 17 years she has been selling clothing. The goods are brought in from the city of Dushanbe. Her sales stall is in the district's central market. She rents the stall for a monthly fee. Now she plans to use a loan to increase sales volume. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales volume

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Mrs. Sophea P. is a 34-year-old widow who lives in Preak Ta Tean village in Kandal Province. She has a four-year-old child.  She is a grocer who runs a small store from her home. In addition, she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice and vegetables to earn her living. She faces a problem because she does not have bean seeds to plant.  So Mrs. Sophea P. decided to request a loan to buy bean seeds; she will use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To buy bean seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar M.ahmad Group

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar baji is a 35-year-old woman who resides in Walton in Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has been living for the past 15 years. She has no children. Parveen baji’s husband, M., makes jewelry boxes. He has been in this business for the past 35 years. 

Parveen baji runs a grocery shop in her house. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy cloth, nails, and wood to make more jewelry boxes. 

She is joined in her loan group by a three other members. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy colored thread and sketchbooks for her decorative embroidery business. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her salon. Salma Qayyum baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To make jewelry boxes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline.

loans.name: Naila Maqbool Bashir Group

texts.en:
Naila baji is the wife of M. B.. Mr. B. makes wooden decorations and sells them in several gift shops. He learned this art from his father, because this is their family business. Naila baji resides in Walton in Lahore, Pakistan, where she has been living for the past 15 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. 

Naila baji has a business sewing clothes. She does this work because she wants to give her children a good education. Naila baji successfully repaid her previous four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy wood, polishers, and tools to make more wooden decorations. 

She is joined in her loan group by three more members. Rashidan baji and Parveen baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle, like a tuk-tuk). Bilquis Begum baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy material for making wooden decorations

loans.name: Silin's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Silin L. is 28 years old and the leader of a group of five members who all live in Trapang Chambok village in Kampong Chhang Province. He has a child who is attending the local school. Mr. Silin L. is a construction worker. Aside from this business, he is also a farmer.  He and his wife, Mrs. Kuy Sokchea, own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice to earn a living. They face a problem because their field is insufficiently fertile to support their crop. Thus, Mr. Silin L. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to make his land more productive. 

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has an overall delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Wotunira Group

texts.en:
Robinah is the chair of the Wotunira Loan Group in the Zana district of Kampala. She is a 40-year old married mother of four children, aged 15-22.  She also cares for two adopted orphans.

Robinah has owned an operated a retail electrical supply stall above the old taxi park in Kampala’s city center for 15 years. She sells such things as assortments of wire, switches, power outlets and light appliances.  Her monthly profit averages 150,000 to 200,000 Ush.  

She began using loans many years ago to help develop her business. Her first loan was 50,000 Ush. Her current loan is 1,500,000 Ush, and her revenues have increased commensurately. Robinah will invest the loan proceeds to restock her supplies of copper cabling, arrestors, switches, plugs, power cables, outlets, and related electrical supplies. She imports her stock from Kenya and Dubai, and her smiling face and expertise keep her customers returning.

Robinah’s family depends on her income to pay school fees and contribute to the family’s living costs. With Pearl’s compulsory savings program, Robinah saves 20,000 Ush each week. Someday, she hopes to transition her business into a wholesale distributorship.  This will give her more sales and a consistent revenue stream.  She and her husband hope to be able to afford a plot of land soon so they can construct their own home and see their children educated to the degree level.

loans.use: To restock supplies of copper cabling, arrestors, switches, plugs, power cables, outlets, and related electrical supplies

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr: Daouda tient une quincaillerie au quartier de Santhiaba. Ce jeune entrepreneur marié et pére de 02 enfants arrive grâce à son commerce de subvenir aux besoins familiaux; Il sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter son stock et réaliser davantage de profit.
texts.en:
Daouda has a hardware store in the Santhiaba section of town. Thanks to that business, this young entrepreneur, who is married and the father of two children, is able to meet the needs of his family. He is requesting a loan to increase his inventory in order to earn more profit.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of spare parts

loans.name: Mrs. Mai Yum Sren Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of thirteen people, is located in Chrok Romeat village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  Mrs. Mai Yum S. is the village bank president. She is a 27-year-old mother of two children; one attends the local school and the younger one is too young to work or study. She sells clothes in the local market. Her husband, Mr. M. Pleu, is a blacksmith. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fashionable clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more fashionable clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mwavu Teyebaka Group

texts.en:
Polline O., age 45, is the leader of the Mwavu Teyebaka women’s group on Lumumba Avenue in Kampala. She is married with six children and cares for three orphans. She has a restaurant called Kalo Eating Place in the same location where her group meets, and she has a good clientele. Come lunch time, the place is filled with people from offices and all over town who want to have something traditional to fill their stomachs.  

Polline has been taking loans to help her to maintain her restaurant each day, such as buying food ,sauce, plates, cups, and so much more. To date, she is so happy about it. She now needs another loan to help to buy more food from the villages where the prices are cheaper.

loans.use: To buy food for her restaurant

loans.name: Razia Shoqat Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of Mr. S., who drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). She resides in Walton in Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has been living for the past 25 years. She is the mother of two sons, both of whom are in the 5th standard grade. 

Razia baji has a beauty salon in her house where she does bridal and party makeup. She has been in this business for 15 years. She successfully repaid her four previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy cosmetics and hairdryers for her beauty salon. 

She is joined in her loan group by 3 more members. Shagufta baji wants a loan to buy flowers for her flower business. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit for her fruit business. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey C. is 37 years old and the leader of a group of six members who all live in Svay Chrum Thmey village in Kampong Chhang Province. She has five children; one is a tailor, one helps the parents' business, and the others are enrolled in the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Nut Sony, sell beef in the local market. Since this business is going well, they have a lot of customers and increased demand. Thus, Mrs. Srey C. decided to request a loan to purchase more beef to sell to her customers. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell.

loans.name: Sleiman

texts.en:
Sleiman is a 56-year-old married man who lives with his wife in Borj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Sleiman has owned and operated a grocery store since 2006. When Sleiman first started his business, he faced some difficulties because of a lack of cash. However, now that his business is well-established, he knows how to make his business successful and how to treat his clients because he is a good manager.

He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 in order to purchase more merchandise for his store as well as a washing machine for his wife. This is the first time that he has requested a loan, so he greatly appreciates your support.

loans.use: To expand his inventory and to purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.ru: Файзуллаев Шерзод житель гиссарского райна. Возраст 20 лет, холост. Образование неполное высшее. Учится в Политехническом Университете. Работиает в диллерском центре. Оказывает услуги по ремонту мобильных телефонов. Кредит хочет получить для того, чтобы закупить запчасти , используемые в ремонте. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sherzod F. lives in the Gissar district. He is a 20 year old bachelor. He is completing his university degree as a student at the Polytechnic University. He works in a small shop, providing mobile phone repair services. He would like to use a loan to purchase spare parts needed for repairs. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Kurbonkhon

texts.en:
A. Kurbonkhon is a widow living in Shahrituz, Tajikistan with her daughter and grandson. Kurbonkhon runs a small business selling women’s clothing in the local market. She has been involved in this trade for 15 years. 

She recently moved her vending facility to a different location, which has promoted an increase in her sales. Kurbonkhon has many loyal customers. She is very friendly and amiable with each client, thus giving her a unique talent of attracting new customers. Kurbonkhon purchases clothing wholesale every week. She is hoping to use the loan of 1500 Somoni ($ 450 USD) to purchase winter clothing for women. She hopes to see her venture grow big enough so that she can afford to buy a new vending facility in the future.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing for her business, in the hopes of later purchasing a new vending facility in the future

loans.name: Mrs. Sory Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of ten members, is located in Phsar village in Kampong Chhnang Province. The members plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Sory C. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is 54 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are laborers while the others are enrolled in the local school.  Her husband, Mr. Soeung ChansE., is a duck breeder. Mrs. Sory C. sells chickens in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand; she has a lot of customers and increased demand. In order to support this business, Mrs. Sory C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more chickens to sell to her customers. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. These borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has an overall delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 36-year-old man who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Haidar has owned a bakery since 2004. He sells mankoucheh and is known for his good and very tasty mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, and the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Haidar requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance on his shop, like painting, buying new ingredients for making his mankoucheh, and also for paying the school tuition fees for his children. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

In the beginning, he faced a difficulty which was the lack of cash, but now that he knows how to treat his clients well, he has improved a lot in his work.

loans.use: Haidar will use the loan to do maintenance in his shop, purchase merchandise and also pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Davlatkhuja

texts.en:
D. Davlatkhuja is 37 years old and is married with two children. Davlatkhuja is a market vendor. He has been selling fruits for the past three years. 

During these years, Davlatkhuja has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, he knows how to store the fruits to maintain their marketable conditions and to not lose the taste and their useful properties. He sells fruits such as: apples, pears and pomegranates in the central, local market. 

Davlatkhuja begins his workday early morning - at 5:00 a.m. Buying vegetables and fruits from the local farmers, he sells them at the market. In the market, he is well-known because of his attractive prices and friendly customer service feature. All this allows Davlatkhuja’s business to generate a stable and considerable income stream for his family. 

Due to the current season, Davlatkhuja’s goods are in high demand. For this reason, he is planning to purchase new, fresh fruits to sell. Today, he is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($ 600 US Dollars) that will allow him to expand his business. With your help, this will be possible. He promises to repay the loan within 9 months and thanks everyone for supporting him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits to sell during the high-demand season

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 50-year-old man who lives in Bourj Barajneh, the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. He has been selling “Knefeh” for the last 17 years. Knefeh is a traditional breakfast Lebanese sweet; it is a special kind of braided cheese that is served with liquid sugar in a round bread. It is also served as dessert, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. In America and in Europe, Knefeh will be known as a gourmet dish that will surpass in popularity the cheesecake and the pancake.

Ali requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to finance his son's wedding. Ali has been a micro-credit client for 6 years and has always paid on time.

In the beginning, when he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash. The loan has helped him improve his financial condition. He is special in his knefeh business because according he has a good way of dealing with his clients and also with his knefeh. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to finance his son's wedding

loans.name: Oumar Seydi

texts.fr: Oumar Seydi N. est dans le secteur de la pêche. Il vend du matériel de pêche (filets, bacs ...) et exploite des pirogues. Cet entrepreneur sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son fond de roulement et faire face à la demande. Il a une expérience avérée du secteur.
texts.en:
Oumar Seydi N. is in the fishery business. He sells fishing equipment (nets and crates, etc.), and operates several canoes. This entrepreneur is seeking a loan to increase his working capital and meet the demand. He has proven experience in this field.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fishing

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 33-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Jihad has owned a grocery shop for 10 years. He sells grocery products and candies. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his grocery shop. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on schedule.

When he first opened his shop, he had some savings that had helped him and he had his father's financial support to buy merchandise. Now, he plans to expand his business and diversify his merchandise in order to attract more clients.

loans.use: Jihad needs the loan to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Avria

texts.ru: Рахмонова Аврия жительница района Гиссар. Возраст 24 года. Не замужем. Живет у родителей. Семья очень большая и , чтобы ее прокормить нужно много работать. Она занимается бизнесом . Имеет торговую точку на рынке , небольшой столик , где продает продукты питания. Кредит планирует получить для того,, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцкв.
texts.en:
Avria R. lives in the Gissar region. She is 24 years old. She is unmarried and lives with her parents. Her family is very big and they have to work hard to sustain it. She does her own business and has her own vendor space on the market, a small table where she sells food products. Avria plans to get a loan to increase commodity circulation. She plans to pay it off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora A. operates a small business selling baby clothes and supplies in Penjikent, Tajikistan. She has an attractively arranged store in the Penjikent market in Tajikistan where she carries all sorts of necessary items for new mothers including toys. Gulnora has been in business for about 4 years and has developed a stable, profitable enterprise based on products that are always in demand. Her business has become the main source of income for her and her husband. Since Gulnora’s business is growing, she is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($ 750 USD) to increase her working capital and help boost the further development of her business. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mairamoy

texts.en: Mairamoy M.  is a 37 years old married woman with two children. For the past 8 years, Mairamoy has been selling kitchen items from her store. She travels weekly to the neighboring cities of Dushanbe, Khujand, and Istaravshan to purchase new inventory. She started her business with only $ 500 USD in capital and gradually expanded her business and now has about $5000 US Dollars in capital. Mairamoy feels that with more working capital the shop could generate more income, so she is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD). She promises to repay the loan within 12 months.  Let's help this incredible mother give her children a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase additional kitchen items for resale.

loans.name: Nouha

texts.en:
Nouha lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children.  Nouha has been a seamstress for the last seventeen years and she has also made clothing for seven years. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase fabrics for her sewing. Nouha has been a micro-credit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

Nouha is a very dynamic person and she is known for her good work as well as the good quality she provides in her work. Nouha says that she feels like she is “gifted” that’s why she is talented in her work. But in the beginning she faced some difficulties because she didn’t have any cash to open a shop, and she said that thanks to A. Majmoua, she was able to achieve her dream and be an independent woman. She plans in the future to purchase a newer and more sophisticated sewing machine.

loans.use: Nouha needs the loan to purchase fabrics for her sewing

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en: Ilhomjon A. is a good father, hard-working farmer, and is steadfast in his endeavor of raising animals. Thanks to his wife’s assistance, he is able to raise and feed the animals and prepare them for sale at both fairs and marketplaces in nearby towns. Traveling to nearby towns increases his costs, but the increase is offset by the higher price he is able to command. Ilhomjon would now like to increase the amount of cattle and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 Somoni ($ 450 USD). He promises to be responsible and prompt in repaying it.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Toufic

texts.en:
Toufic is a 50-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Toufic has been a bus driver for three years. He requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to get some engine parts, do some maintenance and paint his bus. Toufic has been a micro-credit client for three years now and has always paid on time.

The loan has influenced his life in a good way and he is thankful to Al Majmoua. Toufic is known for his punctuality; that is why his clients like him. He plans in the future to purchase a bigger bus and also to open an office.

loans.use: Toufic will use the loan to get engine parts, do maintenance and paint his bus.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en: Nigora I. is 26 years old and is married with one child. Difficult living conditions have forced her husband to leave for Russia to find work. Nigora makes dried apricots and sells them at the local market. This is her family's main source of income and it provides a steady cashflow. She always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is now requesting a loan which will be used to stock up her inventory of dried apricot. She deeply appreciates your support and would like to thank all of you.

loans.use: To purchase dried apricots inventory.

loans.name: Nusrat Maqsood Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Nusrat baji is a 29-year-old woman who resides in Walton in Lahore, Pakistan, where she has been living for the past 20 years. Her husband, M. A., is a butcher who runs a butcher shop in the community. He sells chicken meat. 

Nusrat baji has seven children: five daughters and two sons. Her eldest son works with his father in his butcher shop. The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Nusrat baji embroiders dresses on orders. She takes orders from her neighborhood and charges a fee of $4 per dress. She makes four dresses in a month. She invests part of her income in her husband’s business and uses some to meet household expenses. She has successfully repaid her four previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more chickens to expand her husband’s business. 

She is joined in her loan group by three more members. Maryam baji and Suraiya baji each want a loan to buy a digital camera for their photo studios. Majeedan baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her vegetable business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for butcher shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase flour and other items to sell in shop

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.en: Rahmon K., a father of 3,  is a very responsible gentleman who repairs electrical appliance for a living at the local Isfara area. His business is widely visited by many because he is capable of fixing many types of electrical appliances and offers his clients a high quality service. Rahmon has the urgent need to purchase modern electrical instruments to provide better service in the future and is requesting a loan for this reason. Rahmon deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchasing electrical instruments.

loans.name: Tarifa Javed Masih Group

texts.en:
Tarifa baji is a 38-year-old woman who resides in Walton in Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has been living for the past 20 years. She completed her education until the 8th standard grade, but couldn’t get more education due to her father’s low income. Her husband, J. M., works in a cinema and provides tickets to the people. 

Tarifa baji makes decorative embroidered dresses on order and earns a good profit on them. She has successfully repaid her four previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy clothes, patterns, and colored thread to expand her decorative embroidery business. 

She is joined in her loan group by three more members. Samina baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Nasira baji wants a loan to buy chairs and tools for her barber salon. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and spices for her food business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy material to make decorative embroidered dresses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 39-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Nabil has been a house painter for the last eighteen years. He requested a loan of 500 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to repay his debts. Nabil has been a micro-credit client for five years now and has always paid on time.

The loans have helped him in a good way because in the beginning he faced some difficulties, especially that he didn’t have his family support. His difficulty in the beginning was to have enough clients, to face the competition and also to have a big site. But now he has good business and he is also working on a big site. Nabil always tries to honor his commitments towards his clients. His clients are his neighbors, friends and also acquaintances. He plans in the future to expand his business and also to have more clients.

loans.use: Nabil will use the loan to repay his debts.

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.en: Shuhratjon N. is 27 years old and is married with two children. For the past 2 years, Shuhratjon provides taxi service with his car. Shuhratjon always tries to provide high quality services at an attractive price for customers. He does his best to make the business stable and profitable as he is the main bread-winner for his family and his parents. He is ready to work from early morning until late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones. In order to repair his car, Shuhratjon is now requesting 2000 Somoni ($ 600 USD) for the term of 10 months . He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To make repairs to taxi

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 38-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ahmad works as a plumber. He installs lavatories and does maintenance. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to do some engine work on his car. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Thanks to one of his good friends, Ahamd has been working on a big project, where he knows the owner and they have a good reputation. He plans in the future to sell his old car and purchase a newer and bigger one.

loans.use: Ahmad needs the loan to do some engine work on his car.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 30-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mohamed has been selling vegetables and fruits for three years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the winter season like onions, potatoes, garlic and fruits. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on schedule.

In the beginning, Mohamed faced some difficulties like competition, but now he has very competitive prices with a good quality of food. The loan helped him develop his business. His future plan is to expand his shop where he will be selling all different kinds of fruits.

loans.use: Mohamed will use the loan to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase drugs to stock the pharmacy

loans.name: Wafaei

texts.en:
Wafaei is a 39-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Wafaei has been a taxi driver for seven years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to repay his debts. This is the first time that Wafaei has requested a loan.

In the beginning, Wafaei faced some difficulties like finding a good car with red plates and also to find customers. But now he knows when the right time is to find customers. He plans in the future to have another car and improve his income.

loans.use: Wafaei will use the loan to repay his debts

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Sofia L., from Surallah Cotabato city, is a 50-year-old mother of five children. After she got married in 1987, she decided to start her own store, operating out of the front of her house. She manages her business and caters to her customers who are her neighbors, friends, and relatives.

She is requesting her first loan to purchase additional grocery stock for her business like charcoal, rice, and chorizo. She would eventually like to have a bigger grocery store so she can accommodate more customers.Sofia believes that with her loan, she can increase her sales to better support the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: Purchase assorted groceries stocks

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en: Fidel C. is from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur in the Philippines. He is 26 years old, married, and has two children. He has spent many years plowing a small rice field that was given to him by his father-in-law. He works hard, together with his wife, in the field so that he can send his children to school. He also renders labor services in the neighboring fields so that he could earn extra income for his family. He says, "Life in the field is never easy. I plow using the traditional method all day not minding the heat of the sun because I have an ultimate goal for my kids and that is to give them a better future." He started farming four years ago and now he has acquired his own land and is requesting for a loan to purchase fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en: How sweet is success in the field! Precilla P., who is 64 years old, lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur, in the Philippines. She shared her happiness that her children were able to lead a better life because of rice farming, now that most of them have finished school and are married. “For 20 years I have been in rice farming, helping my husband do all the dirty work in the field, just to feed our 8 children,” she says. Because this is their only source of income, they exert every effort to make their rice-farming business sustainable. She owns a 1-hectare rice field and hires additional help during planting and harvesting. Their harvest has reached an average of 100 sacks during peak season, which is more than enough to sustain the family. Their main buyer is KC Marketing in Trento, Agusan Del Sur. In order to maintain this bountiful harvest and quality of produce, she is requesting for a loan to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Shavkat, amother of 5, is a native of Khujand, Tajikistan and has stayed in her native land. Six years ago she decided to begin a business raising livestock. She began with just one cow and now has many. Every morning, Shavkat awakes early so that her beloved cows may graze among the hills all day in hopes that they return happy and satisfied. Shavkat is motivated to continue in this arduous work and received help from her children and husband.

In order to succeed in her business, Shavkat and her family look to nourish the animals and keep them happy, in hopes of ultimately selling them at a just price. Shavkat and her family are able to sustain themselves and this fills her with great satisfaction. With the support of this loan, Shavkat, would now like to purchase more species of livestock to increase her clientele. With your support, Shavkat will be able to accomplish her business goals and eventually fund the education of all five of her children.

loans.use: Tp purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma P. is from from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur, in the Philippines. She is 54 years old and has been working in the field for 30 years. Her husband is also a farmer and they have 8 children who are currently in school. Most of their daily expenditures are taken from their rice farming business and that is why they spend their time taking good care of the field, in order to achieve a bountiful harvest, which means food for their table and for the whole family. She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and gasoline. She believes that these items will enhance the quality of her produce.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, and gasoline for the tractor.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice A. is a business woman in Accra. She trades in Dumas clothes, lace materials, and ladies shoes. She is 42 years old, married, and blessed with two kids who are currently in school. Beatrice is very supportive of her family through her trading business. Beatrice treks to the neighboring country to purchase her bulk supplies. She has been selling for the past seven years, but progress has been persistently slow due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her inventory and vitalize her business growth, ultimately allowing her to save more money so that she can provide her children with quality education. She belongs to the group called the Somuyie Trust Group. The group members provide assistance and support to one another to repay the loan. Her photograph was taken at a group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of Dumas clothes, lace materials, shoes to increase her inventory and sales.

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.en:
Orifjon R. is 41 years old and is married with 3 school aged children. For the past 7 years, Orifjon has provided taxi services with his car. The current business is the main source of income for his family. Orifjon works hard, rising early and going to bed late. Orifjon has no higher education but he dreams that all of his children are able to receive one. He is planning to send his daughter to the University next year.

Orifjon is planning to fix his car in order to provide a higher quality of service in the future.  He is requesting 4000 Somoni ($ 1200 USD) for the term of 12 months. With this loan, Orifjon is planning to purchase spare parts for his car. The well-being of this family is on your hands. Let’s get behind this dedicated father to make his dream come reality.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for the car.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca A. is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. To support her household, she has been operating a hair salon in her neighborhood for eight years. As the result of her good interpersonal skills and her innovative way of going about her duties, she has attracted many loyal customers to her shop. She notes that, if she is away, her customers find it difficult to adjust to her apprentice, whom she has trained. Rebecca wants the loan to purchase items like hair cream, combs, a hair dryer, and cosmetics so that she can increase her inventory and make a better income for the family’s needs. Rebecca is a member of the group called ‘Nnowm’ (Song). Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Her picture was taken after a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more additional hair cream, combs, hair dryer, and cosmetics to increase services.

loans.name: Worlanyo Kwadzo

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Worlanya Kwadzo est né le 20 septembre 1976 à Lomé, la capitale de Togo.  Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants.  Il a pour activité la vente des sachets en plastique dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Il a commencé ce commerce depuis 1990 et il a beaucoup d’expérience dans le domaine. 
Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter plusieurs types de sachets. Avec ce nouveau stock il pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Worlanya Kwadzo A. was born on 20 September 1976 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He is married and is the father of three (3) children. His primary business is the sale of re-usable plastic shopping bags in the Agoè district in northern Lomé. He started this business in 1990, and he has lots of experience in this field. This first loan he is asking for will allow him to buy several types of bags. With this new stock, he will be able to sell better and realize higher profits.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell multiple-use plastic shopping bags

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara is a 63-year-old woman who owns a grocery store. Her husband helps her with the business. Before acquiring the store, her business, for about twenty-six years, was to buy and sell products in various markets around the province. Her experience, industriousness and the support of her husband have helped their two sons to earn a college education. She wants to expand her grocery store. Both she and her husband want to save money so they can live comfortably, through their own effort, in the future.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Mery

texts.fr:
Née en 1965 à Blitta au centre du Togo, Madame T. Mery est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle exerce le commerce des pagnes dans son quartier, au nord de Lomé. Avec quatre ans d’expérience dans ce commerce, elle a déjà reçu un crédit au près de Kiva via WAGES et elle a bien remboursé.  
Elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour acheter 35 pièces de pagne afin de reconstituer son stock et de pouvoir bien vendre.
texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Blitta in central Togo, Mrs. Mery T. is married and has two (2) children. She runs a business selling pagne cloth (a brightly printed, highly valued type of West African cloth) in her district in northern Lomé. With four years of experience in this business, she has already received a loan from Kiva through WAGES, which she repaid without incident. She is asking for this second loan to buy 35 pieces of pagne cloth in order to reconstitute her stock and to continue selling well.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell pagne cloth

loans.name: Bodjonam

texts.fr:
Madame H. Bodjonam est née en 1976 à Kara, une ville située au nord de Togo. Elle est divorcée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Depuis 2005, elle exerce le commerce de céréales (haricot, maïs, etc.) au marché d’Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé.
Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle soutient ses enfants et paye les dépenses de la famille.
Actuellement son stock est épuisé et elle désire s’approvisionner. A cet effet elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 6 sacs de haricot et 10 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bodjonam H. was born in 1976 in Kara, a city in northern Togo. She is divorced and has two (2) children. Since 2005, she has run a business selling cereals (beans, maize, etc.) in the market at Agoè, a district in the north of Lomé. With the income from this business, she supports her children and meets the household expenses. Currently, her stock is depleted and she would like to re-supply herself. For this purpose, she is asking for this loan (her first) to buy 6 bags of beans and 10 bags of maize.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell cereals

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio is a member of the Florecer (“to bloom”) Village Bank.  He is 41 years old and married with six children. Eusebio sells natural remedies and medicinal herbs that he prepares at home.  He learned the trade by working for a natural remedy business in Lima, and he sells his wares on foot in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Eusebio also travels to different local villages to buy alpaca wool.  Eusebio needs a loan of 2800 soles to buy alpaca wool.  His dreams are to get ahead in life, to save enough to provide for himself in old age, and to own a home to rent out. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Eusebio es socio del Banco Comunal Florecer. 
Eusebio es casado, tiene 41 años y 6 hijos, Eusebio vende remedios naturales, hierbas medicinales, que prepara el mismo en su casa, actividad que aprendió cuando trabajaba en una empresa de medicamentos naturales en la ciudad de Lima, sus ventas los realiza de manera ambulatoria en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Eusebio viaja a distintos pueblos de la zona en donde compra fibra de alpaca. 
Eusebio necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fibra de alpaca. 
Los sueños de Eusebio son salir adelante, tener suficientes ahorros para su vejez y una casa para alquilar.

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool from local villages

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en:
Calixta is a member of the Florecer (“to bloom”) Village Bank.  Calixta is 48 years old and is widowed with two children. She sells fruit outside the bus terminal on Cuzco Street, where buses leave for the southern parts of the region of Ayacucho. She works every day, and her children often help out. Calixta also sells Omnilife products.  Calixta needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy different fruits.  Her dreams are to build a second floor onto her home and for her children to graduate from college with professional degrees.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Calixta es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Calixta es viuda, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Calixta vende frutas en el terminal terrestre de la av. Cuzco, donde es el paradero de salida y llegada de los buses que viajan a la zona sur del departamento, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Calixta vende productos Omnilife.
Calixta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de diferentes frutas.
Los sueños de Calixta son construir el segundo piso de su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To buy different fruits

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 55 años, es casado, tiene tres hijos  mayores de edad. Se desempeña como agricultor, siembra naranjas en sus  hectáreas de terrenos  que posee desde hace 30 años. Siendo así, la agricultura una de sus pasiones, la  cosecha y selección  de las frutas es lo que más le gusta realizar, debido que puede saborear  el fruto de su trabajo, además las naranjas son frutas que en los mercados son muy solicitados, y  gracias a los comerciantes pueden  trasladarlos  hasta los diferentes mercados. Pero lo difícil de esta actividad es sembrar y cuidar sus plantas de naranjas, sobre todo cuidarlas de los insectos que perjudican sus  cultivos. Este es su cuarto préstamo, hasta hoy no ha tenido problemas en los días de pago. Alejandro adquirirá insecticidas y trampas para insectos, con las cuales podrá hacer frente a sus problemas con los insectos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 55, is married, and has 3 adult children. He works as a farmer. He grows oranges in the land that he has owned for 30 years. Agriculture is one of his passions. Harvesting and selecting his fruit is what he likes to do most, since he can savor the fruit of his labor. Oranges also have a lot of demand in the markets, thanks to the merchants that transport them to the different markets. The difficult part of his work is planting and caring for his orange trees, and above all protecting them from insects that damage his crop. This is his fourth loan. He has not had problems with his repayments. Alejandro will acquire insecticides and insect traps, which will help him confront his problem with insects.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of insecticide and insect traps

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 49 años, es soltera y tiene 5 hijos. Se dedica a la producción de cítricos desde hace 20 años, actividad que le agrada realizar, debido a que sus padres también fueron agricultores, se siente identificada con esta actividad y lo que más le  gusta es cosechar sus frutas en sus respectivas temporadas. De la misma manera, el poder vender  cítricos es rentable, si se sabe aprovechar las temporadas en que la demanda es alta, lo difícil es lidiar con el clima y con los insectos que amenazas sus cultivos. Carmen esta en su cuarto préstamo con MFP, hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas de mora en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de abonos e insecticidas para sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 49, is a single mother of 5 children. She has been growing citrus fruits for 20 years. She has enjoyed this activity since she was a child, as her parents were also farmers. Her favorite part is picking the fruits during their respective harvesting season. Selling the crops is profitable when she can take advantage of the high demand season. The hard part of growing citrus fruit is to battle with the weather and with the insects that threaten her crops. Carmen has obtained four loans through MFP. To this date, she has had no problem keeping up with the payments. The loan that Carmen is requesting this time will be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers and pesticides for citrus fruit crops

loans.name: Yovana

texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the Florecer (“to bloom”) Village Bank. Yovana is 30 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their daughter. Yovana has a store in her parents’ house where she and her husband sell dry goods, ice cream, and phone cards. Yovana needs a loan of 600 soles to buy fruitcake (for Christmas) and rice. Yovana dreams of having her own home, and that her daughter will go to school and graduate with a professional degree.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer. Yovana es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hija, Yovana tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres, en donde vende abarrotes, helados, tarjetas telefónicas, tarjetas telefónicas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo. Yovana necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panetones, arroz. Yovana sueña con tener su casa propia, que su hija estudie y sea profesional.

loans.use: Buy fruitcake (for Christmas) and rice

loans.name: Zamu Namiiro’S Group

texts.en:
Zamu is a leader of a 5-member group.  She is a 36-year-old married mother of five children between 7 and 13 years old. All her children go to school.  Zamu takes care of her elderly parents. She resides in and owns a two-room house where she lives with six people.  They have electricity, but no piped water at home The family gets three meals a day.

Zamu works in a semi urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala, selling charcoal. She doesn’t incur any extra transport costs.  Zamu buys charcoal from delivery vans. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and works seven days a week.  

Zamu has been in this business for more than 10 years, working seven days a week. Besides this business of charcoal selling, she owns a motorcycle which is used in a transportation business.  She is faced with a challenge of trusting the driver of the motorcycle and its security. 

She has been with MCDT for eight years working all this time with the same group members. For her 18th loan, Zamu wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land and own four motorcycles.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel es soltero, vive con sus padres. Se dedica a la agricultura, en especial al cultivo de café actividad que viene realizando por 3 años, tiempo en el que decidió independizarse económicamente de sus padres y sobre todo, poder ayudarlos. Dentro de su trabajo como agricultor  le agrada  realizar las cosechas, porque es hermoso ver maduros los cafés y listos para su debido procesamiento y venta, siendo lo más difícil para un agricultor el sembrar las plantas, lidiar con el clima y con el sol de medio día. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Daniel invertirá este dinero en la compra de  plantas de café, las cuales  son muy costosas, pero productivas.
texts.en:
Daniel is single and lives with his parents. He has dedicated himself to coffee farming for 3 years now so that he could become financially independent and could actively contribute to the household income. As a farmer, Daniel loves the harvest most of all. It is is beautiful to watch his plants mature and become ready for processing. On the other hand, the most difficult part of the cultivation process is sowing the seeds, and having to contend with the climate and the midday sun. This is his first loan from MFP. Daniel will use the money to buy coffee plants, which are very expensive at the outset but very productive over time.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of coffee plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Darwin

texts.es: Darwin es un joven de 20 años, el cual vive con su pareja, quien se encuentra embarazada. A iniciado su trabajo de agricultor  desde hace un par de años, siendo dentro de la agricultura, la cosecha, lo que más le agrada, debido a que ve más cercano el día en que podrá ver el fruto de su trabajo. Dentro de  los productos que le  gusta  cultivar se encuentra el café y el arroz, son productos que tiene mayor valor de venta dentro de su comunidad, la cual visitan los comerciantes cada temporada, además que se invierte mucho, pero se puede ganar mucho más, siendo sin embargo lo más difícil el sembrar y preparar las tierras para  la producción. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Darwin requiere  instrumentos necesarios  para limpiar sus terrenos para lo cual  necesita un monto de 500 soles, entre otros gastos de sembrío que  requiere.
texts.en:
Darwin is 20 years old and lives with his partner, who is expecting a child. He has been a farmer for a couple years now and the part of his job he likes the most is the harvest, when the fruit of his labours begins to materialize. He prefers to grow coffee and rice, as these are quite valuable commodities in his community and sought after by traders, yet they are difficult crops to sow and cultivate. One must invest heavily at the beginning of the planting season but one can eventually turn an excellent profit from this initial investment. This is his first loan from MFP. Darwin will use the money, 500 soles, to buy the machines necessary to prepare his land for planting and to cover the other costs involved in sowing his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of farming equipment

loans.name: Ever

texts.es: Ever  es un joven de 22 años, vive con su joven pareja y su  pequeño hijo. Se dedica a cultivar  cítricos, dentro de ellos lo que más cultiva es naranja, actividad que viene desarrollando desde hace 5 años.  Ser agricultor  es lo que más le agrada, sobre todo la cosecha, ya que  es lo más gratificante de todo el trabajo que realiza, además las naranjas son las frutas más demandas en la zona, debido a su  reconocido valor de venta que tienen. Sin embargo, lo que es más tedioso dentro de esta actividad es poder  limpiar los terrenos y cuidarlos de los insectos  que malogran los frutos. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de insecticidas y abonos para sus hectáreas de  cultivo de cítricos.
texts.en:
Ever is 22 years old and lives with his partner and their little boy. He has dedicated himself to farming citrus, mostly oranges, for 5 years now. He enjoys being a farmer and finds harvesting his crops especially gratifying. On the other hand, the most tedious part of farming is the preparation of plots for planting and protecting the oranges from insects that spoil the fruit. Fortunately for Ever, oranges are in high demand in his area and fetch high prices at the market. This is his first loan from MFP. He will use the money to buy insecticide and fertilizer for his plots.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of insecticide and fertilizer

loans.name: Aida Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora de nombre Aída Del Rosario Pérez R. tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Aída tiene 2 hijos un varón de la edad de 29 años que tiene su profesión como abogado y su hija mujer que tiene la edad de 27 años la profesión de esta joven es farmacéutica, su compañero de vida labora como abogad, en sus esta  el propósitos  mantener activo su negocio para así brindarle ayuda a su mama y a su hija que todavía depende de ella.



La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta en general como: ropa, calzados, cosmeticos, bolsos y otros, la ubicación de su negocio es de Asilo de anciano ½ c al norte en león, el tiempo que lleva en este negocio es de 18 años, esta señora además de es contadora por lo que de este modo conseguido administrar  bien   sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo y poder darle a sus hijos lo que ellos necesitaban y empezó a luchar por ellos, inicia con la venta de comida, ropa y caramelos y es así como va incrementando su negocio por lo que es necesario el financiamiento para el capital de trabajo ya que ella viaja  a Panamá para traer productos extranjeros y de calidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aída Del Rosario Pérez R. is 53 years and married. She has two children. Her son is 29 years old and works as a lawyer and her daughter is 27 years and works as a pharmacist. Aída's husband and lifelong companion also works as a lawyer and she works too, because she wants to stay active and also, to help support her mother and daughter, who are dependent on her. She has dedicated herself to retailing for 18 years and sells clothing, footwear, cosmetics, bags etc. She began this work because at the time, the family needed extra income and she wanted to give her children everything they needed. At first, she started by selling meals, clothes and sweets but slowly her business has grown over the years and now she travels to seek out the best quality merchandise. She will use this loan to import some products from Panama. Aída also does all the accounting for her business herself, believing that this is the best way to continue succeeding.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Vicky Kombe’S Group

texts.en:
Vicky is a leader of a 4-member group.  She is a 40-year-old single mother of six children between 12 and 22 years old. All of her children go to school. Vicky takes care of two additional family members. She resides in and rents a two -room house where she lives with nine people.  They have electricity, but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. 

Vicky works in a semiurban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transport.  She sells Bitenge (African wear) from DR Congo and at times brings jewelry.   Vicky sells to an average of 20 customers a day and works seven days a week. 

Vicky sells on retail and wholesale. Vicky has been in this business for more than 10 years, working seven days a week.  She has been with MCDT for eight years working all this time with the same group members. For her 20th loan,  Vicky wants to use this loan to buy more bitenge and necklaces. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land .

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and additional fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cookies, gum and candy

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe tiene 55 años, es casado, tiene tres hijos, pero vive con su esposa y el último de sus hijos. El se dedica a su pequeña tienda, que con tanto esfuerzo logró adquirir hace 4 años, gracias al esfuerzo que puso en su actividad como agricultor. A Felipe  le agrada atender a las personas  y tener  un trabajo que no te demande demasiado  esfuerzo, sino que solo demanda tiempo, ya que dedica tiempo a su negocio le resulta  rentable, además  siendo  una de las pocas tiendas que  hay en la comunidad es mucho más  fácil obtener clientes  fieles. Aunque lo difícil es  tener que realizar las compras de los productos en la ciudad y  traerlas a su comunidad. Es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, nunca tuvo problemas en sus pagos respectivos. Felipe  invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de mercadería  para surtir su  tiendita que día a día va creciendo.
texts.en:
Felipe is 55 years old and married. He has three children, but only the youngest still lives at home. Felipe dedicates himself to the small store that he has, with substantial effort, built up over the last four years. Felipe enjoys attending to people and likes that while the store takes up a lot of his time the work itself is not physically demanding. With his dedication, Felipe's business has become profitable and because it is one of the few stores in the community, it has been relatively easy to build up a faithful client base. On the other hand, the most difficult aspect of his business is that he has to buy his supplies from the nearest city and transport them back to his community. This is his fourth loan from MFP and he has never had problems in making repayments on his earlier loans. Felipe will use the money to purchase merchandise to stock his little store that, day by day, continues growing.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos con quienes vive.
