Esta mujer trabajadora, está dedicada a la agricultura, sobre todo al cultivo de  cítricos y mangos, a lo cual se dedica hace  30 años, siendo la cosecha lo que más le agrada realizar, debido a que todos los miembros de la familia  interactúan  con un solo fin. Además esta actividad es rentable, porque su comunidad es muy frecuentada por los comerciantes, los cuales demandan sus productos a buenos precios, lo que facilita su trabajo de venta, aunque lo difícil es cuidar sus  terrenos de plagas a lo largo de  su producción. Se encuentra en su cuarto  préstamo con MFP, hasta  la fecha nunca dejó, de ser puntual en sus  pagos, siendo ella, la cabeza de su banco comunal, siempre da el ejemplo. Hermelinda  invertirá el dinero en la compra de abonos para sus terrenos, lo cual es muy importante para sacar productos de calidad.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, 45, is married and has 5 children, all of whom still live at home. This hard-working woman has been growing citrus fruit and mangos for 30 years. Her favorite part is harvesting, because the whole family works together toward a single goal. Her crops are very profitable and easy for her to sell, because the community where she lives is often visited by wholesale buyers who give her a good price for her products. For Hermelinda, the hard part of farming is to keep the crops free from pest infestations until harvest time. Hermelinda has requested four loans through Kiva partner MFP. To this date, she has always made payments on time. As the head of her communal bank, Hermelinda is an excellent example to her fellow members. The loan that Hermelinda is requesting this time will be used to purchase fertilizers, which are very important to produce quality crops.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers for crops

loans.name: Mirenda Akoko

texts.fr:
Madame A. Akoko Mirenda est née le 8 juillet en 1981 à Lomé, la capitale de Togo. Elle est célibataire et mère d’un (1) enfant.  Elle a pour activité, la vente de jus de fruit dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de la ville de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2003.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de d’acheter un congélateur pour que ses produits soient fraiches afin de mieux servir les clients.
texts.en:
Mirenda Akoko A. was born on July 8, 1981 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is a single mother of one child. Mirenda Akoko sells fruit juice in the Agoè quarter to the north of Lomé, and has been in this business since 2003. The loan she is requesting, her first, would allow her to purchase a freezer to keep her products fresh and better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 48 años, es casada, vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos jóvenes. Se dedica a administrar sus carros, que con mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir  hace  4 años, con los cuales su esposo y sus hijos trabajan en transporte de pasajeros. Esta actividad es una de  las que más le agrada realizar,  ya que aprende acerca del manejo de los ingresos y egresos que  tiene en su hogar, así puede prever para el mantenimiento de  sus  carros y sobre todo en la  distribución  de  las ganancias. Le es rentable porque en su comunidad los carros son pocos y la concurrencia de personas es abundante. Lo difícil de ello, es poder lidiar con algunas situaciones  graves, como reparar el carro cuando sufre de  algunos choques o accidentes. Se encuentra en su cuarto préstamo con MFP, desde entonces  a  trabajado en el banco comunal con mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos. Hermelinda comprará repuestos para sus carros y los llevara a la mecánica  para su debido mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, 48, is married and has three children. With hard work she bought several cars four years ago. Now her husband and children work transporting passengers and she manages the business. She enjoys this activity because she learns about balancing expenses and income, setting aside funds for car maintenance, and distributing the profits fairly. This business is profitable because in the community where Hermelinda lives few people own cars, and the need for transportation is great. The hard part of the business is to face difficult situations like major repairs or accidents. Hermelinda has requested four loans through Kiva partner MFP. She has been very responsible with her payments to the communal bank. With the loan she is requesting now, Hermelinda will purchase parts needed for her cars, and will take them to the mechanic for maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for auto parts and maintenance

loans.name: Allen Wanyana’S Group

texts.en:
Allen is a leader of a 5-member group.  She is a 45-year-old married mother of four children aged between 18 and 26 years. One child goes to school. Allen takes care of her elderly parents She resides in and owns a four-room house where she lives with five people.  They have electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day, 

Allen works in a semiurban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala, operating a retail shop.  She uses public transport to and from work.  Allen buys her products from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city.  She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and works seven days a week.  

Allen has been in this business for five years, working six days a week. She is faced with a challenge of competition and transportation. She has been with MCDT for five years working all this time with the same group members and wants to use this loan to have permanent place for her business. She aspires to build a bigger shop and sell wholesale.

loans.use: To have a permanent place of work

loans.name: Huilwer

texts.es: Huilwer tiene 24 años, vive con su esposa y sus  dos hijos. Este joven está dedicado a la agricultura por más de 5 años, ahora está sembrando diversos productos como palta, papaya, café, plátanos y variedad de  frutas que  podrán ayudarle a mantener a su joven familia. Lo que le agrada realizar  es  la siembre de las plantas de los diversos productos, ya que es más rentable invertir en variedades de frutas y vender mensualmente sus cosechas, ya que el mercado es exigente. Pero lo más tedioso es  tener que  limpiar sus  terrenos de cultivos y cuidarlos día a día. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Huilwer invertirá la cantidad que solicita en la compra de abono para su terreno.
texts.en:
Huilwer is 24 years old and lives with his wife and two children. This young man has been a farmer for more than 5 years. Now he is growing diverse products such as avocado, papaya, coffee, bananas, and a variety of fruits than he can help support his young family. What pleases him is sewing his diverse crops as it is profitable to invest in a variety of fruits and sell his harvest monthly, as the market is demanding. But the most tedious is having to clear his land and take care of his crops day after day. This is his first loan with MFP. Huilwer will invest the money in purchasing fertilizer for his land.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 34 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive. El es agricultor, actividad que lo acompaña por 25 años. Para Juan esto solo es el comienzo de una vida próspera  como agricultor, ya que con el tiempo pretende  comercializar sus productos en  las ciudades cercanas, que es lo que más le agrada, vender los productos que produce a los  grandes mercados de las ciudades, ya que en las ciudades de la sierra del Perú las frutas tiene gran demanda y su producción es mensual, lo que ayuda en su economía, aunque lo difícil para él, es la cosecha. Se encuentra en su cuarto préstamo con MFP, no tuvo observaciones en sus pagos. Juan invertirá 1000 soles en nuevas plantas de plátanos y cítricos para sus hectáreas de terreno.
texts.en:
Juan is 34 years old, married and has two children. He is a farmer, an activity he has done for 25 years. For Juan this is only the beginning of a prosperous life as a farmer, as with time he intends to sell his products in the nearby cities, which is what he enjoys the most, selling the products that he products in the large city markets. In the mountain cities of Peru fruit is in high demand and his fruits ripen monthly, so what helps him the most, although it is hard work, is his harvest. This is his fourth loan with MFP, he hasn’t had any problems with his payments. Juan will invest 1000 soles in new banana and citrus plans on his hectares of land.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new banana and citrus fruit plants

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: Leoncio tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y vive con sus cuatro hijos. Se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace 30 años, actividad  que  le agrada realizar, sobre todo durante la siembra de sus plantas, porque es el inicio prometedor de lo que  vendrá. Dedicarse al café es rentable  para  Leoncio porque  los grandes productores se encuentran  en la selva central y por ello es bastante concurrido por grandes comerciantes que tiene depósitos de café, sin embargo, lo difícil es poder plantar las plantas de café en los terrenos, ya que estos tiene que estar debidamente abonados. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Leoncio comprará abono necesario para sus terrenos, cada  bolsa de abono tiene un costo de 250 soles, él requiere de cuatro a  bolsas.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 47 years old, married and lives with his four children. He has grown coffee for 30 years, an activity he enjoys doing, above all during the planting of his plants because this is the promising beginning of what will come. Growing coffee is profitable for Leoncio because the big growers are in the central jungle and it is rather common for the large growers to have coffee plantations, nevertheless, it is difficult to be able to plant coffee plants on this land as they need quite a bit of fertilizer. This is his first loan with MFP. Leoncio will buy the necessary fertilizer for his land, each bag of fertilizer costs 250 soles, and he needs four bags.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for his coffee plants

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La Sr. Dominga de 52 años de edad, habitante del memorial Sandino de la capital de Managua. Madre soltera tiene cuatros lindos hijos de 9, 11, 14 y 17 años todos  estudiando en un colegio de la capital. Trabaja en su negocio de venta de mariscos desde hace 20 años en un de los mercados de la cuidad. Como  planes tiene vender variados productos como: frutas, carne, pescado. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic lograra cumplir con sus planes  de crecer como pequeño negocio y generar mayores ventas con sus nuevos productos. También aumentaría sus ingresos y cumplirá con la remodelación de su casa para brindarles un mejor nivel de vida y seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dominga is 52 years old and lives in the neighbourhood Memorial Sandino in the capital city of Managua. A single mother, she has four beautiful children aged 9, 11, 14, and 17 years, all of whom attend a school in the capital. She has worked selling seafood in one of the city markets for the past 20 years. She has plans to sell a variety of products such as fruit, meat, and fish. Thanks to the loans from Kiva partner Afodenic she will be able to accomplish her plans to expand her small business and earn more money from her new products. She will also increase her revenue and finish renovating her home to make it safer and give her children a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seafood, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy replacement car parts

loans.name: Maoul Koffi

texts.fr: Né le 26 mai 1976, monsieur D. Maoul Koffi est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Depuis 2005, il a vendu par livraison des cartes de recharge dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des cartes de recharge de toutes les compagnies de téléphonies au Togo (Togo cellulaire, Moov et Illico).
texts.en:
Born on May 26, 1976, Mr. Maoul Koffi D. is a married father of two children. Since 2005 he has been selling and delivering rechargeable phone cards in the region of Agoè in the north of Lomé. This first loan that he is requesting will allow him to purchase rechargeable phone cards for all of the telephone companies in Togo (Togo cellulaire, Moov and Illico).

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of rechargeable telephone cards

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina, a member of the Torcaza (“Wood Pigeon”) Village Bank, is 55 years old and married with five children. Paulina grows grains and potatoes on her land in the Chiara District of central Peru, which she travels to from Ayacucho on a weekly basis. She also has a small hostel on Bolognesi Avenue. Paulina is now requesting a loan to pay her farm workers. Her dreams are to expand her hostel and to finish building her house in Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To pay farm workers.

loans.name: Francisco Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco tiene 46 años de edad habitante de loma memorial Sandino, de la ciudad de Managua, es casado y concibió dos adorados hijas de 3 y 16 años de edad, las dos están estudiando en una escuela del barrio. Trabaja de sol a sol con su esposa en la venta de frutas y verduras en la camioneta ambulantemente por la calle de Managua desde hace 15 años. Sus planes son tener un negocio grande y fuerte en la venta de productos frescos de buena calidad. Por medio de los préstamos de Afodenic lograra aumentar sus ventas y a la vez sus ingresos y nivel de vida. Así también terminara la constricción de su casa.
texts.en:
Francisco is 46 years old and lives in the Loma Memorial Sandino district of Managua. He is married and has two beloved daughters of 3 and 16 years, both of whom attend a school in the neighbourhood. He works from dawn to dusk with his wife selling fruits and vegetables from their van on the streets of Managua, as he has done since he was 15 years old. He plans to have a strong business selling fresh, high-quality products. Through his loans from Kiva partner Afodeniche will be able to increase his sales as well as his income and his quality of life. This will also allow him to finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruit and vegetables to increase sales

loans.name: Viviane

texts.fr:
Madame S. Viviane est née en 1970 à Lomé, la capitale de Togo. Elle est célibataire et mère de deux (2) enfants.  Elle a pour activité la coiffure et la vente des sacs de sortie dans le quartier d’Agoè. 
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit au près de WAGES et a bien remboursé.
Ce deuxième crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 20 sacs de sortie et 50 pièces de mèches.  Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mrs. Viviane S. was born in 1970 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is single and the mother of two children. Her business is hairdressing and the sale of handbags in the area of Agoè. She has previously benefited from a WAGES loan and repaid it in full. This second loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 20 handbags and 50 hair extension pieces. With this new stock her sales will increase and she will earn a good profit.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of handbags and hair extension pieces

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana, a member of the Torcaza (“Wood Pigeon”) Village Bank, is 28 years old and separated with one son. Travelling two or three times per week to different regional fairs, she buys grains, cheese and mutton to resell in various markets in Ayacucho.  She is now requesting a loan to buy cheese and grains.  Her dreams are to build her own house, educate her son, and open a store in her house.  
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy grains and cheese.

loans.name: Havessi

texts.fr:
Née le 11 juin 1959 à Agoè, madame A. Havessi est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle fait la restauration dans son quartier natal. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis l’année 2000 et accueille beaucoup de clients car elle est située au près d’un marché. Elle achète du maïs, de l’igname dans le marché et procède à la transformation pour servir les revendeurs.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 12 sacs de maïs et 200 tubercules d’ignames afin de pouvoir bien vendre et dégager un bon revenu.
texts.en:
Born on June 11, 1959 in Agoè, Ms. Havessi A. is married and the mother of two. She is a caterer in the district of her birth. It is a business she started in 2000 that accommodates many customers because she is located near a marketplace. She buys corn and yams there , proceeds to prepare them, and then serves them to retail sellers. She is requesting this initial loan to buy 12 sacks of corn and 200 yam tuber, so that she can do well in her sales and earn a good income. .

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is is a member of the Torcaza (“Wood Pigeon”) Village Bank. Gladys is 23 years old and single. She is currently studying to be a high school teacher. Gladys and her fiancé have a small stand on a very busy street in Ayacucho where they sell cell phones, prepaid phone cards, and accessories, and offer technical assistance.  Gladys needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy cell phones. Her dreams are to finish college, to be a good teacher, and to help her family. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow 
 
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Torcaza.
Gladys es soltera, tiene 23 años y estudia educación secundaria en la universidad, Gladys junto a su novio tiene un pequeño puesto en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende celulares, recargas, accesorios y también servicio técnico.
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de celulares.
Los sueños de Gladys son culminar sus estudios, ser una buena profesional y ayudar a su familia.

loans.use: Buy cell phones

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es: La Sr. Mariana tiene 51 años de edad, vive  en un barrio de la ciudad de Managua llamado memorial Sandino, casada, es docente de la secundaria , tiene dos preciosos hijos, los cuales ya no viven con ella. Los planes de doña Mariana es tener mejor estabilidad económica y social. Además de ser profesora en el ramo de la nutrición por medio tiempo también vende cosméticos a las diferentes personas. Inició su negocio de cosmético hace seis años vendiéndolos en su casa utilizando capital propio con la intención de obtener mayor ingresos. También tiene como planes incrementar sus ventas con nuevos productos como: ropa, zapatos y otros productos. Sus planes serán realizado gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic, los cuales con ellos lograra compra de nuevos productos variados, que a su vez aumentara sus ingresos y así mejorando su futuro.
texts.en:
Mariana is 51 years old and lives in a neighbourhood of Managua called Memorial Sandino. She is married, a secondary school teacher, and has two beautiful children who no longer live at home. Mariana wants to have better economic and social stability. Besides being a nutrition teacher she also sells cosmetics part-time. She began selling cosmetics from her home six years ago, using her own money for startup, with the intention of earning a higher income. She also wants to increase her sales by providing new products such as clothing, shoes, and other goods. Her plans will be realized thanks to her loans from Afodenic, with which she will be able to buy various new products, at the same time increasing her income and improving her future.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing and shoes

loans.name: Abla Philomene

texts.fr:
Madame A. Abla Philomène est née le 31 décembre 1952. Elle est mariée et mère d’un (1) enfant.  Elle a pour activité la vente du charbon de bois et des céréales dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. 
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit au près de WAGES et a bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 12 sacs de charbon de bois, 10 sacs de mais, et 3 sacs de haricot. Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Ms. Abla Philomène A. was born on December 31, 1952. She is married and a mother with a child. Her work involves selling charcoal and grains in the Agoè district of Lomé. Once, she was the recipient of a loan from WAGES and repaid it. This second loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 12 sacks of charcoal, 10 sacks of corn, and 3 sacks of beans. With this new stock, she will be able to do well in her sales and to realize a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and grain

loans.name: Salomón

texts.es: El Sr. Salomón tiene 49 años de edad, habitante Hialeah, de estado civil soltero con un hijo de 15 años de edad, actualmente estudia y le ayuda a su padre en sus tiempos libres. Don Salomón tiene su negocio de abarrotes desde  hace 10 años, iniciando con sus ahorros propios. Ofertando granos básicos, frutas, verduras y productos higiénicos en su casa. Dentro de sus planes son: asegurarle un buen patrimonio a su hijo, incrementar el volumen de venta mediante nuevos y variados productos que a la vez sastifacer las necesidades de los clientes y aumentara sus ingresos económicos. Todos estos planes se podrán realizar gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic. Los cuales brindaran para el desarrollo del micro negocio.
texts.en:
Salomon is 49 years old, and lives in Hialeah. He is single and has a 15 year old son who is a student and helps his father in his free time. Salomon started his grocery business 10 years ago with his own savings. He sells staple grains and pulses, fruits, vegetables, and hygiene products from his house. His plans include: insuring a good inheritance for his son, increasing his sales by providing new and varied products to satisfy the needs of his customers, and increasing his economic income. All these plans can be realized thanks to loans from Kiva partner Afodenic, which will allow for the development of this microbusiness.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruits, vegetables, and staple grains

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Qory Qaytu (“Thread of Gold” in Quechua) Village Bank.  Elizabeth is 28 years old and is married with two children. Elizabeth runs a store from her home in the Conchopata neighborhood, where she sells dry goods, vegetables, meat, drinks and ice cream. She works every day.  

Elizabeth needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy rice and sugar. Elizabeth dreams of having a larger business, of offering a wider variety of merchandise, and of saving enough for her children to overcome the obstacles in their lives. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow 
 
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu que significa Hilo de Oro en quechua.
Elizabeth es casada, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Elizabeth tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el barrio de Conchopata, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, bebidas, helados, actividad que realiza todos los días.  
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.  
Elizabeth sueña con tener un negocio mas grande, surtido, ahorrar lo suficiente para que sus hijos se superen.

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Kemelio E. Adzo

texts.fr:
Née le 31 décembre 1975 à Kpele Agave, une ville située 145 km au nord de Lomé, Madame A. Kemelio E. Adzo est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente de charbon de bois dans le marché d’Agoè. Elle a commencée cette activité depuis l’année 1998 et elle maitrise bien ce commerce.  
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 70 sacs de charbon de bois afin de pouvoir mieux servir ses clients et tirer un revenu.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1975 in Kpele Agave, a city located 145 km north of Lomé, Ms. Kemelio E. Adzo A. is married and the mother of three. Her work involves selling charcoal at the Agoè marketplace. She started this business in 1998 and has a good command of it. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 70 sacks of charcoal to be able to do better serving her customers and to derive an income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac A. is married and has five dependents. He has received schooling through junior high. Isaac sells used clothing at the new market in Elmina market, which he has done since 2005.

Isaac uses his income to pay for his children's school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Isaac will use the loan as additional capital to buy more used clothing and fabric for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Isaac plans to reinvest back into his business to increase his income to enable him to give a quality education to his children.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more used clothing and fabric for resale.

loans.name: Esso-Elonoyou

texts.fr:
Madame SALLE Esso-Elonyou est née le 31 aout 1972 à Kaza-Boua, une ville située au nord du Togo.  Elle est célibataire et mère de deux (2) enfants.  Elle a pour activité la vente des céréales dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2000, donc elle a huit ans d’expérience et elle connait bien ce commerce. 
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 3 sacs de mais, 7 sacs de haricot, et 2 sacs de sorgho. Avec ce nouveau stock elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Ms. Esso-Elonyou SALLE was born on August 31, 1972 in Kaza-Boua, a city located in the north of Togo. She is unmarried and the mother of two children. Her work involves selling grains in the Agoè district on the north side of Lomé. She started this commerce in 2000, so she has eight years of experience. She knows this business well. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 3 sacks of corn, 7 sacks of beans, and 2 sacks of sorghum. With this new stock, she'll be able to do well in her sales and to realize a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell grain

loans.name: Papa

texts.en:
Papa G. sells clothing and fabrics. Papa attended school through junior high. He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader.

Papa has been selling clothing and fabrics since 2005. He is responsible for paying his children’s school fees, utility bills and other family expenses.

He is requesting a loan so he can buy more clothing and fabric to sell. He hopes to use the new profits he generates to reinvest in his business. This will allow him to increase his income and enable him to give quality education to his children.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and fabric to sell

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La Sra. Josefa habita en un barrio de Managua que se llama Anexo Villa Libertad en la capital de Managua, tiene 48 años de edad, con dos hijos menores de edad, su esposo se desempeña como maestro de obra, trabaja ambulante y otras veces por contrato, doña Josefa vende tortillas, frijoles cosidos, cuajada, desde hace un años, anteriormente vendía comida con dinero que su esposo ledio para iniciar el negocio, las venta de tortilla comenzó con prestamos que Afodenic brindo, pues ha sido de gran logro para su familia ya que ahora ha crecido en la variedad de sus ventas, y hizo un bajarete para sus venta de tortillas,  espera lograr mas beneficios. Con la solicitud de préstamos es para compra una cocina de leña que se llama escofan para mejorar el servicio, a si como materia prima para la elaboración de tortillas. A largo plazo es cerrar la infraestructura de su negocio, dar estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Josefa lives in a neighbourhood of Managua called Anexo Villa Libertad. She is 48 years old and has two children under 18. Her husband excels in his work as a foreman, sometimes traveling and sometimes on contract. Josefa has sold tortillas, cooked beans, and curds for the past few years. She started her business with money her husband gave her, and her sales have increased with the loans she received from Kiva partner Afodenic. Diversifying her sales has been a great success for her family, and has created a basis for her tortilla sales, so she hopes to earn higher profits. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a wood-burning stove called an escofan as well as ingredients to make tortillas in order to improve her service. In the long term she would like to solidify the infrastructure of her business and provide her children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a stove to make tortillas

loans.name: Assoupi

texts.fr:
Née en 1953 à Tabligbo, une ville située au nord-est du Togo, Madame S. Assoupi est veuve et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle exerce le commerce des céréales et des poissons fumés dans son quartier, au nord de Lomé. Avec trois ans d’expérience dans ce commerce, elle a déjà reçu un crédit au près de WAGES et elle a bien remboursé.  
Elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour acheter 6 sacs de mais et 2 paniers de poissons fumés afin de reconstituer son stock et de pouvoir bien vendre.
texts.en:
Born in 1953 in Tabligbo, a city located in the northeast of Togo, Ms. Assoupi S. is a widow and the mother of two children. She does commerce in grain and smoked fish in her district north of Lomé. With three years of experience in this business, she has already received a loan from WAGES, and she repaid it. She is requesting this second loan to buy 6 sacks of corn and two baskets of smoked fish to replenish her stock and to be able to do well in her sales.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains and smoked fish

loans.name: Ladondou Toure

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Ladondou Toure’ est né le 27 juillet 1975 à Sotouboua, une ville située au centre du Togo. Il est célibataire et il n’a pas d’enfants. Depuis 2005, il exerce le commerce de volailles et de moutons au marché d’Agoè.
Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 70 pintades, 35 poules et 10 moutons. Avec ce nouveau stock il pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Ladondou Toure’ A. was born on July 27, 1975 in Sotouboua, a town located in the center of Togo. He is single and has no children. Since 2005 he has been selling poultry and sheep in the market of Agoè.

He is requesting this initial loan to buy 70 guinea fowl, 35 hens, and 10 sheep. With this new stock, he will be able to make more sales and bring in a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of poultry and sheep for re-sale

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: La Sr. Gloria de 44 años de edad, madre soltera con dos  hijos de 8 y 14 años de edad los tiene estudiando en un colegio de la capital, habita en Reparto Shick de la cuidad de Managua. Trabajo en el aria de limpieza en un colegio por el día y por las noches vende fritanga para obtener otros pequeño ingreso ya que todo esta caro y tiene que sacar adelante a sus hijos, inicio la venta de fritanga con sus propios fondos. Sus planes son  construir su vivienda, comprando piedras, cementos, hierros, bloques. Para poder brindarle seguridad y protección a su familia. Gracias al préstamo de Afodenic lograra  asegurarles un buen patrimonio a  los hijos y futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 44-year-old single mother of two children aged 8 and 14. They live in the Reparto Shick district of Managua where both children attend school. Gloria is a school janitor by day and sells fried food by night in order to earn a little more money to give her children a good start. She began her fried food business with her own money. She plans to build her home, so she must buy stones, cement, iron and blocks. She wants to be able to provide security and protection to her family. Thanks to a loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, she will be able to ensure a good inheritance and a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to construct her house.

loans.name: Salustia

texts.en:
Salustia is a member of the Gratitud Village Bank. She is 42 years old and married with three children. Salustia is a teacher at a school near the Muyurina Valley, about 20 minutes outside of the city of Ayacucho in central Peru. She also sells Omnilife natural medicines and cosmetics from a catalog. She sells both products to her friends, family members, and colleagues.  

Salustia needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy natural remedies. Salustia’s dreams are to expand her businesses, to help her children get ahead, and to save for the future. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow 
 
Salustia es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud.
Salustia es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Salustia vende medicina natural por catálogos llamado Omnilife, también vende cosméticos por catálogos, ambos productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares y colegas. Además Salustia es docente en un colegio ubicado en la comunidad de Muyurina.
Salustia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicinas naturales.
Los sueños de Salustia son ampliar sus negocios, sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Buy Omnilife natural remedies

loans.name: Mawuli

texts.fr:
Madame A. Mawuli est née le 25 mai 1974 à Agoè, un quartier située au nord de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle est célibataire et mère d’un (1) enfant.  Elle a pour activité la vente de charbons de bois et de céréales dans son quartier. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1996, donc elle connait bien ce commerce.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 20 sacs de charbons, 7 sacs de haricots, et 2 sacs de maïs afin de reconstituer son stock et de pouvoir bien vendre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mawuli A. was born on May 25, 1974 in Agoè, a neighborhood located north of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is single and the mother of one child. Her business is selling charcoal and cereals in her neighborhood. She began the business in 1996, so she is well versed in it.

This initial loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 20 sacks of charcoal, 7 sacks of beans, and 2 sacks of corn (maize) so that she can build up her stock and make a lot of sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals and charcoal

loans.name: Rosmery Yanet

texts.en:
Rosmery is a member of the Qory Qaytu (“Thread of Gold” in Quechua) Village Bank. Rosmery is 25 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their son. Rosmery has a stand at the local fish market in Ayacucho, where she sells fish and shellfish from Lima on Saturdays and Sundays. 

Rosmery needs a loan of 900 soles to buy fish and shellfish. Rosmery’s dreams are to build her own home, to expand her business, and to sell wholesale. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow 
 
Rosmery es socia del Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu que significa Hilo de Oro en quechua.
Rosmery es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Rosmery tiene un puesto en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende pescados, mariscos, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, los productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Rosmery necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescados y mariscos.
Los sueños de Rosmery son construir su casa, ampliar su negocio y ser mayorista.

loans.use: Buy fish and shellfish from Lima

loans.name: Egya

texts.en:
Egya E. is married and has three children. He attended school through senior high school.

Egya sells and repairs electrical equipment in Nyanta, near Elmina. He has been in this business since 2000. His wife is a trader.

Egya uses his income to pay for his children's school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Egya will use this loan to purchase more electrical parts for his repair works. With the new profits from his expanded business, Egya plans to reinvest back into his business. This will allow him to increase his income so he can give quality education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical parts for his repair works

loans.name: Esbelta Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Esbelta del Socorro Gonzáles tiene la edad de 48 años habita en el barrio los Madrigales Norte, junto a su pequeña hija de seis añitos , ella es madre soltera se desempeña como domestica en una casa particular desde hace 14 años esta trabajando, la mayor dificultad que ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento para poder terminar de construir su casa .Ella quiere comprar zinc para cambiar todo el techo de la casa ya que en el invierno se pasa todo el agua y le ha dañado algunas de sus electrodoméstico que con mucho esfuerzos ha adquirido. Alargo plazo es  tener salud, para poder terminar de hacer su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esbelta del Socorro G. is 48 years old and lives in the Madrigales Norte neighborhood with her seven year old daughter. She is a single mother and has worked as a housekeeper in a private home for the past 14 years. The biggest difficulty she has had is the lack of financing needed to finish construction of her house. She wants to buy zinc to replace the entire roof of the house because during the winter months water gets in and has damaged some of her electrical appliances that took her a lot of effort to acquire. She wishes for continued health to be able to finish construction of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to repair a roof

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the Gratitud Village Bank. She is 36 years old and is a single mother to three children. Marcelina has a store in a rented space near the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells dry goods, grains and drinks. Marcelina also sells prepared meals in the same location, for which she has an assistant.

Marcelina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy sugar, rice and oil. Marcelina’s dreams are to provide her children with a good education, to save money to expand her business, and to give her customers good service. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow 
 
Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud.  

Marcelina es madre soltera, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Marcelina tiene una tienda en un local alquilado que se ubica cerca al mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende abarrotes, cereales, gaseosas. Además Marcelina vende comida en el mismo local, para lo cual cuenta con una ayudante.  

Marcelina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite.  

Los sueños de Marcelina son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, ahorrar para ampliar su negocio y dar servicio de calidad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice and oil
